story:
Today we are gearing up to take #StopRapeEducate around the world and back! In July 2015 we fundraised $926 but missed our goal of $5000 by a long shot. We still need to reach our goal to make this happen and save the lives of people who need to hear this message. 

World Tour Dates

Air, train, and/or bus transportation to the following cities: 
2015 Tour

  • 10/4- NYC
  • 10/13- London, England*
  • 10/21- York, England
  • 10/27- Barcelona, Spain*
  • 10/30- Madrid, Spain*
  • 11/4- Capetown, South Africa*
  • 11/15- Johannesburg, South Africa
  • 11/25- Melbourne, Australia*
  • 12/1- Sydney, Australia
  • 12/10- Los Angeles, California
2016 Tour
  • 1/10- Bogota, Colombia
  • 1/20- Lima, Peru 
  • 1/30- Cusco, Peru
  • 2/5- Arequipe, Peru

The total travel fare: $3000

Low-cost accommodation: $600

Other (art supplies, airport transfer, public transportation, visa fees): $400
(* indicates tickets purchased)

Our Legacy

We've been busy! In less than a year #StopRapeEducate has made a strong impact and here are just a few ways:

  • Completed over 300 art pieces about rape culture in NYC 
  • Provided free counseling to survivors
  • Received recognition from President Barack Obama 
  • Spread our message at historical colleges & sites like Yale, Columbia, NYU, Brooklyn College, Spelman, Morehouse, and the U.S. Supreme Court!
  • Implemented educational curriculum in schools to create a culture of consent
  • Helped survivors return to college after their assault
  • Inspired thousands around the world! We've gotten support from Indonesia, Germany, Australia, Canada, South Africa, Norway, Belgium, Spain, Sweden, Lebanon, and the list goes on....

Don't Forget...

Every donation matters! Ask your friends, family, community organizations, and place of worship to contribute! $1 buys a bus ticket and $100 buys a plane ticket. It all helps and it all adds up!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, you can still help! Here are a few ways:

  • Share our campaign with your networks
  • Follow us on social media to stay updated
  • Send us positive vibes during this journey


Video Shot by Justin Muñoz. Starring Amber Amour, Lauren Moses, Nina La Voix, Arashi-D, and TJ James. Music by Belles of Holly.

story:
Shamanic Retreat and Craft Centre

Firstly and foremost we will be making the space available to all to use for their own groups / courses.
We have managed to raise 4280 Euro through donations at our little Holistic and Spiritual centre in Galway - A huge thank you and blessings to all those who have donated. 

Myself and Niamh would like to use the space to open a non-profit Earth based (Shamanic) Retreat, Healing and Craft Centre. The ethos on the centre is to help people reconnect with the natural world in both a physical and spiritual way. We would like to achieve this through teaching all age groups about the environment, conservation, yoga, vegetarian cooking, ayurveda workshops, meditation, Tai Chi, this is  naming just a few of the things we would like to do. We would also like to run regular workshops and retreats of varying length and subject matter where we would not only teach people the things outlined about but also various various earth based crafts such as drum making.

The centre is incredibly important as it will offer everyone the chance to reconnect to themselves, the environment through activities, meditation and  earth based "back to basics" retreats.

The centre and space will also be available to be used by other groups for classes / workshops, retreats and the local community.

Contributors will be helping us to establish a truly unique centre in the West of Ireland that will be available for all to use.. I have spoken to numerous friends about the project and we have already been pledged 4000 Euro towards the centre. 

Myself and Niamh are buying the land we just really need help getting the other bits and pieces, such as renovation, tools, access etc. 

What We Need & What You Get

We would like to raise 50,000 euro to establish the centre. This will include renovating the property and purchasing  the basics (Yurts) to start the centre. Myself and Niamh have found the property that we would like to buy and we are in the process of getting a mortage, the link is (http://www.daft.ie/sales/turlough-rosmuc-galway...). 

There are several perks that I would like to offer. 

100 Euro Contribution - For everyone who contributes 100 euro we will personally make and gift a rawhide shamanic rattle.

150 Euro Contribution - An invitation to a Shamanic Rattle workshop.

300 Euro Contribution - We will make and gift a Shamanic Drum.

1000 Euro Contribution - An invitation to attend a  weekend retreat at the Centre



Risks & Challenges

The real challenge will be to find the right parcel of land. But, we are putting our faith in the fact that the right piece of land will  come about.

Update - we have found a nice site of just over three acres on the coast in Connemara...... yay.

Other Ways You Can Help

When we have the parcel of land people can help by donating their time and skills to help establish the centre.
Please share this campaign.

story:
Short Summary

Here at the Addiction Prevention Coalition, we work year round with high school students to try to positively impact drug culture at local high schools. This is done through student chapters at various high schools in Central Alabama. For more information about our high school chapters, you can watch this video: 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RuZzsRLvcZI&list=UUXVlZDK47doIWm3O0sEQ3yQ&index=18.

We are raising money for our leadership retreat at the end of the summer. This is a two day retreat that consists of students participating in team building exercises, students planning events that will happen during the school year, and students connecting to the leader within themselves. The students will be placed in various workshops in communication, marketing, leadership, and influence where they will critically evaluate the current culture and their stance on creating a positive and supportive community for youth. This retreat is a kickstart for these youth as they are about to start the next school year drug free.

What We Need & What You Get

What we need is obvious - your support! We need $10,000 to fund this two day retreat for all of the students and volunteers. We have to pay for food, transportation, lodging, and leadership trainers for all of these students, and as you can see, that adds up! 

We are giving out some fun perks for those of you who partner with us in developing Courageous Leaders. For $25, you will get a shout-out on our website thanking you for supporting our students. For $50, you will be on our website and have the opportunity to come to our office, meet the staff, and pick up a #APCCODERED tshirt (if you are from outside the Central Alabama area, we can mail you the tshirt). For $100, you will be on our website, get to come to the office and meet our staff, and get a #APCCODERED tshirt, wristband, pen, chip clip and cup (if you are from outside the Central Alabama area, we can mail you these rewards). 

If we don't reach our goal, we will use whatever we have raised to decrease the cost per student to attend. So please partner with us to make this retreat happen!

Other Ways You Can Help

SHARE THIS WITH YOUR FRIENDS AND FAMILY!!! We can use all the help we can get! You can share this link on your social media platforms like Facebook, instagram, and twitter to start.

We thank you for your generosity!

story:
Short Summary

Who lives in your city? Do you know your neighbors? Roughly one in ten people in the Twin Cities was born in another country. We are home to the largest Somali and Hmong populations in the United States. Amidst community mistrust and social inequality, we say it's time to flip the study abroad model of cross-cultural education on its head and take a trip into our own backyards.

City Stay is a small 501(c)(3) non-profit with the mission to provide experiential education that breaks down barriers and sparks unlikely connections between the diverse cultural communities of the Twin Cities. We bring the concept of study abroad to the local level by allowing Minnesotans of all colors and creeds to live with a new Minnesotan family from a different culture. Participants can continue building on their cross-cultural relationships and their language skills after the program ends. More broadly, the relationships City Stay facilitates reduce community mistrust and social inequality in Minnesota.

What We Need & What You Get

This year marks a turning point for City Stay. We have established a track record of transformative programs over the past three years, but we lack the funds to expand the scope of our work. The goal of our fundraiser is to take City Stay from a part-time, project-based effort to a sustainable, long-term organization. Your donation is needed to help us increase the impact of our groundbreaking cross-community work. 

Student tuition for our program is $875. This prices is prohibitive for many students and does not even cover all of our expenses. By providing a partial or full student scholarship, you enable us to use our current savings to rent an office space, offer part-time salaries to skilled leaders in the field, and advertise to new student and family populations.

The Impact

This year, we ran our first cohort homestay program. Minnesotan high school students of diverse backgrounds lived with Somali and Hmong host families in two of Minnesota’s largest immigrant communities for one week. After the program, student Eli Aronson wrote, "[City Stay] opened me up to new cultures like never before. I was outside my comfort zone for nearly the whole time, and it introduced me to new ways of life. I'm so glad I participated in City Stay.” To learn more about Eli’s City Stay experience and meet his Somali host family, watch our one-minute video above.
Every penny of your tax-exempt donation provides the foundation for relationships that foster intercultural understanding in an increasingly diverse world. Your donation will help us achieve the following impacts on our community:
  • Foster meaningful and lasting relationships between people of diverse backgrounds
  • Prepare the next generation to live and lead in a multi-cultural world
  • Share the cultural richness of the newest Minnesotans with a wide audience
  • Reduce community mistrust and social inequality by facilitating dialogue, study, and action
We truly believe in the power of getting to know your neighbors. Please help us reach more students and families with a generous donation.

Risks & Challenges

To reach our goal of being a sustainable, long-term non-profit, we need ongoing funding, not just a one-time campaign. However, the money from this fundraiser will give us the support and resources we need to pursue larger grants for the future. At this point, all of our energy is devoted to programming. The funding from this campaign will allow us the freedom and flexibility to devote some of our time and resources to pursuing competitive grants.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • "Like" us on Facebook.
  • Share about our campaign with friends, family, or on social media.
  • Encourage students, teachers, and families to get involved with our program.
Thank you for your support of our campaign! Gracias! Ua tsaug! Mahadsanid!

story:
Help Fund the travel book 'Nepal Before the Crisis' and/or support my completion of the Budapest Marathon, in aid of two worthwhile charities, both of whom are working hard to save lives in Nepal.


I am Duncan Lanser, writer of the travel book ‘North to Lalibela: Searching for Ethiopia,’ recently published in paperback and as an eBook, and available here:


http://www.amazon.co.uk/North-Lalibela-Searchin...


Nepal and its people are close to my heart, having spent five weeks in the country in April/May last year. I spent time in the capital, Kathmandu, before embarking on a trek along the old trailhead, used by the early explorers, from Jiri to the Everest region, which took 25 days and involved several high passes and peaks of over 5,000 metres above sea level. It was a challenging, enlightening, and remarkable experience.


However, on 25 April 2015, a massive earthquake struck Nepal, leaving over 8,000 dead, around 18,000 injured, and at least 500,000 people homeless. A number of damaging aftershocks followed, before a second quake then rocked the country on 12 May 2015.


People in Nepal are suffering. It is now thought that the number of displaced people across the country is around 3 million. Aftershocks are occurring every day, causing further damage to cracked and already dangerous buildings. Survivors need clean water, food, sanitation, and medical supplies. Not to mention psychological support. In addition, many homes and buildings providing vital services, like schools and hospitals, have been destroyed and must be rebuilt.


This project aims to raise as much money as possible to support the relief effort in Nepal. I am writing about my experience there last year and, with your help and support, my second travel book, ‘Nepal Before the Crisis,’ will be ready in around 3 months' time.

In addition, on 11 October this year, I will run the Budapest Marathon - 26.2 miles of grit, determination, and pain, all for the same cause. I ran the London Marathon in 2012 and have thus already encountered the extreme difficulty of going beyond ‘the wall!’


All profits from this project will go to support the relief efforts of two charities - Unicef and The Britain-Nepal Medical Trust - both of whom are already ‘in on the ground’ in Nepal and engaged in saving lives.


WHAT IMPACT WILL YOUR HELP HAVE?


The monsoon season is here and could wreak havoc on Nepal's fragile recovery.


The monsoon season has arrived in Nepal. Food is scarce and clean water supplies are running out. The monsoon brings flooding and landslides and therefore an increased risk of waterborne disease, damage to property, and further loss of life.


Half a million people in the Kathmandu valley alone are living in makeshift camps - simple tents or basic, unstable structures with tarpaulin roofs. The number now homeless across Nepal is thought to be over 3 million. 


Your money will help to provide clean water, food, sanitation and medical supplies, and to help rebuild homes and other vital structures devastated by the earthquakes.


This project will help to fund two different organisations:


1. Unicef - a large international charity that is operating in Nepal and significantly  involved in the relief effort, with a particular focus on the needs of children. The charity has thus far provided clean water for 300,000 people, temporary toilet facilities for 65,000 people, and reached 800,000 children with a vital, pre-monsoon vitamin A supplement and deworming campaign; and


2.  The Britain-Nepal Medical Trust - a charity established in 1967 in the UK, and also registered in the U.S, which has a long history in Nepal and is already involved in helping people in the mountainous areas hardest hit by the earthquakes, but which are difficult for large international charities to reach.


Your contribution will help to save lives.


WHAT DO WE NEED AND WHAT WILL YOU RECEIVE?

You can contribute to this campaign in the following ways:

1. Help fund the writing and publication of my travel book, 'Nepal Before the Crisis' and receive a copy of the book, which will be ready within 3 months of us reaching the funding target; or


2. Contribute to my Budapest Marathon effort and receive a personal thank you from me by post; or


3. Support both the writing of ‘Nepal Before the Crisis’ and my Marathon effort; or


4. Support the writing of 'Nepal Before the Crisis,' and my Marathon effort, and purchase my existing travel book, 'North to Lalibela: Searching for Ethiopia;' or


4. Make a donation of £5 and receive a personal thank you from me; or


5. Make a donation of an amount you can afford, however large or small.


There will be campaign and production costs, which may reach a maximum of 30% of the £10,000 target, but the remaining 70% will all go to charity. 


If we can raise in excess of £10,000, the campaign costs will be a smaller proportion of the overall funding and the percentage paid to the charities will increase.


'Nepal Before the Crisis' will take approximately 3 months to complete and will be a standard paperback/eBook of around 200 pages. UK contributors will receive a paperback copy and international contributors an eBook. High postage costs make it uneconomical to send paperbacks overseas. 


Although the book will take 3 months to complete, once the funding target has been reached, the monies going to the two charities will be paid immediately, in order that the funds can be quickly utilised to help the relief effort. The money is needed now, on an urgent basis. The provision of basic needs, prevention of disease, and efforts to rebuild and rehouse are all now critical.


Just a few days ago (on 11 June 2015), a landslide triggered by heavy rainfall buried six villages in Nepal's mountainous north east, about 310 miles east of Kathmandu, and it is thought that 15 people have been killed. Given the remoteness of the area, the nearest town is 5 hours away on foot, provided the weather is good.


Check-out our Perks to see how you can help and what you get in return for your support.

 

WHAT ARE THE CHALLENGES?


There is a risk that we may not hit the funding target, that we do not spread the word well enough or capture the imagination of the wonderful world of Crowdfunders.


It is a risk worth taking because the goal is important and we can really contribute to improve the current desperate situation in Nepal. We must take action.


Even if the funding target is not reached, I will remain committed to producing the book, running the Marathon, and providing as significant a contribution as possible to our two chosen charities.


In order to ensure we reach the target, I have assembled a team known for their tireless organisation, efficiency, and passion for worthwhile causes. I am confident that my team will spread the word across their networks and bring in the loot!


Producing the book in 3 months is a massive challenge but I believe that, having been through the process before, in producing ‘North to Lalibela,’I have the know-how and the experience to strain every sinew towards the completion of 'Nepal Before the Crisis.' The book is well under way but needs a lot of writing, redrafting and editing before completion. This project and the funds raised will give me huge motivation to undertake that necessary further work.


The other challenge is the small matter of my completion of the Budapest Marathon on 11 October! Having run the London Marathon in 4 hours and 32 minutes in 2012, I am confident that I know what it takes to endure the pain, particularly of the last 5 miles, and to succeed. I suffered a hamstring injury in training in advance of the London Marathon and that affected my preparation for the event. The injury has remained with me and, in addition to being 3 years older, I also have cracked heels (from trekking in Nepal!), a generally very tight left side, and a problematic lower back!  


Nevertheless, with careful training, lots of foam-rolling, and your help and support, I aim to smash my time of 2012 and go under 4 hours in 2015!


OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP


There are various ways in which you can fund this project. However, we understand if you are unable to make a donation and would still appreciate your help and support.  If you believe in the project, we would be very grateful if you could help to spread the word, using any of the social media platforms on this page or any methods you would like to use.


Please join, donate to, or support the project and help us to rebuild Nepal. Every purchase or donation counts and any amount you can offer will be deeply appreciated. Your generosity will go a long way towards saving Nepali lives and restoring this beautiful country to its former splendour.

The number now homeless across Nepal is thought to be over 3 million. Your money will help to provide clean water, food, sanitation and medical supplies, and to help rebuild homes and other vital structures devastated by the earthquakes.This project will help to fund two different organisations:1. Unicef - a large international charity that is operating in Nepal and significantly  involved in the relief effort, with a particular focus on the needs of children. The charity has thus far provided clean water for 300,000 people, temporary toilet facilities for 65,000 people, and reached 800,000 children with a vital, pre-monsoon vitamin A supplement and deworming campaign; and2.  The Britain-Nepal Medical Trust - a charity established in 1967 in the UK, and also registered in the U.S, which has a long history in Nepal and is already involved in helping people in the mountainous areas hardest hit by the earthquakes, but which are difficult for large international charities to reach.Your contribution will help to save lives.WHAT DO WE NEED AND WHAT WILL YOU RECEIVE?You can contribute to this campaign in the following ways:1. Help fund the writing and publication of my travel book, 'Nepal Before the Crisis' and receive a copy of the book, which will be ready within 3 months of us reaching the funding target; or2. Contribute to my Budapest Marathon effort and receive a personal thank you from me by post; or3. Support both the writing of ‘Nepal Before the Crisis’ and my Marathon effort; or4. Support the writing of 'Nepal Before the Crisis,' and my Marathon effort, and purchase my existing travel book, 'North to Lalibela: Searching for Ethiopia;' or4. Make a donation of £5 and receive a personal thank you from me; or5. Make a donation of an amount you can afford, however large or small.There will be campaign and production costs, which may reach a maximum of 30% of the £10,000 target, but the remaining 70% will all go to charity. If we can raise in excess of £10,000, the campaign costs will be a smaller proportion of the overall funding and the percentage paid to the charities will increase. 'Nepal Before the Crisis' will take approximately 3 months to complete and will be a standard paperback/eBook of around 200 pages. UK contributors will receive a paperback copy and international contributors an eBook. High postage costs make it uneconomical to send paperbacks overseas. Although the book will take 3 months to complete, once the funding target has been reached, the monies going to the two charities will be paid immediately, in order that the funds can be quickly utilised to help the relief effort. The money is needed now, on an urgent basis. The provision of basic needs, prevention of disease, and efforts to rebuild and rehouse are all now critical.Just a few days ago (on 11 June 2015), a landslide triggered by heavy rainfall buried six villages in Nepal's mountainous north east, about 310 miles east of Kathmandu, and it is thought that 15 people have been killed. Given the remoteness of the area, the nearest town is 5 hours away on foot, provided the weather is good. Check-out our Perks to see how you can help and what you get in return for your support.  WHAT ARE THE CHALLENGES?There is a risk that we may not hit the funding target, that we do not spread the word well enough or capture the imagination of the wonderful world of Crowdfunders. It is a risk worth taking because the goal is important and we can really contribute to improve the current desperate situation in Nepal. We must take action. Even if the funding target is not reached, I will remain committed to producing the book, running the Marathon, and providing as significant a contribution as possible to our two chosen charities.In order to ensure we reach the target, I have assembled a team known for their tireless organisation, efficiency, and passion for worthwhile causes. I am confident that my team will spread the word across their networks and bring in the loot! Producing the book in 3 months is a massive challenge but I believe that, having been through the process before, in producing ‘North to Lalibela,’I have the know-how and the experience to strain every sinew towards the completion of 'Nepal Before the Crisis.' The book is well under way but needs a lot of writing, redrafting and editing before completion. This project and the funds raised will give me huge motivation to undertake that necessary further work.The other challenge is the small matter of my completion of the Budapest Marathon on 11 October! Having run the London Marathon in 4 hours and 32 minutes in 2012, I am confident that I know what it takes to endure the pain, particularly of the last 5 miles, and to succeed. I suffered a hamstring injury in training in advance of the London Marathon and that affected my preparation for the event. The injury has remained with me and, in addition to being 3 years older, I also have cracked heels (from trekking in Nepal!), a generally very tight left side, and a problematic lower back!  Nevertheless, with careful training, lots of foam-rolling, and your help and support, I aim to smash my time of 2012 and go under 4 hours in 2015!OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELPThere are various ways in which you can fund this project. However, we understand if you are unable to make a donation and would still appreciate your help and support.  If you believe in the project, we would be very grateful if you could help to spread the word, using any of the social media platforms on this page or any methods you would like to use.Please join, donate to, or support the project and help us to rebuild Nepal. Every purchase or donation counts and any amount you can offer will be deeply appreciated. Your generosity will go a long way towards saving Nepali lives and restoring this beautiful country to its former splendour.

story:
Breve reseña

The Volunteer Fire Department of Guatemala , is the largest service institution and with more credibility, respect and admiration of the Guatemalan population. With more than five thousand firefighters provides service to 14 million people and a budget that covers 50 % of needs . 26 Volunteer Fire Department of Guatemala will travel first to the Fire Training Expo Conference to be held in Fort Lauderdale , Florida , USA , paying them out of pocket all ( Airline tickets, food, accommodation , internal transport expenses and the cost to participate in all training ) . During training these firefighters update their skills in firefighting , search and rescue people in burning structures , develop survival skills in fire skills to perform rescues in collapsed structures ( after an earthquake) , different types of ventilation required fire etc.
El Cuerpo Voluntario de Bomberos de Guatemala, es la institución de servicio más grande y con más credibilidad, respeto y admiración ante la población guatemalteca. Con más de cinco mil bomberos presta su servicio a los 14 millones de personas y con un presupuesto que cubre el 50% de las necesidades. 26 Voluntarios del Cuerpo de Bomberos de Guatemala viajarán por primera vez a la Fire Expo Training Conference a realizarse en Fort Lauderdale, Florida, USA, pagando ellos de su propio bolsillo todos sus gastos (Pasajes aéreos, alimentación, hospedaje, transporte interno y el costo de participar en todo el entrenamiento) .Durante el entrenamiento estos bomberos actualizaran sus técnicas en combate de incendios, búsqueda y rescate de personas en estructuras en llamas, desarrollarán técnicas de sobrevivencia en incendios, destrezas para realizar rescates en estructuras colapsadas (posterior a un terremoto), diferentes tipos de ventilación que requiere un incendio, etc. 

 

US$15,000

Presenta más detalles:

It takes $ 15,000 to help defray these costs as all the expenses out of their pockets and budget of this trip is equivalent to three months salary of many who participate . Fire Training Conference Expo is one of the greatest opportunities to learn from world-renowned instructors who will transmit their knowledge , in the end who is assisted is the population . All funds raised will be used to:
1. SCBA rent 
2. Vehicles rent
3. Gas
4. Accommodation in hotel
5. Dinner (are not included in the training)
Nuestra meta es de  $15,000 para poder ayudar a sufragar estos gastos ya que todos los gastos salen de sus bolsillos y el presupuesto de este viaje equivale al salario de 3 meses de muchos quienes participaran. 
Fire Expo Training Conference, es una de las oportunidades más grandes de poder aprender de instructores de renombre mundial que estarán transmitiendo sus conocimientos, al final quien recibe la ayuda es la población. 
Todos los fondos que se recauden serán utilizados para:
1. Alquiler de Equipos Autónomos de Respiración 
2. Alquiler de vehículos 
3. Gasolina
4. Alojamiento en hotel
5. La cena (no está incluida en el entrenamiento)

El impacto

Currently firefighters are committed to save lives , protect property of the people and protect the environment. In the last year we lost two firefighters in action and one who was amputated leg, we can not let this keep happening to help
Actualmente los bomberos estamos comprometidos a salvar vidas, proteger las propiedades de las personas y a proteger el medio ambiente. En el ultimo año perdimos a dos bomberos en acción y uno más a quien le fue amputada una pierna, no podemos permitir que esto siga pasando a quienes ayudan 

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

If you are in the availability of help you can do so by sending your donation and sharing this information with your contacts so they also contribute and share it . Use tool Indiegogo share .
Si usted esta en la disponibilidad de ayudarnos puede hacerlo enviando su donativo y compartiendo esta información con sus contactos para que ellos también aporten y también lo compartan.Utiliza la herramienta compartir de Indiegogo.
More information
Más información en
http://fortlauderdalefireexpo.com/index.cfm?Section=1

Thank You

Gracias

story:
Hi, my name is Filip Leskaroski. I am from Serbia, a small country in the Balkans.

Now, I have a chance to make my dreams come true and your help will probably be crucial to achieve them.

What is the goal of crowdfunding?

The goal of this campaign is to continue my studies abroad in one of the fields of greatest challenges that my country and the region will face in the coming decades. In January 2015, I planned and applied for what I see as a dream come true – continuing my studies abroad, which is something that I have desired since my high school days. In mid-June I received a chance to materialize that desire – the invitation for Master's in European Studies and Economy at the Comenius University in Bratislava! Scholarship that I have acquired covers 100% of the tuition, leaving only the greatest problem which every student faces during his or her time abroad – high costs of living.

The average monthly wage in Serbia is below $400 and this fact makes paying study materials, accommodation, books and food during my studies impossible.

Comenius University estimates that my living expenses for two years – including accommodation, books and study materials, will be about $10.000. My crowdfunding goal is a third part of this amount because my plan is to cover the other part with additional job available for the students in Bratislava in the very beginning of my studies.


Who am I professionally?

I hold a BA in Journalism and Communication from the Faculty of Political Science at the University of Belgrade. After completing my undergraduate studies I volunteered as a Teaching Assistant at subjects taught by prof dr Dobrivoje Stanojevic – Rhetoric and Stylistics. During my studies I was also a Trainee Teaching Assistant at History of Political Theory I and II.

My out-of-academia experience was acquired in the media, PR and digital marketing. In my first year of studies I volunteered at the „Pančevac“ weekly, having in mind the importance of extracurricular activities. In the following years, I had the opportunity to gain additional practice at companies iBike Belgrade, Executive Group and NIS. Most significantly, I worked at NGO BIRN (Balkan Investigative Reporting Network) that does investigative reporting.

I am especially proud of winning the second place in oratory competition „Besede u Zoranovu čast“ (Sermons in Zoran’s honor) in 2010 and winning the prize „dr Zoran Djindjic“ for achievement of the year, awarded to individuals for outstanding contribution to promotion of the City of Pančevo.

About Serbia, my country, and future plans

Situation in Serbia is complicated and my ambition is to restore hope to the people in Serbia through a success in this campaign and a prove that everything is possible, as well as to motivate new, young people who will be different from everything that Serbia has been facing for years. Hope we will reach this tough goal together.

For more information about paying, do not hesitate to contact me via email f.leskaroski@gmail.com

story:
Background:

I have been a volunteer at orphanages for more than 5 years. Seeing how orphanages crave for donations and kids live in such limited conditions, motivated us to find a solution to solve it once for all. We came out with a model where the orphanage can be self sufficient on its operational expenses from year 3 onwards. We are searching for funding for initial land down payment.  Once we have access to the land, we can get volunteers to help us with building the infrastructure and food production so we can take care of the kids.

Last week, one of the orphanages I use to volunteer at, was closed and 25+ kids are in need of a place to go.

If you could help us with a small amount, what you spend on a hamburger or dinning out, and we get enough hands helping us, we will be able to place the land down payment to start this beautiful project.


Project Overview:

We intend to build a financially self-sufficient Sustainable Orphanage with state of the art education system. The objective is to reach autonomy in our operational expenses by implementing an Orphanage in a rural area where we can provide food, shelter, education, legal assistance and health services to abandoned / orphan children from urban areas in the state of Chiapas, Mexico.

By focusing in improving their self-esteem and healing of the past, leadership, team-work, social and work skills, we aim not only to be an assistencialist organization focused to keep children safe while they reach adulthood, but committing to their success with clear objectives and measures following up after they leave the orphanage.

Sustainability is a pillar for our organization. By establishing it on a rural natural environment, growing our own food, sustainable construction techniques, solar water heating, electricity generation, caring for the water and the pollution foot print with state of the art sustainable methodologies, our graduates will become sustainable educators and lead by example, transforming the society they live in.

Taking advantage of the Australian organic food production technique known as Permaculture will provide food for the children. Since we will own the land, there is no rent to pay. Services (internet, transport) and salaries will be covered with the product of selling the surplus of the food production and trough the income from sustainability workshops to urban and rural organizations. Receiving international volunteers will help us to teach languages and diverse skills to the kids.

The founder and director of this initiative worked seven years for Procter & Gamble as a senior manager in 4 different departments such as operations, maintenance, project management, and logistics. He was respected as a problem solver, team builder and handled budgets of over 3 million per project. This experience gave him the enterprise management skills, market defined result-driven approach, with the goal to become “best in class trough innovation” that will be applied to the newly build organization Casa Hogar Sustentable. The director was awarded one of the 20 entrepreneurs of the future by Young Entrepreneurs Organization (YEO), Endeavour and ITESM Mexico.

 

The problem we solve:

1) Abandoned Children

Mexico government ignores the problem of abandoned children, refusing to have an accurate count of total orphans/abandoned. According to the International Children foundation an estimate of 2 million children were left by their parents and are invisible to the government. Many are recruited by criminal organizations, other are captured by human trafficker and put to work on subhuman conditions and/or prostitution. The underground traffic or organ black market also takes advantage of the young and abandoned. 

2) Education

The formal public education in Mexico is very poor. Abandoned/orphans children have no education at all. (Sexual education) abandon kids have 20 times higher percentage of STDs than national average creating a risk of infection for the rest of society. HIV and Hepatitis C are rampant in this demographics as well as pregnancy at a young age. Most of the cases could be avoided by awareness and simple prevention methods saving the government hundred thousands of dollars by preventing the spread of this viruses to the rest of the society. Another big problem is not enough jobs to qualified high school graduates and that is why the entrepreneur emphasis is so important.

3) Lack of funding for orphanages

Donations to orphanages in Mexico are limited. Since there are not enough donations to existing orphanages, no new orphanages are opened, leaving 98% of the abandoned/orphan children without support. We want to fix this problem by implementing a self-sufficient model where all the surplus of the organic farm, livestock will be used to support the orphanage and school activities. We will also provide workshops for urban or rural organizations interested in sustainability as an additional source of income. The land is surrounded by a virgin jungle and a river which provides opportunity for ecotourism. Allowing us to operate without the need of additional donations after the 3rd year.

 

How will the project help vulnerable children succeed?

The Sustainable Orphanage NGO will provide food, accommodation, legal and physiologic assistance and leading edge education. Our success indicator is to reach 100 percent of employability, and provide the sustainability education necessary to students to become agents of change on the community they choose to live at their adulthood.

We will implement a revolutionary education system based on active learning from European models and the distant learning system from New Zealand. We will put special emphasis on entrepreneurship, aligned with conventional education. It will give a strong foundation for those who are self-made as well as who wants to pursue a career working as employee. Our school will have subjects such as sexual education to prevent STD spreading and early pregnancy. We plan to have an information technology center with high speed internet to keep them connected and to provide a technical certification through an online university partnership, as well as English as a second language.

In addition to attending school, children will be invited to participate in different roles that sustain the village. In this way, they will be able to choose from a diverse range of activities like the veggie garden, farm animals, pets, fruit trees, industrialization of farm products, carpentry, plumber, electrician, electronics, solar heaters, chef, interior decorator, teacher, etc. Later on, they will gain entrepreneurship skills like marketing, sales, administration, leadership, etc. By shadowing and training with adults learning valuable skills, they will gain the tools to help them define and reach their own goals.

In our experience, there are two other areas important to boost the potential of the kids. Performance arts like theater, singing, dancing, etc. and sports in nature like hiking, camping, swimming in the lake, mountain bike, fruit tree climbing, etc. Due to the location of the orphanage being in direct contact with nature, they have easy access to this options without generating a significant expense for the organization. The implementation of summer camps for city kids in nature, will help them build relationships with city kids.

Healthy kids:

Kids will be systematically monitored to ensure their physical (size and weight), mental and emotional health. Their nutrition will be organically produced fruit, vegetables and animal protein ensuring they do not suffer from neither mal-nutrition nor obesity. The kids will learn how to identify healthy vs non-healthy food and how to balance the meals to meet their nutrition needs.

A graphical IT app will be implemented to receive feedback from kids. This information will be a key input for our Continuous Improvement program.

 

Project outcomes:

1. New education model based on active learning for children from the age of 2. An investigation center to document new techniques and methodologies which will boost children’s natural skills to reach their full potential.

2. A new model where the orphanage can generate enough resources to cover for its own expenses.

3. Open an opportunity for financially struggling orphanages to reapply our model and become financially self-sufficient. 

4. Taking advantage of the sustainability systems at work in the orphanage, a Sustainability Training Center will offer workshops to surrounding communities and urban organizations. They will be able to see our sustainability systems at work and reapply whatever is useful for them. This will have a double purpose: teach the children on Sustainability and as a source of income to cover for Orphanage operational expenses and future needs.

5. Develop Online methodologies to systematize and streamline the operation of an orphanage so other orphanages can take advantage of them.

6. Reach financial self-sufficiency by year 3.

and the distant learning system from New Zealand. We will put special emphasis
on entrepreneurship, aligned with conventional education. It will give a strong
foundation for those who are self-made as well as who wants to pursue a career
working as employee. Our school will have subjects such as sexual education to
prevent STD spreading and early pregnancy. We plan to have
an information technology center with high speed internet to keep them
connected and to provide a technical certification through an online university
partnership, as well as English as a second language. 
In addition to attending
school, children will be invited to participate in different roles that sustain
the village. In this way, they will be able to choose from a diverse range of
activities like the veggie garden, farm animals, pets, fruit trees,
industrialization of farm products, carpentry, plumber, electrician,
electronics, solar heaters, chef, interior decorator, teacher, etc. Later on,
they will gain entrepreneurship skills like marketing, sales, administration,
leadership, etc. By shadowing and training with adults learning valuable
skills, they will gain the tools to help them define and reach their own goals.

In our experience, there
are two other areas important to boost the potential of the kids. Performance
arts like theater, singing, dancing, etc. and sports in nature like hiking,
camping, swimming in the lake, mountain bike, fruit tree climbing, etc. Due
to the location of the orphanage being in direct contact with nature, they have
easy access to this options without generating a significant expense for the
organization. The implementation of summer camps for city kids in nature, will
help them build relationships with city kids.
Healthy kids: 
Kids will be systematically
monitored to ensure their physical (size and weight), mental and emotional
health. Their nutrition will be organically produced fruit, vegetables and
animal protein ensuring they do not suffer from neither mal-nutrition nor
obesity. The kids will learn how to identify healthy vs non-healthy food and
how to balance the meals to meet their nutrition needs.
A graphical IT app will be
implemented to receive feedback from kids. This information will be a key input
for our Continuous Improvement program.
  
Project outcomes: 
1. New education model
based on active learning for children from the age of 2. An
investigation center to document new techniques and methodologies which will
boost children’s natural skills to reach their full potential.
2. A new model where the
orphanage can generate enough resources to cover for its own expenses.
3. Open an opportunity for
financially struggling orphanages to reapply our model and become financially
self-sufficient. 
4. Taking advantage of the
sustainability systems at work in the orphanage, a Sustainability Training
Center will offer workshops to surrounding communities and urban organizations.
They will be able to see our sustainability systems at work and reapply
whatever is useful for them. This will have a double purpose: teach the
children on Sustainability and as a source of income to cover for Orphanage
operational expenses and future needs.
5. Develop Online
methodologies to systematize and streamline the operation of an orphanage so
other orphanages can take advantage of them.
6. Reach financial
self-sufficiency by year 3.

story:
Daniel Zongrone..............

......is a music performing artist and community educator with 30+ years of experience. He has traveled the United States and Europe to share his inspiration and love of learning with various performing artists and educators. This 60 day fundraising campaign is to raise awareness and financial support for the development of a Kindermusik International program in Spartanburg South Carolina. This campaign is important because it inspires a community effort to invest in the children of our community. An investment in ALL the children from ALL walks of life throughout the Spartanburg area. By contributing to this campaign, through time or money, your investment will be to the children of our community.

Children thrive on music. It’s one of the best vehicles for learning in early childhood development. The Kindermusik program takes learning to the next level; the curriculum is proven to improve a child’s brain development.  Psychologists, neuroscientists, and experts in early childhood development have demonstrated that this program does more for children than bring them joy; it helps their brain cells make the connections needed for every kind of intelligence. When young children are consistently engaged in an age-appropriate, socially accepting environment, they benefit at many levels: 

  • Reading. They gain the phonological processing, spoken language, and comprehension skills that are the foundation of reading.
  • Quantitative. They build the spatial-temporal and reasoning skills required for math, science, and engineering.
  • Social. They develop social and emotional skills that are essential for school readiness—like the ability to regulate their responses and relate to others in complex ways.
  • Physical. By moving and dancing to music and playing simple instruments, children improve their gross and fine motor skills.
  • Creative. Activities that encourage freedom within a fun and friendly structure spark their creativity.

The money contributions raised here will help sponsor children that are otherwise unable to attend this program because of financial limitations. With your contributions you will receive recognition, if requested, as a child sponsor along with a personal visit to the classroom and participate with your sponsored child in a scheduled class.  The impact this program can have on our community of children cannot be overstated! Each day we ignore the early development education of our children is another day of opportunity lost to create a brighter and more inspiring future here in Spartanburg and throughout the world. The risk of not investing in the children of our community brings social problems, lack of understanding and depression. This Early Childhood Education program reduces that risk significantly and creates a happy and healthy community for all to embrace.  


If you are unable to contribute please share

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

If you are unable to contribute, please MAKE SOME NOISE and spread the word to your family and friends that may be interested and share this page information through social media outlets and the Indiegogo share tools

Thank you for your interest. See you out in our community!!

story:
Exchanging Resources, Ideas and Friendship

CanJamEx.com

Students in Calgary, Alberta, Canada are actively adding to a conversation and digital files collection they started, and would like to expand that conversation to the world. Their next step is to make a connection with schools in Jamaica to offer access to their collection, in exchange for similar digital contributions from Jamaican students.
   

As part of that step, we are creating an app, a video report and a digital journal, of a trip to Jamaica to arrange for the exchange. They are intended as a how-to guide and inspiration for teachers and schools around the world to do the same.

At the core of the story is the digital collection of student and family-friendly content - available on the internet, but also available as a copy fitting on a Terabyte USB hard-drive. Copies can be shared equitably and distributed economically, right now, by physically transporting them to schools which do not have fast, reliable, affordable, or any internet connections.

We follow the story of the drives in areas where some limited number of computers are available, but internet connections are currently non-existent, slow or too expensive. We will be reporting on where we go, who we meet, what challenges we find, and how we get to the goal of making a real connection between students in different countries and cultures.

The collection will draw from at least three categories of content: copies of open source resources on the net; contributions from artists and musicians; and, student and teacher contributions.

Copies of open source information from the internet, such as a stand-alone copy of Wikipedia, can give some students access to these resources for the first time. Wikipedia and related resources fit easily into a fraction of a hard-drive.

Artists and musicians from Western Canada are contributing their talents in the hopes of collaborating with Jamaicans to create digital works. They are adding them as generous donations, but also for promotion, making connections and learning.

Perhaps most importantly, students can add their own contributions - of projects and assignments they are proud of and would like to share. USB hard-drives and cameras circulating to and from schools give some students their first opportunity to contribute to an international conversation.

Teacher Dovilio Binotto has started work with his students in Calgary, Canada. He will travel to Jamaica with hard-drives and cameras to find schools to participate, meet with teachers, students, church and community leaders, and get the digital exchange started.

App developer, tech consultant and former teacher David Walley from Calgary, is handling the technical side of things. David's wife, teacher Tatlin Wright Walley from Port Antonio, Jamaica will be assisting with making connections and plans in Jamaica.

We will be reporting on the planning, execution and results of our efforts. Our primary target audience is teachers and community leaders who would like to take on a similar project.

Teachers will be able to get free access to the detailed journal, lesson plans and advice and experience of arranging an international digital exchange for their classrooms.

What We Need

Hard drives: $650. At the heart of the project are USB hard-drives. The price of compact, portable and robust 1 Terabyte drives is about $65 each, and we will start with 10.

Digital Cameras: $350. While many students have access to smart phone with cameras, we want to provide a few digital cameras to be shared among schools, so that all students will have an equal chance to participate.

Mini-studio recorders: $300. To be shared among schools and students, and also as an inviting means for musicians, church groups and story-tellers from the community to get involved.

Air-fare and accommodations: $2200. Two of us will be travelling from Canada to Jamaica for 2 -3 weeks, to get the project started, explain and document the process, and ensure the donated hardware is in good hands. (Lest anyone think we will be lounging on the beach, we are going when sensible Canadians enjoy their own great weather, and yes, we will visit community-maintained Winnifred beach once, just because).

Transportation: $500, in and around Kingston, and in the Blue Mountains.

Donations in kind. We will be relying on family, friends and the abundant kindness of Jamaicans to bridge the remaining gap in our finances.

If we can't meet our goal, we will rely on family and friends in Jamaica to supervise distribution of whatever hardware we have. Documenting the process to guide and inspire follow-on projects will be more challenging, but that will become another part of the story.

Risks & Challenges

Our biggest challenge is ensuring we communicate clearly and openly with everyone involved, between two countries and two cultures. Given the real possibility of misunderstandings, we will be taking care to fully explain: our goals; what schools, students and other contributors are agreeing to; and the limits of what we are able to do.

Another challenge is making sure that hardware does not go missing, so we will be enlisting the help of teachers, school administators and church leaders to take personal responsibility to ensure not only that the hardware is tracked, but also that it is being used effectively. We will be asking these custodians to report back to us so that we can pass along progress reports to you.

Ensuring participation of Jamaican teachers and students is another challenge

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are an artist, musician, educator or writer, we are interested in student and family-friendly original content released under an open license. If you are technologically inclined, we can use your expertise to help assemble open source resources from the Internet. If you support our project, we need your help in spreading the word.

story:
I'm ending this campaign earlier than the planned deadline as I got the great news yesterday that Université de Nice, itself, was granting me with a scholarship. 

Thank you so much for your help and support, and for having believed in my dream!


Je mets fin à cette campagne avant la date prévue, car j'ai appris hier l'excellente nouvelle que l'université de Nice m'attribuait eux-mêmes une bourse. 
Merci beaucoup de toute votre aide et de votre soutien, et surtout d'avoir cru en mon rêve ! 




(that's me there in blue t-shirt sitting next to my younger brother/Je suis ici, en t-shirt bleu, au côté de mon petit-frère)

story:
Microsoft Exchange 2013 is the most powerful e-mail solution in the world.
It synchronizes your contacts, folders and calendars across all of your devices in real time.

For a $1 pledge, you get a fully featured account for 1 year. On top of that, you can extend your service at 50% off our regular price (as published on www.paradoxweb.ca) for 2 extra years with any pledge. You can use your domain or have an email address on one of our domains.

We invite resellers to buy perks in batches and resell them at a later time.

http://www.ParadoxWeb.ca is a Canadian company offering corporate system and network administration, hosted Microsoft Exchange 2013, hosted Microsoft Dynamics CRM 2015  and virtual machine hosting services.

What defines us: Trust, Quality, Reliability, Security and Power.

We also offer Business Intelligence (BI), Customer Relationship Management (CRM) and Enterprise Performance Management (EPM) solutions.

What is our goal?

We have been in business since 1999 and hope to expand our Datacenter by year's end with your contributions.

Our team of highly qualified system and network administrators currently manage many servers locally and remotely. 

New and existing clients now want to externalize their networks and move them to our Cloud. This includes Exchange and CRM services. Therefore, we need your help to move to a new location (expand our Datacenter), add bandwidth, buy Blade servers, SAN Servers, Racks, Switches, Air Conditioning system and a Diesel backup generator. Details at the bottom of this page.

What is EXCHANGE 2013?

Microsoft Exchange 2013 is the most powerful e-mail solution in the world.
It synchronizes your contacts, folders and calendars across all of your devices in real time. Accounts can be managed and restricted independently.

Our Hosted Microsoft Exchange 2013 Plan includes:

– Unlimited Storage
– 100% Hosted in Canada, a safe and steady country
– Your Own Domain Name or on one of ours (Free)
– SSL Only Connexions
– Daily Backups
– OWA (Outlook Web Access) https://webmail.paradoxweb.ca/owa
– Support for Mobile Devices (iPhone, Android, BlackBerry)
– Exchange ActiveSync
– Dedicated Exchange Database ($)
– Barracuda Anti Spam/Virus included
– Over 50 Features

E-mail Security Service (ESS) protects you against all of the threats associated with your e-mail account. You get effective protection against: spam, viruses, malware and data leaks. Service provided by Barracuda Networks.

Price on ParadoxWeb.ca is currently set at $10/User/Month with unlimited storage!

Microsoft Exchange 2013 Fully Functional Demo

Sending has been deactivated to prevent spam.
If you wish to test the send features, please e-mail us and we will turn it on for you with one click.

https://webmail.paradoxweb.ca/owa

Username:  PW\John.Smith
Password:  TestMe=123

We invite you to test this account from your PC, laptop, smartphone and tablet.
use it with your browser on any device or add the Exchange account with ActiveSync.

If you need assistance, contact us.

Hosted Exchange 2013 Perks

$1 gets you a hosted Exchange 2013 account for 1 year with 1 GB space. You can use your own domain or have your account on one of our domain names.

- 1 Gb Space
- Unlimited size of the attachments you send and receive
- Protected by Barracuda Anti-Spam/Virus Service
- ActiveSync for mobile devices
- Hosted in Canada
- Daily Backups
- SSL Only Connexion
- OWA (Outlook Web Access)
- Easy account setup in Outlook
-  Must refer 1 contributor or your $1 becomes a donation. E-mail us the name or e-mail address of the person referred and your account will be activated.

$5 gets you a hosted Exchange 2013 account for 1 year with 2 GB space. You can use your own domain or have your account on one of our domain names.

    • 2 GB Space
    • Unlimited size of the attachments you send and receive
    • Protected by Barracuda Anti-Spam/Virus Service
    • ActiveSync for mobile devices
    • Hosted in Canada
    • Daily Backups
    • SSL Only Connexion
    • OWA (Outlook Web Access)
    • Easy account setup in Outlook
    • No need to refer someone

$10 gets you a hosted Exchange 2013 account for 1 year with 5 GB space. You can use your own domain or have your account on one of our domain names.

    • 5 GB Space
    • Unlimited size of the attachments you send and receive
    • Protected by Barracuda Anti-Spam/Virus Service
    • ActiveSync for mobile devices
    • Hosted in Canada
    • Daily Backups
    • SSL Only Connexion
    • OWA (Outlook Web Access)
    • Easy account setup in Outlook

$20 gets you a hosted Exchange 2013 account for 1 year with 10 GB space. You can use your own domain or have your account on one of our domain names.

    • 10 GB Space
    • Unlimited size of the attachments you send and receive
    • Protected by Barracuda Anti-Spam/Virus Service
    • ActiveSync for mobile devices
    • Hosted in Canada
    • Daily Backups

    • Easy account setup in Outlook

$40 gets you a hosted Exchange 2013 account for 2 years with 10 GB space. You can use your own domain or have your account on one of our domain names.

    • 10 GB Space
    • Unlimited size of the attachments you send and receive
    • Protected by Barracuda Anti-Spam/Virus Service
    • ActiveSync for mobile devices
    • Hosted in Canada
    • SSL Only Connexion
    • OWA (Outlook Web Access)
    • Easy account setup in Outlook

$60 gets you a hosted Exchange 2013 account for 2 years with unlimited space. You can use your own domain or have your account on one of our domain names.

    • Unlimited Space
    • Unlimited size of the attachments you send and receive
    • Protected by Barracuda Anti-Spam/Virus Service
    • ActiveSync for mobile devices
    • Hosted in Canada
    • SSL Only Connexion
    • OWA (Outlook Web Access)
    • Easy account setup in Outlook


Don't forget to add your Client Access Licence (CAL) perk for every Exchange perk you sign up for.

@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@ @@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@

Hosted Microsoft Dynamics CRM 2015
Microsoft Dynamics CRM is a customer relationship management platform with Internet Facing Deployment (IFD) helping sales, marketing, and customer care teams work together to deliver personal experiences to customers worldwide.

For a $50 pledge, you get a fully featured account for 6 months. On top of that, you can extend your service at 50% off the regular price for 2 extra years with any pledge.

– Unlimited Storage
– Hosted in Canada
– Dedicated Organization
– SSL Only Connexions
– Enterprise Account Licence
– Daily Backups
– IFD (Internet Facing Deployment)
– Support for Mobile Devices (iPhone, Android)
– Plugin for Outlook
– Dedicated Database ($)
– Fully Featured

FULLY FEATURED

We will never sell you an upgrade because you get all of the advanced features right from the start with truly unlimited database storage and daily backups. You can export your database and import it on-premise at any time.

Price on ParadoxWeb.ca is currently set at $65/User/Month with unlimited storage!

To test Microsoft Dymancics CRM 2015 please visit this page for a 100% fully functional demo: http://www.paradoxweb.ca/crm-2015-demo/

Hosted Dynamics CRM 2015 Perks


$50 gets you a hosted Dynamics CRM 2015 account for 6 months.

– Unlimited Storage
– Hosted in Canada
– Dedicated Organization
– SSL Only Connexion
– Daily Backups
– IFD (Internet Facing Deployment)
– Support for Mobile Devices (iPhone, Android)
– Plugin for Outlook
– Fully Featured

$100 gets you a hosted Dynamics CRM 2015 account for 1 year.

– Unlimited Storage
– Hosted in Canada
– Dedicated Organization
– SSL Only Connexion
– Daily Backups
– IFD (Internet Facing Deployment)
– Support for Mobile Devices (iPhone, Android)
– Plugin for Outlook
– Fully Featured

$500 gets you 2 unlimited Exchange and CRM accounts for 2 years with all the advantages stated above.

$1000 gets you 5 unlimited Exchange and CRM accounts for 2 years with all the advantages stated above.

$2000 gets you 10 unlimited Exchange and CRM accounts for 2 years with all the advantages stated above.

$5000 gets you 25 unlimited Exchange and CRM accounts for 2 years with all the advantages stated above.

Don't forget to add your Client Access Licence (CAL) perk for every CRM perk you sign up for.

@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@ @@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@

What We Need:

Break down of what we will do with the funds:

First part is to move our datacenter to new offices in Ontario.

Our long term goal is to gather $250.000 to invest as follow:

  • Installation of new Fiber Optic Internet connexions to offer optimal speed and offer redundancy to our clients.
  • Purchase of a new Diesel Backup Generator
  • Buy a new air conditioning system
  • PowerEdge M1000e Blade Enclosure $11,895
  • 2 x F10MXL Blade Switches $34,602
  • Equallogic SAN PS-M4110XS $66,645
  • 2 x PowerEdge M620. E5-2670 v2, 192GB RAM, 2 x 200GB SSD - WindowsDatacenter 2012 $52,884
  • 2 x 4032 SFP+ (Core/Lan switches) $35,396
  • PwerEdge R730XD, 64 GB RAM. 2 x 300GB raid 1 Windows Server STD, 5  4TB Raid 6 $23,792
  • 42U Rack $2,180
  • UPS & PDU $6,965
If we do not reach our entire goal, funds will set aside until we can reach our target at a later time. In ALL cases, perks will be honnored in full. We are in business since 1999 and do not intent to stop our expansion projects until we reach our financial goals. We still have the capacity to host thousands of Exchange and CRM accounts with no negative impact on performance but we wish to expand and take our small company to a whole new level. We have the clients but needs the means to upgrade our network and respond to their ever growing demands.

Your help is invaluable and we will be VERY generous with our supporters!
Free support is included with EVERY perk!
We are devoted to providing reliable service and innovative solutions. Backed up by the 20 year experience of the professional system and network administrators at Preference Technologies, your hosted Exchnage 2013 and hosted CRM 2015 accounts get the best care and attention you can imagine.

At our core, we are not just another hosting company, but a global IT consultant with strong ethical values. ParadoxWeb is managed by its founders. It’s a family business with a unique signature that started in 1999.

story:
Force Ikshvaku is the formula student team of the national institute of engineering, Mysore. We have been participating in SAE Supra for the last 2 years and this year we had a dream run.
For a team attending the event just the second time, we secured 4th position in endurance and we bagged an overall rank of 7, out of 125 teams .
Our mission for the 2017 season is to step on the throttle and make it to the podium and take part in multiple events. We are planning to innovate our designs and our main concern is to reduce the weight.
For reducing weight, we have planned to use composites such as FRP and Carbon Fiber . For this, we need support from every corner of the country and the world .

Each and every contributor will be thanked in all the social networking websites and they will even be given a chance to drive the car we make for the next season as a token of gratitude. 
Your money will be put to good use, you can visit the team garage before or after donating, we are completely fine with it because one of our moral missions include educating the society about motorsport.  We are in conquest to achieve the same. You can visit our youtube channel  @ https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC4KEl1H_PTKXcJP8B-cKuBQ to get to know us through " Talk with the team " campaign .  

You can visit us in facebook to get to know more about our team and our presence : https://www.facebook.com/ForceIkshvaku/

Visit our website : forceikshvaku.in 

You can mail us if you want to support us by providing parts/accessories or any queries regarding the campaign or even mail us if you are expecting anything out of the team, we are ready to offer anything at our powers to gain your trust . Mail us @ forceikshvaku@gmail.com

You can ring us up if you want to visit us or question us about the progress of the project, we are always ready to get to know new people . Contact us at :
Shreevatsa: +91 88922 80105

Vageesh: +91 80953 69725

College Details : 

The National Institute Of Engineering, Mysore

College website : http://www.nie.ac.in/

NIE,Mysore is Ranked 96 out of 3800 Engineering Colleges in india, including prominent institutions like IITs and NITs . ( Release from HRD Ministry ,India)

The mechanical engineering department in NIE is one among the top departments in asia in terms of knowledge oriented learning.


This campaign is completely managed by a group of students, we need your support more than even to build a championship winning car. Please support us and contribute . 


Thank you

story:
We just want Jessica to be able to continue at the school she's been at for the past 4 years. 

It is through landlord negligence that I have lost almost £8k in the past year, and Jessica shouldn't pay for that with disruption to her education and being taken away from the friendships she's formed in the last 4 years.

She is doing very well, and loves her school and is desperate to stay there, but the arrears currently mean she may not be allowed to by Lancing College. 

We intend to walk from Brighton pier to Worthing pier - a task that will be difficult and painful for the both of us - painful for me because due to various surgeries, walking is incredibly painful after 20 minutes or so - a 21 mile walk will render me unable to walk for at least 2 days afterwards, but Jessica AND the charity Clic Sargent are both entirely worth it. 

We can't really offer anything but thanks, and our eternal gratitude, but anything you are able to contribute will be gratefully received by both us and Clic Sargent.

story:
The Bird’s Nest is a community space dedicated to creative play, movement, and connection. Located in the heart of the growing Larkinville District of Buffalo, this facility will be the first in our region to offer classes in Circus Arts that are accessible for everyone regardless of body type, age, income, or ability. AcroYoga, aerial arts, hooping, tumbling, strength training, and dance classes will be offered to keep us active, while regular meditation and yoga classes balance your mind and satisfy your soul. In addition to classes, we will host donation-based weekly open play time in order to be truly inclusive to our community! The Bird’s Nest aims to create a safe space that promotes health through non-conventional ways of moving and collaboration.

We need your help to renovate our new home for circus arts and community play in Buffalo. We need new windows,  heating, electrical, plumbing, repairs to the masonry, and so much more! We also need to purchase safety equipment like mats and soft flooring, and training equipment like aerial rigging, yoga blocks, and climbing holds. Thank you for your contribution to developing a space for our community to learn and move together!

Who Are We?

We are a community of folks who love circus, yoga, and Buffalo! For the last several years, we have been spreading our joy and building our community by teaching classes and hosting donation-based group play times (called jams) all over Western NY. Jams are so important to us because they allow everyone to participate and grow their skills, without having to make a monetary commitment. We teach paid classes as well, at yoga studios and gyms, but most of our classes and jams have been held outside in Delaware Park, Bidwell Park, and Canalside. We have joined with many local groups of movers, dancers, hoopers, thinkers, and players to open The Bird’s Nest. We are so excited to have a home of our own so we can offer regular classes in all kinds of movement arts for your enjoyment and have a space to play when it’s too cold to be outside. Please help us open The Bird’s Nest to create a home for circus arts in Buffalo!

Help us Build Our Nest

Thanks to a huge outpouring of support from our community, we've been able to accomplish a lot already. We took down a wall, shelving, and balcony, but there's still a lot we need. Here’s how we will use your contribution at The Bird’s Nest!

The Fun Stuff:

  • $2,200 for five aerial set ups, including silks and rigging
  • $350 will get us started with some basic yoga equipment: blocks and straps are a must, but we plan to make use of donated mats, bolsters, and blankets.

  • $1,500 will help us build a vertical strength training area with climbing, a peg wall, pull up boards, and safety mats. We will also have a donated hangboard, parallettes, and free weights.
  • $500 for hula hoops

Safety Equipment:

  • $5,000 is needed to purchase carpet bonded foam flooring to give us a nice soft landing. This flooring can be rolled up, stored, and moved around so we can have it where we need it depending on the class or event.
  • $400 will get us a spotting block- a tall pad that a spotter can stand on to provide safety for standing acrobatics.
  • $3,200 for two 4ft deep acrobatics crash pads
  • $2,000 for 8in thick crash pads
  • $250 to stock up on first aid materials like bandages, kinesiology tape, ice packs, and a freezer to store them in.
  • $300 for emergency signs and lighting
  • $300 for permanent railings for our mezzanine 

Repairs and Construction:

  • $14,000 will go into replacing most of the windows in the building.
  • $1,500 for a structural evaluation of the building
  • $1,500 for heating
  • $3,000 for electrical
  • $4,000 for masonry repairs
  • $10,000 to level the concrete floor

The Grand Total:

$50,000

Stretch Goals

That's what we need to get the bare essentials accomplished!  Here's the cool stuff we have in mind for if we exceed our goal:

  • $4,200 for more anchor points for aerial rigging, and crash pads for them
  • $3,000 for Cyr Wheels
  • $3,000 for flow arts gear: poi, fans, dragon staffs, contact staffs, rope dart, etc.
  • $1,175 for gymnastics trapezoid
  • $1,500 to install carpet-bonded foam in our vertical strength training area
  • $9,000 to build out a second bathroom, plus installing showers
  • $2,000 to build out our massage studio
  • $8,000 to install hardwood flooring in the front of the building 
  • $3,000 to replace our garage doors with insulated doors
  • $8,000 to paint the building
  • $3,000 for a 2nd hand scissor lift
  • $450 for scissor lift certification for 3 people
  • $500 for handstand canes
  • $250 for a sound system so we can party on

Perks

Check out our perks! By contributing to our campaign you are making an investment in our future and yours. You can purchase drop-in class passes, monthly memberships, and open play time at The Bird’s Nest. We also have cool t-shirts and stickers for you to show off your circus pride. Larger contributions can get you private parties at our space, performances at your events, and more! If you would like to make a large contribution, please contact us and we would be happy to create a custom package that suits your organization’s needs. We hope that the benefits you receive from contributing from this campaign will be on-going. Read on to discover the meaningful ways we hope to benefit the community.

The Impact

If all this circus stuff seems a little odd to you, you’re probably wondering why we think circus arts are so great, and how they can bring people together. How can the Bird’s Nest make an impact on the greater Buffalo community?

  • The key philosophies of circus arts as we practice them are trust and communication. These are vital when we work with one another, test our boundaries, and grow our skills. The same tenants apply to growing a community! That’s why the Buffalo Circus community has grown so quickly in just a few years. By opening The Bird’s Nest, we believe we can make circus arts accessible to everyone.
  • Our Jams are free time in which our space is open to everyone and anyone who wants to come practice, work with new people, and share their skills- at no charge. We will offer weekly jams at no cost because it is an important mainstay in our culture and crucial to welcoming and inclusiveness.
  • Yoga teaches us to be truthful, kind, peaceful, and mindful. By practicing Yoga and offering classes, we spread these teachings to our greater Buffalo community. We really believe that treating ourselves, our friends, and strangers in this way spreads this message and makes the world a better place.

  • We all came to circus from different backgrounds: some of us are artists or yogis, some are lawyers or engineers. What unifies us is our willingness to work together and open our hearts and our space to all.
  • Buffalo is booming with a myriad of talented artists, musicians, dancers, and creators of all kinds! AcroYoga Buffalo is already well-known in the national circus community, but having our own space to practice will make us a world-class destination for famous practitioners of Circus Arts to come and share their knowledge with us. The Bird’s Nest will expand Buffalo’s unique arts scene and contribute to our growing reputation as an incredible city to visit!

Our Business Structure

The Bird's Nest will offer regularly-scheduled classes in all sorts of Circus Arts, as well as yoga, meditation, and dance. Students can pay per class (drop-in classes), purchase a package of classes in a series, or buy memberships that will give them access to classes plus Open Play time. Special workshops will be offered at additional costs, and we hope to host visiting teachers as well. We will also offer donation-based weekly jams, and everyone is invited!

We have a large team of awesome teachers at The Bird's Nest who will be paid per class. Eventually we also plan to have a retail area where you can purchase t-shirts, yoga equipment, custom hula hoops, water bottles, and more.

We own our building, so we don’t have to worry about rent. We do have bills to pay such as electric, internet, and heating, which will amount to about $450 per month on average. Our taxes are about $3,000 a year, and insurance will be about $8,000 a year.

Risks & Challenges/ Safety

Safety is important to us! It is only possible for us to excel in our skills and proceed with learning when we know we are safe. The Bird’s Nest is fully insured for all the ways we plan to use it. Our teachers have many years of training and experience teaching and practicing their skills. Our classes always feature a safety component: whenever you learn a new move, you must also learn how to spot it. We never just jump right into a new skill- we believe you have to learn to walk before you can run, and learning the ground-up progression to a new skill is crucial to safely growing your practice. Everything we do is by invitation and not expectation, meaning that you set your own goals and your own boundaries.

Other Ways You Can Help

We believe that whoever you are, you have a unique skill that can help make the community more beautiful. Please contact us at http://acro-wny.org/contact-us.html if this project speaks to you and you want to help in one of the following ways:

  • Construction and building renovation
  • Setting up equipment
  • Clerical work, payroll, employee/scheduling management and organization

Items we need:

  • yoga mats, blocks, straps, blankets, and bolsters
  • free weights, rings, TRX, and other workout equipment
  • cleaning supplies, a vacuum, and carpet shampooer
  • a refrigerator/freezer
  • an office desk and filing cabinet
  • space heaters
  • laptops

Thank You!

We truly appreciate your contribution to building The Bird’s Nest! We promise this will be an enduring place for you to learn, grow, stay healthy, and find peace. We are so excited to see how this project will grow and the many ways in which it will be successful. Thank you for your help in bringing a community circus space to Buffalo!
