story:
Let's Make It!

We are Sacha Mittelman and Lindsay Gahn, school psychologists from Boulder, Colorado.  We share the struggle our colleagues face balancing meaningful interaction with kids and time spent wrestling with data.

So we formed SuperPsyched in 2011 to develop an iPad app that makes it simple to conduct behavior observations and prepare easy to understand graphs that bring key insights to focus and inform decision making.

This frees up time to enjoy the most rewarding and important part of your job--  making connections and being a difference maker.

As practicing school psychologists ourselves,  we created a tool that matches the exact needs of users in the field.  Psychologists rave about the intuitive interface and time-saving features of BehaviorSnap.

Over the years we have had the pleasure of meeting thousands of school psychologists who praise the application as well as a substantial number begging for the release of an iPhone version.  

School psychs bring a data-driven approach to promoting student growth and one of the the most useful tools in their box is systematic behavior observation. Having the ability to access your data on the go, on your primary device-- your iPhone-- will allow you to be even more on top of your game.

By backing our campaign, you will help us get BehaviorSnap into the hands of more users, thereby giving more school psychologists the chance to streamline their approach to behavior observation and increase their availability to provide critical support to teachers and kids.  

SuperPsyched Needs Your Support:

We are raising $5000 to hire the same talented app designer who built the iPad version of BehaviorSnap, Hunter Hillegas.  These funds will go directly toward paying our developer for his excellent coding work.  We strive to keep the cost of production low in order to offer the iPhone version at the same affordable price as our iPad app.  We want to avoid having to pass the price of development on to our users, knowing educators have limited funds for technology.  

By backing our campaign, you will help thousands of school psychologists gain access to the tool they need and there are some pretty great deals for you!

Perks:

For $200 you will get the Forever Version of the iPhone app. This is a $300 value.

A $50 contribution will get you the iPhone Version of the app - and a 2 year subscription (a $70 value).

A $25 contribution will get you the iPhone Version of the app - and a 1 year subscription (a $40 value).

Any contribution will get you our sincerest gratitude and a BehaviorSnap sticker!

The Impact:

As a school psychologist, your skill set is in such high demand, it is easy to drown in responsibilities. Some days you get through your tasks and other days they get blown up. The plain fact is, you're often your school's only resource for handling crises with students and regardless of what else is on your plate, certain situations will always take precedence.

Because of this, it is crucial to find ways to work smarter not harder or else you will regularly have the last car in the parking lot at the end of the day and still find yourself dragging files home.  

We want you to be a superstar school psych so our app simplifies data collection and reporting which means you can spend more time interacting with kids.

An iPhone version of our app will extend the awesome functionality of our iPad app allowing you flexibility to use it how and when you want.  BehaviorSnap for iPad has a 4.8 of 5 star rating in the App Store and has received overwhelmingly positive reviews in the the National Association of School Psychologists Communique.  Our app is a trusted brand among behavior support specialists and the one complaint we receive is the lack of of an iPhone version.

Wouldn’t it be great to have all the utility of BehaviorSnap available on your primary device? No need to obtain an outdated district-issued iPad or to turn it in at the end of the year, only to have your data wiped by the IT department.

Our users have asked for more access to BehaviorSnap, and we would like to answer the call.  

Risks & Challenges

We hope to reach our funding goal within 30 days.  This will allow us to complete the work for a fall release. If we do not reach our goal, it will be a longer, slower process to reach completion.

But with full funding, we can turn to our accomplished app developer to execute our plans. 

Our process to create the initial iPad app as well as subsequent updates has always been one of detailed planning and much testing to ensure quality and performance for our users. 

Once again, we will dedicate our evenings and weekends to working through the beta testing until the iPhone version is solid and ready for market.  

While this can be a bit pain-staking, this is not our first rodeo, and we are excited to get rolling.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

Please support us by getting the word out and make some noise about the campaign.

Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you so much for supporting our campaign!
story_txt: Let's Make It!We are Sacha Mittelman and Lindsay Gahn, school psychologists from Boulder, Colorado.  We share the struggle our colleagues face balancing meaningful interaction with kids and time spent wrestling with data.So we formed SuperPsyched in 2011 to develop an iPad app that makes it simple to conduct behavior observations and prepare easy to understand graphs that bring key insights to focus and inform decision making.This frees up time to enjoy the most rewarding and important part of your job--  making connections and being a difference maker.As practicing school psychologists ourselves,  we created a tool that matches the exact needs of users in the field.  Psychologists rave about the intuitive interface and time-saving features of BehaviorSnap.Over the years we have had the pleasure of meeting thousands of school psychologists who praise the application as well as a substantial number begging for the release of an iPhone version.  School psychs bring a data-driven approach to promoting student growth and one of the the most useful tools in their box is systematic behavior observation. Having the ability to access your data on the go, on your primary device-- your iPhone-- will allow you to be even more on top of your game.By backing our campaign, you will help us get BehaviorSnap into the hands of more users, thereby giving more school psychologists the chance to streamline their approach to behavior observation and increase their availability to provide critical support to teachers and kids.  SuperPsyched Needs Your Support:We are raising $5000 to hire the same talented app designer who built the iPad version of BehaviorSnap, Hunter Hillegas.  These funds will go directly toward paying our developer for his excellent coding work.  We strive to keep the cost of production low in order to offer the iPhone version at the same affordable price as our iPad app.  We want to avoid having to pass the price of development on to our users, knowing educators have limited funds for technology.  By backing our campaign, you will help thousands of school psychologists gain access to the tool they need and there are some pretty great deals for you!Perks:For $200 you will get the Forever Version of the iPhone app. This is a $300 value.A $50 contribution will get you the iPhone Version of the app - and a 2 year subscription (a $70 value).A $25 contribution will get you the iPhone Version of the app - and a 1 year subscription (a $40 value).Any contribution will get you our sincerest gratitude and a BehaviorSnap sticker!The Impact:As a school psychologist, your skill set is in such high demand, it is easy to drown in responsibilities. Some days you get through your tasks and other days they get blown up. The plain fact is, you're often your school's only resource for handling crises with students and regardless of what else is on your plate, certain situations will always take precedence.Because of this, it is crucial to find ways to work smarter not harder or else you will regularly have the last car in the parking lot at the end of the day and still find yourself dragging files home.  We want you to be a superstar school psych so our app simplifies data collection and reporting which means you can spend more time interacting with kids.An iPhone version of our app will extend the awesome functionality of our iPad app allowing you flexibility to use it how and when you want.  BehaviorSnap for iPad has a 4.8 of 5 star rating in the App Store and has received overwhelmingly positive reviews in the the National Association of School Psychologists Communique.  Our app is a trusted brand among behavior support specialists and the one complaint we receive is the lack of of an iPhone version.Wouldn’t it be great to have all the utility of BehaviorSnap available on your primary device? No need to obtain an outdated district-issued iPad or to turn it in at the end of the year, only to have your data wiped by the IT department.Our users have asked for more access to BehaviorSnap, and we would like to answer the call.  Risks & ChallengesWe hope to reach our funding goal within 30 days.  This will allow us to complete the work for a fall release. If we do not reach our goal, it will be a longer, slower process to reach completion.But with full funding, we can turn to our accomplished app developer to execute our plans. Our process to create the initial iPad app as well as subsequent updates has always been one of detailed planning and much testing to ensure quality and performance for our users. Once again, we will dedicate our evenings and weekends to working through the beta testing until the iPhone version is solid and ready for market.  While this can be a bit pain-staking, this is not our first rodeo, and we are excited to get rolling.Other Ways You Can HelpSome people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:Please support us by getting the word out and make some noise about the campaign.Please use the Indiegogo share tools!Thank you so much for supporting our campaign!

story:
Who We Are

We're two military spouses and moms who have a passion for building stronger families. Like most military families, ours have already endured more short and long-term separations than we can count, and we personally know dozens of other parents and kids trying to work through the challenges of living apart. We have the first comprehensive product for children ages 4-7 that targets the biggest troubles of separation: a subscription box filled with handpicked tools and toys for kids and their caretakers. 

Jamie Pasquariello and family

Madeleine Reeves and family

Your contribution will help lift Deploy Joy Co. from dream to delivery. Let's get these packages to some of the bravest, strongest kids we know. 

What We Need & What You Get

The $8000 you're helping us raise will

  • Cover the initial expenses of ordering our boxes and products in bulk. We're committed to sending high quality products to our customers and want to be able to assure the quality from the start
  • Increase our marketing and reach to families who will benefit from our product
  • Help with the upkeep and development of our website
  • Donate boxes to families in need

In return for your enormous generosity, we'd like to thank you with an array of perks. 

$10 donations earn a Deploy Joy Co. decal 

$20 donations get our first month's box at an Early Bird discount--a total steal!

$50 donations earn a "Choose Joy" hand-stamped cuff bracelet 

$60 donations earn a 3 month box subscription at an Early Bird rate

$100 donations earn a bracelet, decal, and one month subscription

Donors are also able to specify that their donations should go to a family in need, and Deploy Joy Co. will donate a box or a three month subscription to a qualifying family.

The Impact

As of 2014, 1.4 million US children had a parent in the military, and about half of US service members had a child under the age of 18. A military life inevitably involves periods in which parents have to work away from home and separate from their children. Rarely do parents feel prepared for the emotional and behavioral impact on their children, causing additional stress, worry, and tension in an already difficult time.

What's In the Box?

Using the latest research and input from experts in child psychology, behavior, and education, we're sourcing or making products that will: 

  • Facilitate greater connection between parents and young children who have to video chat to stay in touch. Our activities are such that a deployed parent can easily participate over the computer or phone with their child, making quick conversations more like family time at home. Think: writing an ongoing story together over time apart, playing a game that thrills both child and parent, or talking a kiddo through a craft that they can send in a care package. 

  • Encourage and educate parents on the emotional or behavioral changes they may be seeing in their children, and give them tools to address tough issues. Think: books that cover tough subjects in a way that kids can understand, stress kits to help soothe hard emotions, and affirmations for parents and kids that will help bring more peace and positivity to homes.  

  • Bring JOY! Even though they seem like little warriors, these boxes are going to kids who like to have a good time. We promise quality products that are vetted by moms. If we wouldn't put it in our homes, we wouldn't send it to yours, either. 

Risks & Challenges

At the end (and beginning) of the day, we're moms who take care of our families. We think this makes us qualified to know and understand our target market and to really craft a product that'll make a positive change in families across the military, but it does mean that our pace-setters are the little ones at home. We're confident and committed to being able to set and share accurate timelines and to be immediately transparent if changes occur, and are working to grow our team as soon as possible so that we can scale our operations to accommodate the needs of as many families as we can reach.

Currently we're only shipping to the contiguous US, but please stay tuned if you're overseas! We hope to be able to serve OCONUS families as soon as possible. 

We thank you for your understanding and encouragement in building Deploy Joy Co. into a business that not only will support our own families, but thousands of others. 

Other Ways You Can Help

It all comes down to spreading the word! We'd be so grateful if you could share our campaign or website so that we can reach as many families who could benefit from our product as possible!

Indigeogo makes it easy to share the links. Just select your preferred platforms (at the top right of the page to the right of the BACK IT button, and go! Thankful for YOU!

story:
Hello. I'm Ebru. I graduated from Akdeniz University Fine Arts Faculty Department of Music in 2017.
I have been accepted to the Universität Mozarteum Salzburg for Master Performance of Guitar. Due to Turkish Lira’s recent significant loss of value against Euro, I can no longer support my studies with family funds alone. So, I ask you for your help to gather the funds required by the Austrian Embassy to grant me a student visa - 10,000 Euros for one year - by the end of September. Please donate, no matter how small, as every bit helps. Thank you very much in advance!
If you donate me more than 100 Euros, I can give you some guitar lessons or a little concert on Skype.


Ebru Beş
She started her guitar adventure with  Hamit Elmas in 2010; he continued with Atahan Kaya in Akdeniz University Fine Arts Faculty Department of Music. She actively attended masterclasses of Aniello Desiderio, Cecilio Perera, Enno Voorhorst, Erdem Sökmen, Frank Bungarten, Hopkinson Smith, Kağan Korad, Matthias Seidel, Ricardo Moyano, Roberto Aussel, Safa Yeprem, Soner Egesel, Ozan Sarıtepe and Vincenzo Sandro Brancaccio. She became finalist at the competition within the scope of Istanbul Intenational Classical Guitar Festival which lasted between 20-24 April 2016. She attended Youth Talent Music Festival in Mehmet Akif Ersoy University on 6th May 2017. She performed Arturo Marquez - Danzon No 3 at Antalya State Opera as a soloist on 17-19 January and 21-23 March 2017. She gave a recital within the scope of Marsyas Cultural Art and Music Festival on 17th May 2017.  She graduated from Akdeniz University with High Honor Degree in 2017.

Merhaba. Ben Ebru. 2017 yılında Akdeniz Üniversitesi Güzel Sanatlar Fakültesinden mezun oldum. Mezuniyetimden sonra, Antalya Belediye Konservatuvarı'nda yaklaşık bir yıl gitar öğretmeni olarak çalıştım.
Universität Mozarteum Salzburg'a gitar bölümüne yüksek lisans öğrencisi olarak kabul edildim. Türk Lirasının değer kaybetmesinden dolayı, her geçen gün amacıma ulaşmam benim için zorlaşıyor.  Şuan Avusturya Büyükelçiliği'ne göstermek zorunda olduğum banka hesabımda bir yıllık ihtiyacım olan paraya sahip değilim. Burs başvurularında bulundum ancak hala sonuçlanmasını bekliyorum. Bir aylık ihtiyacım ortalama 700 Euro civarında olacak.
Eğer bana 100 Euro'dan fazla bağış yaparsanız, Skype'tan size küçük bir dinleti yapabilir ya da gitar dersi verebilirim.
Şimdiden teşekkürler!

Ebru Beş
Gitar çalışmalarına 2010 yılında Hamit Elmas ile başladı. Akdeniz Üniversitesi Güzel Sanatlar Fakültesi'nde Atahan Kaya ile devam etti. Aniello Desiderio, Cecilio Perera, Enno Voorhorst, Erdem Sökmen, Frank Bungarten, Hopkinson Smith, Kağan Korad, Matthias Seidel, Ricardo Moyano, Roberto Aussel, Safa Yeprem, Soner Egesel, Ozan Sarıtepe ve Vincenzo Sandro Brancaccio'nun ustalık sınıfı derslerine aktif olarak katıldı. 20-24 Nisan 2016 tarihleri arasında gerçekleştirilen İstanbul Uluslararası Klasik Gitar Festivali kapsamındaki gitar yarışmasında finale kaldı. 6 Mayıs 2016'da Mehmet Akif Ersoy Üniversitesi Genç Yetenekler Müzik Festivali'ne katıldı. 17-19 Ocak ve 21-23 Mart 2017 tarihlerinde Antalya Devlet Opera Balesi ÜÇ-RENK Bale temsilinde solist olarak Arturo Marquez Danzon No 3 seslendirdi. 17 Mayıs 2017 tarihinde Marsyas Kültür Sanat ve Müzik Festivali kapsamında bir resital verdi. 2017 yılı bahar dönemi sonunda Akdeniz Üniversitesi'nden yüksek onur derecesiyle mezun oldu.

story:
The Certification Commission for Healthcare Interpreters (CCHI) is a national non-profit organization in the U.S. whose mission is to administer a national, valid, comprehensive, and inclusive certification program for medical interpreters. Certifying interpreters leads to higher quality healthcare services for patients who don’t speak English, to a more professionalized work force and greater trust in interpreters by providers and patients alike. We have certified over 3,800 interpreters since 2011.

Currently, CCHI offers certification performance exams in Spanish, Mandarin and Arabic. Of course, we all would like to have valid and reliable tests for all 350+ languages in which interpreters work in the U.S. But developing such valid, bilingual tests is statistically impossible when the language group to be tested is small, and it is extremely expensive. We believe that certification should be inclusive and equitable. Patients of any language deserve to have a qualified interpreter, and, therefore, interpreters of any language deserve to have an opportunity to prove their qualifications. What can we do?

We want to conduct a study to find out if we can measure cognitive interpreting skills (=ability to successfully convert meaning from one language into another) via a standardized English-only oral performance test. We will invite 300 candidates, who are taking our existing certification tests in Spanish, Mandarin, and Arabic, to take a second interpreter performance test in English, and under the guidance of a professional psychometrician, we will see whether the English-only test or any of its components predict success on the already validated bilingual tests. This will give us data to develop an English-to-English (EtoE) certification exam for all.

No one in our field has done a study of such scale or on such an important subject. Join us in being the first! Your contribution will help us put the interpreter profession on the map of data-driven research and evidence-based decision making.

What We Need and Ask

CCHI will develop an English-to-English (EtoE) test assessing cognitive interpreting skills for medical interpreters following the national accreditation standards and certification industry best practices. We will recruit 300 volunteers, interpreters of Arabic, Mandarin and Spanish, who will be randomly assigned to take the EtoE test before or after they take a corresponding language-specific performance certification test. Our raters will score the results of both tests. CCHI’s psychometric consultant will conduct sets of psychometric analyses of the results and provide a psychometric report. We will publish a comprehensive report about this study online, free of charge.

We estimate the cost of conducting this study to be about $70,000. We are reaching out to foundations and corporate funders for financial support. And we are allocating our own operational funds for project coordination and promotion.

But we also need support from YOU - interpreters, interpreter trainers, patients and providers for whom we interpret, education enthusiasts, people who believe in social justice and equal opportunity for all, people who believe that diversity makes our country and our society stronger.

Your contribution is critical! We cannot do it without YOU! Partner with CCHI in the largest research initiative in the history of the interpreting profession.

And we offer some unique and meaningful Perks for your participation! Depending on the level of your contribution you can get a chance to talk to a Commissioner, a flashlight or t-shirt with CCHI logo, a book, a gift voucher for continuing education webinars, or a commemorative plaque along with a one-year listing on our website. And you will always have our deepest gratitude.

What Your Contribution Means

We come to this project prepared. We have worked with over 50 national experts in interpreting, interpreter training and testing since the fall of 2017 to outline the parameters of this EtoE study. We have formed the National Task Force to guide us in this project (see http://cchicertification.org/etoe/). We know it is timely and needed.

With your help, we are ready to make this a reality. This study will help better assess medical interpreter competencies, which ultimately will help patients of all languages get better access to health care. Interpreters, trainers, employers, the profession overall, and patients will benefit from this project.

This is your opportunity to stand behind a profession that helps non-English speaking patients communicate with their doctors, nurses, etc.

We welcome contributions at any level and from any individual or organization. Please see the Perks sections for our awards and recognition of your support. Please note that a contribution to CCHI cannot be deductible as a charitable gift but may be deductible as a business expense if properly filed.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Get colleagues and friends to contribute
  • Share the campaign using the Indiegogo share tools
  • Use the hashtag #ProjectEtoE on Twitter and Instagram
  • Volunteer to be a subject matter expert to create test questions
  • Volunteer to take the EtoE test (if you are an interpreter of Arabic, Mandarin or Spanish)

Check out http://cchicertification.org/etoe/ for more information.

story:
Our Story

Hello world, we are Recul! For those of you who know us from the previous campaign….we’re the same people you met and supported, Vlad, Bogdan, Dan M, Dan C, Alexandra, Adriana and Adina, and now we’re back with a bigger challenge and a new address, 160 Splaiul Unirii street.

Ever since we closed the circle in Cercului Street, where our theatre saw the light for more than two years, we began searching: searching for our new home, for a place that would fit all of our dreams of performance and education.

 

We’ve been through a challenging hero's journey and on our way we met Calup, a team of awesome architects, the strategic partner who plays a very important role in the new Recul space and who invited us in the Calup Space Starter program. Now, Recul will not only be a new theatre and performance based school in Bucharest, but it will also keep alive the cultural heritage of the space we're in.

Our new home is the Cotton Industry, a place that was witness to the third industrial revolution, and now, with the creative new wave that’s populating the building, we’re going towards the fourth revolution together.
 

THE space

Without any other metaphors ….. we rented a 850 square meters space big enough for the new Recul!

And when we say big….it’s big… but let us give you some context:

The new Recul would fit 21,25 old Reculs in it. 

It's about two-and-a-half times as big as an IMAX screen.

It's about three-and-a-half times as big as a Tennis court…. Hear that, Simona Halep… you’re welcome to play some improvised tennis with us anytime.

It's about one-fifth as big as Bill Gates' Home….  and Bill Gates has one of the biggest homes in the world.

It's about one-tenth as big as The White House.

It's about 55 times as big as a Parking Space.

It's about one-seven-hundred-fiftieth as big as Disneyland………but it’s OUR playground and we can’t do this without you guys.

 

What you're in for:

Curtain up!

Hello, dear friends, let’s get more pragmatic:

Recul is being developed in new parameters: 850 square meters that will be divided into two main sections -
- Recul School, 4 multifunctional classrooms for workshops, rehearsals and events;
- Recul Theatre  - the space that will accommodate up to 140 people with a 30 square meters stage and functional backstage. The space is modular thanks to the soundproofed and fire resistant curtains, a new technology that will enhance the transformation of the space every day.

Between Recul School and Recul Theatre it’s the place where magic happens - Recul Social - a bar and networking space that serves as the best transition from class to stage, from the shy introverted to the shining star. It’s the perfect place for talks about improv, theatre, arts, a purgatory for those who are about to perform and also those who will be in the crowd.

 

A short timeline to how we got here will help you understand everything:

January 2018 - The hope - we started the Indiegogo Campaign, we also started packing, wrapping, performing our last shows, crying and hoping for the future;

February - March 2018 - Gratefulness - at the end of month we closed the campaign with so much joy and energy, with the help of 117 individual contributors from all over the world...Romania, Switzerland, Sweden, Great Britain, Belgium, Germany, Bulgaria, the Netherlands, Hungary or the United States we financed more than 100% of our campaign.

March - June 2018 - The search: we took the city by foot, we saw old buildings, attics, basements, we hoped again and we lost our hope, but Calup saw the light at the end of the Cotton Industry;

July - August 2018 - Loans, credits and business plans: the place had a lot of potential, but it needed a great investment. During the summer we started talking to banks, we put our romantic dreams on paper, in excel, we added the numbers and the costs;

August - November 2018 -  The heavy lifting: we found the best team of specialists, constructors, and they are contributing every day to the transformation of the space. They are the first to be on Recul’s new stage and we are honoured to have them there;

November - December 2018 - Resilience: we discovered that things don’t always go as planned. We knocked on many doors and not so many people responded. We rapped our way through a business pitch and once again the community showed us all the love that we needed to win the 1st prize in a pitching contest.
…………………….26th of December 2018 - we’re still here, and we’re coming back to the community.

      ……...Fast forward……. In April 2019 the new Recul will open the doors for the first show. And we want YOU there!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Elden Chase Kimball. We are launching a new online portal website named ChronicleQuest.com. This is a continuation of the work my father, Glenn Kimball, and I did for many years in the fields of archaeology, science, history and cultures. Together, we amassed a sizable media library. Glenn passed away in 2010 and I suspended our work until which time I had the team, funds and technology in place to relaunch. That time is now...

Now we have a team in place for transforming our previous work (and our new and upcoming work and collaborations with other scholars) into many technological formats including audio, video, virtual and augmented reality, animation, etc. By using these technologies, we are making the world of history and discovery exciting and fun, not just for adults, but for the youth of today as well!

We have the ability to provide all of this information right now. However, we created this campaign in order to have the funds to work and create in these new media formats to provide the maximum experience for our members.

What We Need & What You Get

There are many different ways for us to get our information out to people. In order to create the best experience, we feel we should tackle as many of them as possible. Our goal is to have the funds necessary to provide a 1st-person augmented and virtual experience for the consumer, where they can go visit different sites around the world without leaving their home. While we are developing the first destinations, we will be continuing to provide new research, audio books, videos and more for our members. People can visit our website and browse through many intriguing topics. As time goes on, the website becomes more and more populated with fascinating material from around the world.

Running this new website (ChronicleQuest.com) has expenses, but also has a subscription model that will help fund future projects. Creating the 1st-person augmented and virtual experiences has many expenses, but will also launch us into having the capability to provide more and more adventures.

In order to get from where we are today (a functioning website with a vast media library of content) to rolling out our first 1st-person augmented and virtual experience we need the following funding:

$13,000 - Website Upkeep and Development

$9,000 - Advertising/Social Media

$20,000 - Audio/Video Production

$8,000 - Research/Writing/Travel

$6,000 - Light Administration Costs

$40,000 - 1st Person Experience Production Costs 

$96,000 - Total Funding Needed

In the event that this campaign does not meet the goal of $96,000 the money will be used as follows:

25% - Audio/Video Production

25% - 1st Person Experience Production Costs

25% - Website Upkeep and Development and Advertising/Social Media

25% - Research/Writing/Travel and Light Administration Costs

In the event that the campaign exceeds the goal of $96,000. the money will be dispersed into each category as it was allocated. The excess money will be dispersed as follows:

25% - Audio/Video Production

25% - 1st Person Experience Production Costs

25% - Website Upkeep and Development and Advertising/Social Media

25% - Research/Writing/Travel and Light Administration Costs

Each campaign offers perks for donating. Our perks will include different memberships and free 1-hour long audio books (of which we have 147 titles, all researched, written and produced by me and my father and our production team).

The Impact

We aren't just relaunching some company. My father and I always had a passion for helping people understand various important subjects. We believed that you must keep all the pieces of the puzzle on the table, no matter how much they don't seem to fit, in order to get closer to the truth.

One of the main reasons for launching this, is because the kids and young adults of today have so much information at their fingertips and most are wasting the opportunity to grow their knowledge and understanding. I see all these kids spending all day watching meaningless videos on YouTube, or other sites, when there is a vast amount of information out there that would be so much more beneficial! The problem is that there is so much out there and it is almost impossible for them to put it together in a way that makes sense. This pertains to the adults too, not just the kids. That is why we have the different sections on our site, so you can research, or learn and be entertained on any level that is right for you.

Risks & Challenges

Any new business faces different risks and challenges. Our team has countless years of experience in research, writing, production, animation, etc. This experience allows us to overcome many obstacles that might arise throughout the beginning stages of this business. The main challenge that I see, would be not raising enough money to get the 1st-person augmented and virtual experience up and running soon enough. We will get there, no matter what, eventually. However, by getting enough funding, we will get there quickly and everyone will have a lot of fun once it goes live.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you cannot contribute financially, there are some ways you can help with our campaign.

If you can tell someone about us, or share a link to our website, or this campaign, that would be extremely helpful. If you have certain technological, or research skills that might help us with the new materials and/or productions, that would be extremely helpful. 

Remember that you can use the Indiegogo share tools on this site.

story:
Help us launch our exciting new educational charity,“Why Comics?”

- Bringing contemporary humanitarian and social issues into the classroom

Why Comics? encourages 14-18 year old students and their teachers to interact with global humanitarian and social issues (such as racism, migration, climate change, conflict, bullying and trafficking) through interactive comics based on real-life testimonies.

Why Comics?  provides innovative educational resources, embedded with multimedia (such as maps, news articles and videos). Each resource is accompanied by national-curriculum lesson plans for various subjects.

The comic acts as a ‘hook’, building empathy and creating talking points for wider issues. The age-appropriate contextual links allow students and teachers to explore the topics in greater detail, increasing understanding and raising awareness.

** Check out our amazing pledge prizes! You can be become the star of your own comic! **

How does Why Comics? make a difference?

Why Comics?  tackles the gap in available and accessible educational resources on these important global topics, making them engaging, relevant and interesting. 

Why Comics? encourages and promotes critical and reflective thinking on vital global themes, whilst encouraging learners to make connections between their own lives and the lives of others throughout the world.

In this way Why Comics? can help combat racism and intolerance in schools. “Looking at Merha’s story in class suddenly made it ok for me to talk about my family’s similar experience, suddenly it’s like the other kids understand me and know where I’m coming from”, Pupil, aged 16 from a State-Secondary College, Birmingham, UK.

It can be used to support and enhance the teaching of various subjects:

  • Personal, social, health and economic (PSHE) education / Citizenship
  • English Language / English Literature / ESOL / EAL
  • Languages / Geography / History / Psychology
  • Art / Media / Drama
  • Information Computing / Technology

Currently, more than 500 schools in 26 countries (and counting) have signed up to receive our free interactive resources and accompanying suggested lesson plans.

The feedback we are receiving from teachers and students has been overwhelmingly positive, which tells us we're onto a good thing here!

We need your help to take these complex issues to new international audiences. Help us humanise the mass statistics we hear in the news!

About Us 

Dr Benjamin Dix, Senior Fellow at SOAS, University of London, founded the award-winning non-profit PositiveNegatives in 2012 and has been producing literary comics about contemporary social and human rights issues ever since. “We aim to build empathy with readers by combining ethnographic research with illustration and photography, and adapting personal testimonies into art, advocacy and education materials.” PositiveNegatives and their commissioners have kindly donated their portfolio for Why Comics? to use.

Ben has worked for the United Nations and various international NGOs across Asia and Africa for over 12 years. Emma Saville has worked extensively in the not-for-profit sectors for 10 years, principally in charities across Latin America and the Institute of Education in the UK. Find out more about how our team is passionate about innovation, global humanitarian issues and education.

PositiveNegatives has worked extensively with a range of organisations such as The Guardian, United Nations (UN), Open Society Foundations (OSF), Norwegian People’s Aid, BBC, The Nobel Peace Centre, and the Overseas Development Institute (ODI) and with leading academic institutions such as; Harvard South Asia Centre, School of Oriental and African Studies (SOAS) and University of Sussex.  

Why do we need your help?

We need your help to launch the charity!

We need your help to develop an easy-to-use website, a searchable Discovery platform for teachers, and to keep our resources free for schools all over the world.

We are also raising money to develop PositiveNegatives past and growing portfolio of ethnographic comics into interactive, educational tools.

We need your help to build a new interactive website to enable educational engagement around vital humanitarian issues. The website will have a dedicated section for teachers to enable easy lesson planning around different subjects, key topics and the length of lesson. 

The new Why Comics? site will also help general public understanding by building empathy with individuals, rather than presenting face-less statistics.

Help us make Why Comics? a free platform for schools all over the world!

** Have a look at our amazing pledge prizes! You can get a personal drawing from one of our great artists! **

How exactly will your money be helping us? 

Here is a breakdown of the costs:

  • £20,000 – Design and development of the interactive website for 14-18 year old students and their teachers
  1. £15,000 will go to web developers and designers to create the site
  2. £5,000 will pay for the project management, communication work and labour intensive research and development of the contextual links and designing national-curriculum relevant lesson plans.

We hope to raise at least £20,000 which will pay for the website itself, but we need to make sure we can make updates and further improvements in house.

Any additional funds raised will help:

  • £10,000 – development of the Content Management System (CMS) (so we can make updates in house).

**Check out the different pledges for the great prizes your donation can get you!! **

What happens if we don’t raise enough money?  

If we don’t raise enough money we will continue to send our existing materials (in the form of interactive pdfs) to teachers and schools who request them and apply for more funding of course!

We are currently writing applications for grant funding from: Big Lottery Fund, The Esmee Fairbairn Foundation, Paul Hamlyn Foundation and the Arts Council England. We are also utilising the Funding Central search platform to identify other grants, trusts and other forms of funding.

*                *                 *                 *                *  

“Teachers have said that ‘Why Comics? is such a useful, vital resource’ and they have ‘never seen their students so engaged’. Their pupils love it too and ‘can’t wait to see more’.

Building empathy is now more important than ever. It’s easier to be scared of people than to understand them. These vital human stories are missing in schools and Why Comics? can take them there.

That's it! Please pledge your support and together we can bring Why Comics? to life!

*                *                 *                 *                *  

Acknowledgements 

A special thanks to many, many people that have helped bring this project to life:

  • All of PositiveNegatives respondents – thank you for having the bravery to tell your story on the global stage – we could not do this work without you
  • PositiveNegatives amazing team of artists for breathing life into the comics
  • All of our great commissioners – thank you for funding PositiveNegatives great portfolio!
  • Hogan Lovells for all their help over the past year and helping us turn Why Comics? into a charity
  • The awesome team at IDEO for helping us with designs, concepts, the Why Comics? prototype and the crowdfunder video!
  • Tim at RealMedia.net for filming and editing this fabulous crowdfunder video
  • Enrica Masi for designing the fab Why Comics? logo
  • Ade Torrent: Old Cameras for help with filming and storyboarding
  • Teachers, students, schools, colleges and universities internationally for taking part in our pilot and for giving such excellent detailed feedback
  • All PositiveNegatives and Why Comics? friends and supporters around the world – we could not have done this without you!

Please contact us at comics@positivenegatives.org if you would like any further information or to receive our great free resources. See http://positivenegatives.org/why-comics/ for more information. Thank you. 

Thank you so much for your donation, we really appreciate it. Please also share on social media to help spread the word about this great project!!

PositiveNegatives amazing team of artists for breathing life into the comics
All of our great commissioners – thank you for funding PositiveNegatives great portfolio!

Hogan Lovells for all their help over the past year and helping us turn Why Comics? into a charity
The awesome team at IDEO for helping us with designs, concepts, the Why Comics? prototype and the crowdfunder video!
Tim at RealMedia.net for filming and editing this fabulous crowdfunder video

Enrica Masi for designing the fab Why Comics? logo
Ade Torrent: Old Cameras for help with filming and storyboarding
Teachers, students, schools, colleges and universities internationally for taking part in our pilot and for giving such excellent detailed feedback
All PositiveNegatives and Why Comics? friends and supporters around the world – we could not have done this without you!
Please contact us at comics@positivenegatives.org if you would like any further information or to receive our great free resources. See http://positivenegatives.org/why-comics/ for more information. Thank you. 
Thank you so much for your donation, we really appreciate it. Please also share on social media to help spread the word about this great project!!

story:
My First Festival cultivates love for cinema in children and it takes place in Peru. It is, in fact, the first children's film festival in Peru and includes a delicate curatorship of children's audio-visuals, workshops, master classes, concerts, children's jury and more. 

There have been two previous editions in 14 locations all over the country and this year we are launching the third one at the end of January. And this is where we need your help.

 

During these years we have achieved surprising results (the first ones to be surprised were us! You might want to check the results below). All of this was achieved through the prize we received for winning the National Competition for the Film Training given by the Ministry of Culture, through sponsorships and above all, through the passion and commitment of our Direction, Design and Production team. Their generous contribution of professionalism, time and resources made and keeps making this festival possible. 

 

Sadly, this year we do not have the prize funds and have limited sponsorship. So we decided to launch this campaign, in order for cinema loving people and kids’ creativity supporting folks to help this festival keep spreading happiness, curiosity and imagination to children in Peru. 

 

We need to cover some basic expenses for the Festival to take place. With the money raised we will pay for film copyrights, printing costs, transport, production costs and ads in social media & press. In order to have quality content we have to pay for all the copyrights. Additionally, this year we want to expand the festival to 6 boroughs of Lima: Barranco, Cantagallo, Comas, Los Olivos, Miraflores and San Isidro. Having a decentralized festival to reach more children regardless of their social condition increases the transportation costs. We must also advertise the festival with posters, printed programs and online ads. 

 

It is a lot to handle and we are doing everything in our power to keep this project on track, since we believe it is valuable and needed, especially in contexts like Peru. Any contribution will be greatly appreciated. It does not matter if it is much or little, it all adds up.

 

If you want to know more about the festival click here (www.miprimerfestival.net) and thank you for being part of this festival!

_______________________________

​

Mi Primer Festival siembra en los niños el amor por el cine y quiere seguir sembrando. Es, de verdad, el primer festival de cine para niños en el Perú que incluye una delicada curaduría de audiovisuales infantiles, talleres, clases maestras, conciertos, jurado de niños y muchas cosas más. Se ha realizado dos ediciones anteriores en 14 sedes en Lima y provincias y este año lanzamos la tercera edición a finales de enero. Para eso necesitamos tu ayuda.

 

Durante estos años hemos alcanzado resultados sorprendentes (los primeros sorprendidos hemos sido nosotros! ver los resultados abajo). Lo hemos logrado gracias a tener el premio del concurso nacional para la formación cinematográfica del Ministerio de Cultura, con auspicios y sobre todo con el empuje de todo el equipo de Dirección, Diseño y Producción del festival. Todos ellos hacen que este festival sea posible aportando su profesionalismo, tiempo, y recursos. Este año no tenemos los fondos del concurso y los auspicios han sido limitados. Por eso hemos lanzado esta campaña para que todas las personas que aman el cine, los niños y quieren que este festival siga igual de vivo y especial que antes nos ayude a cubrir algunos gastos básicos. No importa si es mucho o poco, todo suma.

 

Con el dinero recaudado pagaremos los derechos de las películas, la imprenta, el transporte, anuncios en redes sociales y prensa. Para tener contenido de calidad debemos pagar por los derechos y este año queremos llevaremos el festival a 6 distritos: Barranco, Comas, Los Olivos, Miraflores y San Isidro. Tener un festival descentralizado hace que los gastos en transporte son elevados. También debemos dar a conocer el festival para eso necesitamos afiches y programas impresos además de anuncios en redes. Y eso será todo. Para saber más del festival entra a (www.miprimerfestival.net). Muchas gracias por ser parte de este festival!

________________________________

 

Results Previous Years:

• More than 9,000 attendees

• More than 40 Audiovisual and artistic training workshops

• More than 1,700 participants in audiovisual and artistic training workshops

• 14 venues all over the country

• More than 90 short and long films

• 8 Concerts

story:
LLP is growing...

...and we'd like to bring you along for this life-changing & highly impactful journey!

 

A Little Bit of Our History

Learning Little People, LLC began April 15, 2013 with a focus on training teachers and school administrators in Alabama. Later, we added tutoring and enrichment services to our business model because we observed, first hand, the stark disparities in academic success for minority and less fortunate students, as well as students with mild to moderate disabilities. Our focus continues to be on learning, rather than schooling, and the LLP team understands the difference between the two.

In 2016, we partnered with the Birmingham Urban League to host our 1st annual Learning Little People Summer Enrichment (LLPSE) program. We offered reading, math, science, computer coding, Spanish, music, and physical activity workshops that kept our little people engaged all summer.

This year, we returned to the Urban League for the 2nd summer and thankfully, the Urban League sponsored the transportation for all of our field trips. Our little people traveled to places like Railroad Park, the Southern Museum of Flight, the Birmingham Museum of Art, Chuck E. Cheese's, and the Southern Environmental Center at Birmingham Southern College.

Although we are VERY grateful for the Urban League's continued support, we are excited about venturing out into our own building! 

 

Why We Need You

We believe that all little people deserve the best education. We understand, however, that many parents, especially minorities, can't afford to provide their children with the educational resources that they need. That's why LLPSE was created! Help us design and furnish what we hope will be a state-of-the-art urban learning facility.

Join us now and we'll include you, as much as you desire, in the process of outfitting our new building from top to bottom. With multiple classrooms and 1-on-1 tutoring/study rooms for optimal student learning, The Learning Little People Foundation will be the place that little people are eager to come for learning, exploration, and inspiration. 

Your donations will help us to:

​      

  • sheet rock and paint our walls in vibrant colors    
  • purchase & install carpet and laminate flooring 
  • install electrical wiring and lighting

We'll also use your donations to purchase:

  • furniture and books for our classrooms
  • furniture and supplies for tutoring rooms
  • technology for our computer coding workshops
  • furniture and books for our library
  • commercial kitchen equipment

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  1. Email your ideas and suggestions to us at admin@learninglittlepeople.com.
  2. Share our story with your family and friends.
  3. Like us on Facebook and follow us on Twitter.
  4. Donate new and gently-used books to our new library.
  5. Reach out to your local hardware or home improvement store for donations on our behalf.

 

LLPSE's 2016 Sponsor Page

 

LLPSE's 2017 Sponsor Page

story:
Join us in our mission.  

Receive some great benefits, too.

MUFON is the world’s largest and oldest organization dedicated to the scientific study of the UFO / ET phenomenon and the sharing of this information for the betterment of humanity.

For nearly 50 years, the Mutual UFO Network has been gathering and analyzing reports of unexplained aerial phenomenon all over the world.

Now, YOU can help us do more.

We are a 501.c.3 non-profit with a track record that speaks for itself.  Over 4000 members worldwide are united in delivering the truth.  Your support is tax deductible.

We believe that resolving the UFO / ET mystery is the biggest question facing humanity.  And we’re working on the answers.

We've gathered and investigated over 100,000 reports, and many of them are unsolved to this day.  The body of evidence in our files is overwhelming. 

What we will do with the funding:

1.) We will coordinate and deliver this material in a series of concise media productions,  much of which will be shared with the world via YouTube and social media.

We also have over 11 years of presentations by nearly everyone in the field, creating the most comprehensive archive of the journey for the truth truth ever assembled.  We will re-master the best of this material and deliver it to the world.

2.) From the Producers of "Unacknowledged", "Sirius", and "The True Story of Travis Walton",  we are launching great new media! We will expand MUFON Television, an already existing subscription site, into the world's best repository of commercial-free UFO / ET related information.

We will make the channel available on the web via app Roku and through Smart TV apps.

We will deliver new original shows, both free and premium versions.   Four of these are already in production.

"Experiencer": Actual hypnotic regression and analysis of the undeniable experiencer phenomenon. 

"This is disclosure": There are many who say that disclosure has already happened.  Are ET's revealing themselves to individuals on an ever increasing basis?  The answer seems to be "Yes".

"Bigger Questions:"  The hit Internet Show "Bigger Questions" comes to MUFON TV, which will be your place to view full episodes containing new ET- Related content.

"The MUFON Report"  This is our periodic video report, delivered from our own spaceship.

3.) We are expanding our role as the premiere organization advancing this cause.  That means more research, more discovery and more presentation.

These are our exciting new initiatives:

                                                       

MUFON EXPLORE:
While we continue to investigate the UFO Phenomenon, we are launching new research into UFO Technology,  the Experiencer Phenomenon and more.

                                                      

MUFON ACTIVATE:

Finally, there is community for those who insist on knowing the truth.  We support the work of activists and influencers are working every day to make a difference.  Your support adds to the chorus of voices, collectively demanding the truth.

                                                      

MUFON AWARE:

Through media outlets such as the new MUFON TV, and social media, we are creating public awareness campaigns and sharing vetted reports to increase public awareness, understanding, and knowledge.

When you help MUFON, you gain access to some great perks. 

We’ll send you something cool at every support level, but once you become a member, the rewards are only just beginning.  Enjoy great perks like this E-copy of "The Ultimate Guide to the Secret Space Program."

From the probable to the outlandish, the latest information (or not) is included here.  261 pages.  12 contributors.  Hundreds of Illustrations

                                        

 

MUFON CLASSIC PERKS:

 
MUFON FINE ART COLLECTION:
 
  Video
 
 

Join us at the Enhanced Membership Level for only $125.00, and you will receive:
 


MUFON MEMBERSHIP:
• Membership Card
• Monthly E-Journal (the best UFO magazine ever)
• Regular Email Updates
• VIP Member’s Only Website Access

MUFON TELEVISION:
• All access to the MUFON Video Archives - Commercial Free
• All access to 2017 Symposium Videos
• All access to the 2018 MUFON Symposium Live Stream
• All access to nearly 10 years of MUFON content and hundreds of other films and videos.
• New original programming and special edition reports and live shows.

All support above 125.00 gets MUFON membership and MUFON Television in addition to higher level perks.

Your support will help us expand our research and publish the results for the world to share.

Please support MUFON.  Be a part of the most important revelation in human history.  Make your voice count.  Share the journey.  Enjoy the rewards.

PLUS:  This awesome hard copy of Tom Keller's "The Total Novice's Guide to UFOs."

No matter what level you choose to help, your tax deductible donation is working hard for the benefit of humanity.

story:
We Just Want To Do Something To Help!

Everybody Gets To Eat, and Norwegian Couture has joined to uproot children of Cambodia from inhumane conditions of poverty through education.  Norwegian Couture has committed his BRAND to support Everybody Gets To Eat in building computer schools to teach children modern learning skills that gives a child hope and vision of a bright future.  Join us in this mission to help where it's most needed and change these innocent little lives through education.  We need your single act of kindness.

Imagine having no hope of an education then suddenly you can attend a school supplied with computers for automated learning.  Vision a computer in these children hands.....

Basic education is viewed worldwide as a human right and should not be denied to anyone who wants it.  Our original goal was building ten schools, but we decided to run our campaign with a small challenge only asking for your help to build two digital schools at $10,000 Each.  

You can help a child escape inhumane conditions of poverty by donating to support building digital schools equipped with teachers trained in lesson plans that surpass Cambodia public school curriculum.  Your contributions are not wasted.  Also, you Create Jobs by hiring local labor for school construction.  Carpenters can increase production from farming after raining season using money earn from building schools.

 

Founder Derrick Brown of Everybody Gets To Eat Inc. (EGTE)

EVERYBODY - Global Community

EAT- Nurture, Cultivate, Growth 

Derrick Brown is a former U.S. Government employee who confronted himself years ago to do something that matters in the fight against poverty and founded Everybody Gets To Eat Inc. in 2012.   In 2014 he resigned from work, sold his home, car, and other possessions to embark on an amazing single act of kindness to help underprivileged children of Southeast Asia and wow, he really did it.  Using only his Pension, Savings, and Volunteers, he managed to accomplish more than 40 humanitarian projects in remote areas of Cambodia, Vietnam, and Philippines supporting over thirty-five hundred children in their fight against poverty. This is the result of his single act of kindness.

 

Johannes Marseth owner of Norwegian Couture

Johannes Marseth of Oslo Norway started his fashion brand, Norwegian Couture in 2011 producing suits and blazers custom tailored for the edgy man who loves a BOLD signature brand.  Johannes says he admires Derrick’s integrity and sincere obligation to ensure that every dollar spent by his organization is not wasted on unnecessary expenditures. Also, the personal sacrifice that Derrick delivers to Everybody Gets To Eat played an important role in Johannes decision to select this organization as a collaborating partner for his brand to give back.

 

Education is one of the most important investments a country can make in its people and its future.

 

Why Are We Here? 

Cambodia is one of the most disadvantaged and poorest countries in Southeast Asia with nearly half the population living on less than $2 per day. Restricted access to education is one of the surest ways of transmitting poverty from generation to generation. When children can't Read, Count, or acquire the necessary life skills they continue the poverty cycle. Education contributes to the reduction of both absolute and relative poverty. Basic education, in particular, helps to alleviate poverty by helping poor people improve their lives. Mothers with some education raise healthier families. 

 

2016 Derrick travels over 1.5k kilometers (600 miles) in two days to assess school developments sites in far remote provinces of Cambodia. 

 

During his visit he met with local children and in them he witnesses uncertainty, and no hope of a future in their eyes.  However they knew that education is the key to freeing them from a life time of suffering in poverty. 
 
 
 

Derrick was so convince that Everybody Gets To Eat was on track with its strategy that the first small school was built December 2016 in Rovieng Province Cambodia. 

The children love their new school that's supplied with a computer for automated learning and are excited to have a place to gather where they can learn.

Our impact is measurable!

 

Your single act of kindness

IEstimated School Development cost (10,000 each)

  • Each school is built and designed at discretion of the local community
  • Local carpenters are hired for school construction (we create jobs)
  • Construction\Land cost  ($5,500)
  • Solar panels ($300)
  • Two Computers ($1,100)
  • 45 students tables, chairs, school material ($1,500)
  • Digital Smart Board ($300)
  • Small library (1,300)

 

Make some noise and get the word out about our campaign!

Please share our story with family and friends and become a partner in Everybody Gets To Eat mission to achieve a worthy cause in helping children to dream and see a positive future with real expectation of it becoming reality.

Also we have Perks!  Your donations can get you a beautiful EGTE Shoulder Bag or one of our signature t-shirts as a thank you.

EVERYBODY - Global Community
EAT- Nurture, Cultivate, Growth 
Derrick Brown is a former U.S. Government employee who confronted himself years ago to do something that matters in the fight against poverty and founded Everybody Gets To Eat Inc. in 2012.   In 2014 he resigned from work, sold his home, car, and other possessions to embark on an amazing single act of kindness to help underprivileged children of Southeast Asia and wow, he really did it.  Using only his Pension, Savings, and Volunteers, he managed to accomplish more than 40 humanitarian projects in remote areas of Cambodia, Vietnam, and Philippines supporting over thirty-five hundred children in their fight against poverty. This is the result of his single act of kindness.
 

Johannes Marseth owner of Norwegian Couture 
Johannes Marseth of Oslo Norway started his fashion brand, Norwegian Couture in 2011 producing suits and blazers custom tailored for the edgy man who loves a BOLD signature brand.  Johannes says he admires Derrick’s integrity and sincere obligation to ensure that every dollar spent by his organization is not wasted on unnecessary expenditures. Also, the personal sacrifice that Derrick delivers to Everybody Gets To Eat played an important role in Johannes decision to select this organization as a collaborating partner for his brand to give back.
 
Education is one of the most important investments a country can make in its people and its future.
 

Why Are We Here? 
Cambodia is one of the most disadvantaged and poorest countries in Southeast Asia with nearly half the population living on less than $2 per day. Restricted access to education is one of the surest ways of transmitting poverty from generation to generation. When children can't Read, Count, or acquire the necessary life skills they continue the poverty cycle. Education contributes to the reduction of both absolute and relative poverty. Basic education, in particular, helps to alleviate poverty by helping poor people improve their lives. Mothers with some education raise healthier families. 
 
2016 Derrick travels over 1.5k kilometers (600 miles) in two days to assess school developments sites in far remote provinces of Cambodia. 


 

During his visit he met with local children and in them he witnesses uncertainty, and no hope of a future in their eyes.  However they knew that education is the key to freeing them from a life time of suffering in poverty. 

 
 
 
Derrick was so convince that Everybody Gets To Eat was on track with its strategy that the first small school was built December 2016 in Rovieng Province Cambodia. 

The children love their new school that's supplied with a computer for automated learning and are excited to have a place to gather where they can learn.
Our impact is measurable!

 
Your single act of kindness
IEstimated School Development cost (10,000 each)

Each school is built and designed at discretion of the local community
Local carpenters are hired for school construction (we create jobs)
Construction\Land cost  ($5,500)
Solar panels ($300)
Two Computers ($1,100)
45 students tables, chairs, school material ($1,500)
Digital Smart Board ($300)
Small library (1,300)

 
Make some noise and get the word out about our campaign!
Please share our story with family and friends and become a partner in Everybody Gets To Eat mission to achieve a worthy cause in helping children to dream and see a positive future with real expectation of it becoming reality.
Also we have Perks!  Your donations can get you a beautiful EGTE Shoulder Bag or one of our signature t-shirts as a thank you.

story:
The Origin Story of the AC Trump Museum Project

Hi! My name is Levi Fox and I'm an Atlantic City Historian, Tour Guide, and Adjunct Professor. I'm also a part of the Trump Museum Committee, which hopes to soon bring an exhibit to AC. When giving a post-election 'Trump's Gambling Heritage Tour' for my company, Jersey Shore Tours, I hit upon the idea that a Trump themed museum exhibit could help to benefit local tourism. After reaching out to colleagues, we began looking for artifacts and stories from Trump casinos, and we are now seeking funding to pay for the foundation of a non-profit group to manage the project and the costs of storing artifacts prior to an exhibit.

How You Can Help and Why You Might Want To

We are currently looking for $2000 to cover the costs associated with creating a non-profit entity to manage the project and the fees to store artifacts prior to an exhibit. Roughly $1500 will go to pay for the legal advice and the registration of documents needed to formally create a Trump Museum Organization, which will make it easier to raise additional funding for the future via partnerships and grants. The remaining roughly $500 will pay for storing artifacts in a place where they can be cataloged and safely remain until an exhibit or permanent archive is created.​ We will continue fundraising efforts whether or not we reach this short term goal of $2000, since the project will require more funding for a temporary exhibit or permanent display to succeed. This is only our first fundraising effort!

Silver level contributors of $5 or more will be recognized on the project website:  www.TrumpMuseum.org. Gold level contributors of $20 or more will also receive two tickets to an exhibit, whenever it opens. Platinum level contributors of $45 or more will also get two invitations to a special sneak preview event. Diamond level contributors of $75 also get two tickets for a 'Trump Tour' by Jersey Shore Tours.

Why Now Is The Time For A Trump Exhibit In AC

As Donald Trump prepares to take the oath of office as President in just a few days, public interest in his legacy as founder of several now-defunct casinos in Atlantic City continues to grow. Indeed, the shuttering of the Trump Taj Mahal on October 10th, 2016 by Trump’s economic advisor Carl Icahn has led to nearly 3,000 newly unemployed workers in an area that already lost almost 10,000 local jobs when the Trump Plaza and three other Boardwalk casinos closed in 2014. The Taj’s closing also marked the end of an historical era that began in 1984 with the opening of the Plaza, a period when there was always at least one Trump branded casino operating in Atlantic City. After exploring the idea over the last few weeks, the Trump Museum Committee has received offers of artifacts and stories from locals, as well as interest from the general public in staging an exhibit about this ‘Age of Trump in Atlantic City’, and we are now moving forward!

Hurdles Standing In The Way Of A Trump Exhibit

Putting on an 'Age of Trump in Atlantic City' exhibit --let alone creating a Trump Museum-- will be both challenging and time consuming, especially building a balanced display to high scholarly standards. As a professional public historian completing my doctorate at Temple University, I believe that any such effort involving the broader community also needs to work hard to include diverse voices, so one challenge to this project will be making sure people are aware that it will be designed to reflect the various views of local Atlantic City area residents, rather than as some sort of shrine. Through public outreach the Trump Museum Committee hopes to mitigate the possibility of people misunderstanding what a Trump Museum exhibit in Atlantic City might focus upon. Moreover, both this problem and another potential obstacle, the slim possibility that not enough artifacts are donated to hold an exhibit, can be lessened by getting the word out.

Other Ways To Contribute Besides Giving Money

Even if you can't contribute to our funding goal you can still help the AC Trump Museum Project. The Trump Museum Committee has already started accepting artifacts relating to Trump’s five casinos and collecting stories from those who lived or worked in Atlantic City over the last four decades. Anything related to marketing Trump Castle, Trump Marina, or Trump World’s Fair is especially needed, but all types of objects from photos and playing cards to towels and trays that help to narrate the story of Trump’s Atlantic City casinos are sought with an initial goal of staging a pop-up museum or temporary exhibit as soon as summer 2017 at a location to be determined. Personal stories and images contributed by the community might also end up becoming part of a related book project that has been proposed on Donald Trump’s Atlantic City, and donations may later become part of an archive for scholarly research. Beyond stories and artifacts, you can help create awareness of the project by sharing this campaign!

story:
Learn C# And Unity And Become A Professional Game Developer

Hi, my name is Fahir and I've been making games for more than 3 years now, and teaching people how to do the same for over 2 years. Since the first time I saw a computer I knew what I wanted to do in my life, and that is make games. However, when I started to learn how to create games I got lost and confused because the tutorials on YouTube and other websites did not explain game development very well, and the examples were always presented with a simple cube.

I finally managed to learn game development but I learned it myself, since the resources on the internet were not very useful, and this made me think - What if I create an online course I wish I had when I started to learn game development. And I did, I created Master Unity By Building 6 Fully Featured Games course which was a HUGE success, and it has attracted more than 14,000 students.

Now I want to do the same with this course.

What is Unity3D

Unity3D is a professional 2D and 3D game development engine used by thousands indie game developers as well as big game development companies such as Ubisoft, Eidos Montreal, and Blizzard. Unity3D is cross-platform, which means you build your game once and you can publish it for iOS, Android, PC, Mac, Linux, Xbox, PS4 and other platforms. The good thing is that Unity3D has a free plan that you and I can use to create games, even if we earn money from the games that we create.

The Course

I am a self-taught programmer, so I know what it feels like to be a beginner, that's why I made this course project-based so students will not just be learning dry programming concepts, but applying them immediately to real games as you go. All the project files will be included, as well as additional references and resources. One of the good things about this course is that it is hosted on Udemy and you can watch the videos whenever you want and how many times you want, and the best part of the course is that I am available every day to answer any questions you might have, so you'll never get stuck.

What Will Be Covered In The Course

This course is comprehensive, if you're a beginner don't worry, I will hold your hand from the very start. I plan to cover the very basic things early on in the course, so you will know everything before we even begin to develop our games.

Take a look at the concepts that I plan to cover in the course:

  • Introduction To Programming In C#
  • Intermediate Programming In C#
  • Advanced Programming In C#
  • Unity's Interface
  • Importing And Organizing Assets
  • Materials
  • Shaders
  • Particle System
  • Unity's UI System
  • Creating Menus
  • Navigating From Menus
  • Animating Menus
  • Animating 3D Models
  • Adding Events In Our Animations
  • Calling Animations From Code
  • Procedural Level Generation
  • Pooling Techniques
  • Melee Battle Systems
  • Boss Fights
  • Collectable Items
  • Score Systems
  • Creating Beautiful Cut Scenes
  • Using Lightning To Create Mood In Our Games
  • Basic Artificial Intelligence
  • Intermediate Artificial Intelligence
  • Game Managers
  • And much more

By the end you will learn how to plan, design, create, optimize and publish your games on any platform, and you can even apply for Jr. Game Developer jobs as a Unity 3D developer.

Why will this course be better than existing courses?

The course is going to be project-based, so students will be able to learn by creating real world games and see tips and tricks the pros use in their games. I am an experienced coder and avid gamer, so I am able to explain complex concepts clearly. And I have a teaching style where I use different approaches to achieve the same thing and talk about the cons and pros one way has over another, and I don't cover a topic only once and stop talking about it for the rest of the course, instead I revisit topics because the best way to learn is by repeating. I am also a fun and engaging teacher, so you will not be bored during the lectures and I am available every day for help.

Who is this for

Anyone who wants to learn to create games: Unity 3D is a fantastic platform which enables you to make production-quality games. Furthermore these games can be created for Windows, MacOS, iOS, Android, Consoles, and other platforms all from a single source!

This will be a full course, if you're a complete beginner, I will teach you all the coding and game design principles you'll need. If you're an artist, I will teach you to bring your assets to life. If you're a coder,  I will teach you game design principles. 

I've taught more than 22,000 people how to code and make games

I mentioned that I am teaching online for more than 2 years. Since I started, I have taught over 22,000 people how to code and make games, and they said some nice things about me:

Students From YouTube:

Students From Udemy:

 

 

 

 

 

 

What are the different rewards?

I believe that my courses are the best that you can find online, and because of that I would love that everyone can benefit from my courses by the lowest price possible. The prices you see below are going to be the lowest prices for my courses and I only offer them during my fund raising campaigns, after the campaign ends the courses will not be this cheap, so choose your reward level wisely.

This reward level will grant you full access to the course once its released. The full price of the course will be $195, this is your chance to get it for only $7

The course I am going to create will be concentrated only on making 3D games, if you want to learn how to make 2D games as well, then you should choose this reward level because it includes the Learn To Make 3D Games With Unity course and my best selling course Master Unity By Building 6 Fully Featured Games From Scratch where I teach how to create awesome 2D games with all features such as menus, animations, selecting different levels, characters, weapon select system, saving game data and much more. The full price of these courses is $390, this is your chance to get them for $9

Along with Learn To Make 3D Games With Unity and my best selling course Master Unity By Building 6 Fully Featured Games From Scratch this reward level will also get you my second best selling course Unity: From Master To Pro.  Unity: From Master To Pro is a sequel to my best selling course and it goes into advanced scripting and techniques that you can use to create your dream game. The value of these three courses is $575, choose this reward level and get them for only $11

So you really want to master all aspects of unity, then this reward level is for you. It includes all courses from "Intermediate Unity Developer" package plus my Create Old Arcade Games With Unity Game Engine course. This course also uses advanced coding to teach you how to build game mechanics like in the old arcade games such as pacman, arkanoid, and space shooter. Choose this reward level and get $730 worth of value courses for only $13

Learning how to make games in unity is not enough for you? No problem, I got you covered with this reward level which includes everything from "Can't Get Enough Of Unity" package plus my Complete iOS Game Course Using SpriteKit And Swift 3 where you will learn how to make games for iOS and Mac OS by using SpriteKit and Apple's fast growing programming language Swift. Combined all these courses are worth $900, with this reward level I am offering them to you for only $15

So you want to be a game development wizard, well you can do that with this reward level which includes everything from the "Unity And SpriteKit Developer" package plus my Complete LibGDX And Java Game Development course where you will learn how to make games by using the worlds most popular programming language Java. Choose this reward level and get all my game development courses for $17 only, their total value is $1070

Want to know how to make games and apps? This reward level will help you. It includes every game development course that I have and my Java Developer Course and Complete iOS 10 And Swift 3 Developer Course, in total you will get 8 courses which for me is a no brainer deal. And above that, the combined value of all my courses is $1390, if you choose this reward level you can get them for only $19

I have only one stretch goal for this course and that is $30,000. If we reach this amount in funding I will create a First Person Shooter game with all features such as selecting different weapons and levels in the game, and enemies AI(Artificial Intelligence) where enemies will be able to navigate the whole level, search for the player and shoot him.

When Will The Course Be Ready?

The course is going to be very large, my rough estimate is that the course will have 50+ hours. Because of that as soon as I finish the first 20-30 hours of the course I will make that available to you guys which by my calculations will be in April, but it is very likely that it will be earlier. The course will then be added-to until it's finished, which I aim to be in summer or even earlier, but I will do my best to get the full course out as soon as possible. If we hit our stretch goal then I will need time to create the first person shooter game which will be around one month + recording time(I will of course record and publish all other parts of the course before I begin with the first person shooter).

Risks & Challenges

There is always a risk that the aliens will kidnap me and force me to teach them game development, if that does not happen I am pretty confident that I will deliver the course on time.

Thanks

Thank you so much for your interests in my course, please consider pledging and help me make an epic Unity3D Course.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute but would still love to help out then you can share the campaign on social media and let your friends know.
