story:
Museum of Goa is one of the largest contemporary art spaces in the country, visited by over 15,000 people last year including 5,000 children. It is driven by the idea of breaking cultural barriers which exist in the country to take art to the masses. We believe in the power of art to communicate ideas and bring about social change.

Carpet of Joy

Although Goa is best known for its pristine coastlines, rolling hills and exemplary species of marine, plant and animal life – this ecological haven is steadily eroding. There is plastic litter everywhere. Even the ‘educated’ and the rich litter shamelessly. We believe that this situation can only be changed with the education of our children. The ‘Anti-litter’ idea has to be inculcated from an early age. Museum of Goa is planning a project, Carpet of Joy, to spread this very idea against littering. 


3,000 children will create 150,000 flowers of different colors using discarded plastic bottles. These plastic flowers will form a 2,000 square meter carpet which will rise about 12 meters high into the sky at one end. A 9 meter tall tree will be a part of the installation, juxtaposing the toxic and the organic. 
The Carpet of Joy  is inspired by the Israeli artist and architect, Uri De Beer. De Beer has created many such installations including the one in front of the Israeli Parliament in Tel Aviv. He calls the flowers plastiflora.

Contemporary Installation artist and Founding Director of Museum of Goa, Dr. Subodh Kerkar, has visualized a unique composition for Carpet of Joy  based on Uri De Beer's original concept. 

With your help, Museum of Goa will manifest this important collaborative work. 


The Anti-Litter Oath 


A viewing platform will be created at the venue. There will be a podium for taking the 'Anti-litter’ oath. As soon as the viewer's hand is raised, a sound will be heard - ‘I shall not litter’

The Anti-Litter Oath is a unique, symbolic interaction conceived by Dr. Subodh Kerkar. 


Location 
The Carpet of Joy will be created in the field next to the Saligao Circle. It will be 17 m broad and 100 m long. 

Duration 
The Carpet of Joy will be on view for a period of three months from March - May, 2017 

 

Funding


We are seeking financial support for this project through crowd funding since it aims at educating everyone including children to create a litter free environment. We would like to raise USD 8000 (INR 5,00,000), which will cover  a portion of our costs: 

Iron Scaffolding USD 4,500 (INR 3,00,000)

Plastic Net USD 4,500 (INR 3,00,000)

Painting USD 4,500 (INR 3,00,000)

Labor and Security USD 2,300 (1,50,000)

Lighting USD 3,700 (2,50,000)

You can support us in other ways

  1. Volunteer your skills – photography, digital marketing, journalism and event organization
  2.  Get the word out - put us on your facebook, instagram, tumblr or blog to get people talking

We are thankful to our community of backers!

We look forward to hearing your thoughts and feedback. Don't hesitate to reach us at mail@museumofgoa.com or +917722089666,
story_txt:
Museum of Goa is one of the largest contemporary art spaces in the country, visited by over 15,000 people last year including 5,000 children. It is driven by the idea of breaking cultural barriers which exist in the country to take art to the masses. We believe in the power of art to communicate ideas and bring about social change.Carpet of JoyAlthough Goa is best known for its pristine coastlines, rolling hills and exemplary species of marine, plant and animal life – this ecological haven is steadily eroding. There is plastic litter everywhere. Even the ‘educated’ and the rich litter shamelessly. We believe that this situation can only be changed with the education of our children. The ‘Anti-litter’ idea has to be inculcated from an early age. Museum of Goa is planning a project, Carpet of Joy, to spread this very idea against littering. 3,000 children will create 150,000 flowers of different colors using discarded plastic bottles. These plastic flowers will form a 2,000 square meter carpet which will rise about 12 meters high into the sky at one end. A 9 meter tall tree will be a part of the installation, juxtaposing the toxic and the organic. The Carpet of Joy  is inspired by the Israeli artist and architect, Uri De Beer. De Beer has created many such installations including the one in front of the Israeli Parliament in Tel Aviv. He calls the flowers plastiflora.Contemporary Installation artist and Founding Director of Museum of Goa, Dr. Subodh Kerkar, has visualized a unique composition for Carpet of Joy  based on Uri De Beer's original concept. With your help, Museum of Goa will manifest this important collaborative work. 
The Anti-Litter Oath

As soon as the viewer's hand is raised, a sound will be heard - ‘I shall not litter’The Anti-Litter Oath is a unique, symbolic interaction conceived by Dr. Subodh Kerkar. Location The Carpet of Joy will be created in the field next to the Saligao Circle. story:
Short Summary

  • I am a Costa Rican musician that wants to study in a well-known music school. All my life has been with music I learned how to sing, how to play guitar, piano, banjo, ukulele, bass and drums. It's easy to me how to learn new things like play new instruments. So I want to take advantage of my musical experience by studying in a well-known music school.
  • This is to important to me because I love music and I will love to study it, but here in my country we don't have a college of music, and my dream is to be able to study in a well-known college of music
  • If you help me by making a contribution of money, you will be helping me to study the thing that I love the most; music. You will help me to make my dream come true. I will be too grateful with every person that help me in this campaign.

What We Need & What You Get

  • I need the funding amount to pay the cost of attendance in a music school. Even if I get a scholarship I will use all the contributions to my studies.
  • If you make me get in a music school you will be part of my dream makers.
  • If I don't reach my entire goal the money still will help me to apply in a music school.

The Impact

  • With your contribution this campaign will be a good example of a musician or any person that wants to make his/her dream come true. You will be proud of helping someone making hois dream come true.
  • I will let you know in this campaign if I make it through. Every funding will be use it for Gabriel's studies.

Risks & Challenges

  • I know that I am a good musician and people tell me that too. But I haven't be able to study music in a college. This is the opportunitty to make my dream come true.
  • My plan to solve these problems is to apply for a scholarship in a good well-known music school and do whatever I have to do to mak me able to study the music career.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you share this campaign to your friends, familiars or people you know, you will be helping me a lot:')
  • You can use the Indiegogo share tools too!

story:
The fields of software, computing and computer science are plagued by tremendous underrepresentation of women, African Americans, and Hispanics. 

In high school, the Advanced Placement exam in Computer Science has the worst gender diversity across all courses, with 78 percent participation by men and 22 percent by women. Participation by students of color is 13 percent. These underrepresented groups represent 65 percent of the entire US population!

Go to: https://code.org/diversity

Data 360 is introducing the first risk mitigation platform for Fair Chance Hiring as a part of Freshstart Bootcamp

Data 360 and the Mayor's Office of Economic Opportunity are looking to collaborate with you with your personal passion and professional expertise to advise, volunteer, mentor and sponsor the Fair Chance Hiring platform.

The platform is hosted on the Domo platform and provide key insights into how to best help candidates cross the finish line and find  sustainable long-term careers in corporate careers.

To learn more about fair chance hiring go to, http://www.fairchancehiring.com.

story:
Gofundme.com

 

 

LEGAL NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATION 501c3

www.aaeaall50states.com

 

The African American Entrepreneurial Academy

also known as the A.A.E.A. is the world’s first entrepreneurial educational facility totally dedicated to building strong, successful and productive African American Men and Women across the United States. The idea was born after bearing witness to multiple decades of African-American men being forgotten by their government, society, their women and being targeted for termination and extinction by the powers that be. The African American Entrepreneurial Academy has furthermore become painfully aware that black people can expect little to no assistance from society as it relates to employment opportunities. As a result, we at the A.A.E.A. have decided that in order to secure the future of our people nationally, we would need to educate and train our African American men and women in entrepreneurial endeavors so that they may create their own jobs through companies they start after graduating the A.A.E.A. When these students graduate from the African American Entrepreneur Academy, they will leave with the relevant knowledge to help them launch, maintain, advertise and grow their very own successful small businesses while being monitored and mentored continuously. Additionally, we anticipate that these new black business owners will residually create thousands of subsequent jobs for others in their communities. Students will also be taught additional studies, information and teachings that they may have missed out from both or either of their parents. So, we ask that you embark on this ambitious and monumental journey with us as we attempt the change the destiny and plight of our precious black men and women across the United States.

 

THE $10,000 WILL BE USED THE FOLLOWING WAY:

 

- HIRE A PUBLICIST TO GET THE PRESIDENT RADIO/TV AIR TIME, PRINT MEDIA (MAGAZINES) SO HE CAN ARTICULATE HIS VISION TO THE WORLD.

- SEND OUR PRESS RELEASE TO OVER 100,000 MEDIA OUTLETS.

_ HIRE A TEAM OF 5,000 ENERGETIC AND  MOTIVATED FUNDRAISERS TO HELP US RAISE ADDITIONAL CAPITAL BY WAY OF OUR AAEA DONATION TICKETS WE WILL HAVE PRINTED http://africanamericanentrepreneurialacademy.co...

 

HERE IS HOW WE CAN BE SUCCESSFUL:

 

$10,000 initial fundraiser.  The $10,000 can get us 

$50,000.  Once the $50,000 is acquired we can generate upwards of $500,000 from a massive national campaign.  Then when we have the $500,000 we can market to the world more effectively to ultimately get the $1,000,000 needed for the academy. 

 

So $10,000, $50,000, $500,000 to $1million. Four successful gofundme campaigns and we are there.  Sounds like a lot but we can do anything together as one group of people united.

 

OUR MISSION; is to teach millions of black men and women across the United States of America everything they need to know on how to start, grow and maintain a black-owned business within their communities.

 

The benefits would be so great that the entire United States would benefits. Here’s how:

 

- Six million salaried workers paying taxes could generate more than $120 billion dollars annually.

- Six million salaries could ease the burden on the government’s $701 billion dollar relief welfare obligation by 33%, thus helping the government to save $233 billion per year.

- Since blacks comprise approximately one million of the prison systems’ 2.2 million population, 6 million newly employed blacks would save the government 50% of the prison industrial complexes’ annual budget to equal $31 billion dollars saved.

- Our economy where goods and services are purchased could benefit tremendously from a revenue injection of $120 billion. Just think of how housing, cars, hotels, travel industry, food, dining, clothing and product manufacturing, entertainment and sports venues could all benefit. This cash infusion would inspire companies to start hiring more people of all races.

- What about 6,000,000 more people paying into the healthcare industry?

These new jobs will also strengthen the social security coffers and we’ll all benefit from that. Both for people who are retired, retiring and those who will be retiring in the not too distant future.

- Within 10 years, the $120 billion could grow tenfold to an extra one trillion dollars which would strengthen America’s Gross Domestic Product (GDP) immensely.

And finally, the entire world would start to feel the effects of these one-million new companies as they begin to grow and prosper.

story:
My name is Mamadou Ndiaye. I live in Providence Rhode Island with my family.  I am originally from Senegal as you can tell from my name and I am passionate about my homeland. I am launching a campaign to raise funds to launch after school enrichment activities including homework help and tutoring on behalf of the children of Guediawaye my hometown near Dakar Senegal. Guediawaye is a town near Dakar Senegal with a high concentration of kids and young adults. Your donation will help us buy school supplies, snacks, and pay stipends for tutors, and cover our overhead expenses. We are starting this initiative which we hope to scale to reach millions of additional children throughout Senegal and Africa.  

What We Need & What You Get

Our Goal is to raise $10,000 to run the pilot which we will supplement with local in-kind donations. We will serve 75 children in this pilot for a period of 20-25 weeks.  We will keep costs low by training local youth - high school seniors and college students - to run the program under the supervision of a local coordinator.

The Impact

Senegal, like many African countries, faces a wide range of challenges that impede its economic advancement. We propose to leverage young people to take the lead to identify and solve the country's most pressing challenges which includes providing an adequate education to its children. 

Below is a breakdown of how far your donation will go:

  • Program cost: $120 per child  
  • $180 pays for 1 tutor for 20 weeks 
  • $20 pays for school supplies for one child for the duration of the program  

Risks & Challenges

We are fully aware that running a project like this in Senegal is not without risk including identifying and recruiting the right staff and tutors i.e. people who are passionate about giving back to their communities and helping children succeed. To mitigate these types of risks, we decided to start with a pilot and intend to identify key lessons which we will use in the next phase of our work. Our board of directors will work closely with the local coordinator in Senegal to oversee the execution of the pilot. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We started  Jeunesse Action, Inc to put young people in the driver's seat to solve Senegal's most pressing challenges. We need all the help we can get in the areas of fundraising, marketing, business and board development. 

Thank you for your support!

story:
Short Summary

Born in 1952 in Santa Fe of Chicano and Apache descent, Jimmy Santiago Baca was abandoned by his parents and at 13 ran away from the orphanage where his grandmother had placed him. He was convicted on drug charges in 1973 and spent five years in prison. There he learned to read and began writing poetry. His semiautobiographical novel in verse, Martin and Meditations on the South Valley (1987), received the 1988 Before Columbus Foundation’s American Book Award in 1989. In addition to over a dozen books of poetry, he has published memoirs, essays, stories, and a screenplay, Bound by Honor (1993), which was made into a feature-length film directed by Taylor Hackford.

Baca has conducted writing workshops in prisons, libraries, and universities across the country for more than 30 years. In 2004 he launched Cedar Tree, a literary nonprofit designed to provide writing workshops, training, and outreach programs for at-risk youth, prisoners and ex-prisoners, and disadvantaged communities. Baca holds a BA in English and an honorary PhD in literature from the University of New Mexico.

With his continued commitment to support and improve the conditions of communities that are in most need, Jimmy Santiago Baca has revamped and outfitted his RV and trailer to be a bookmobile that will go straight to barrio street corners, parking lots and festivals, to make reading attractive, fun and easy...  and he is asking for YOUR HELP!

Your contributions will put books in children’s and emerging adult reader’s hands on a regular basis and make literacy attractive and engaging in economically depressed areas. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need bookshelves, books for circulation, a set of folding tables and chairs, furniture and supplies for the coffee machines and snacks, an artificial lawn that we can roll out in front of the bookmobile and preliminary funding for staff. 

Here is what you will get when you contribute:

$49.00 and under – your name in a bookmobile book as donator, and we will take a photo of  the book cover and the page, with your name on it and send it to you.   

$50.00— AUDIO LIBRARY

$100.00- AUDIO & VIDEO LIBRARY

$ 250.00-  THE ABOVE PLUS SIGNED 1ST EDITION HARDCOVER

$ 500.00- THE ABOVE PLUS TWO SIGNED COLLECTOR’S TITLES

$ 750.00- THE ABOVE PLUS I EDIT 15 PAGES OF YOUR WORK

$ 1,000.00- THE ABOVE PLUS 30 PAGES EDITED

$. 2,500.00- THE ABOVE PLUS 3 DAYS AT RETREAT HOUSE

$ 5,000.00- THE ABOVE PLUS A WEEK AT RETREAT HOUSE

$ 10,000.00- THE ABOVE PLUS YOU GET TO JOIN THE BOOKMOBILE TEAM FOR A DAY

$ 15.000.00- THE ABOVE PLUS A COPY OF MY WRITING WEBINAR TEXTBOOK

$ 20.000- THE ABOVE PLUS THE ILLUSTRATED CHILDREN’S BOOK SERIES

All funds, regardless of whether we make our goal or not, will go toward selecting and purchasing books for circulation, as well, outfitting the RV for remaining needs for operation.  

The Impact

The Baca Bookmobile will create the same excitement and anticipation that the neighborhood ice cream truck has when it rolls down the street.  Children, families and adults will know that wherever it stops, they will be able to sit down in the shade, find a book that interests them and read in their community.  If they do not have this opportunity, readers in these communities will have to depend on their trips to schools and libraries. Baca’s Bookmobile brings reading straight to the doorstep of those who need books the most.  

Risks & Challenges

The greatest risk and consideration is to maintain the book circulation and collection.  Readers are welcome to buy any book they’d like, but if they cannot afford it, then they can borrow a book. Each book will have a unique Baca’s Bookmobile stamp. If anyone returns a book, in good condition, with the bookmobile stamp and the original receipt from checkout, we will allow them to exchange it for another book.  We don’t know how this system will work out, until we’ve used it for at least three months. 

We know that when you just give books away, it will be read once and then put aside.  How do we keep books circulating in the communities in a way that is borrower friendly and consistently rotated and replenished.  This is what we don’t know and will continue to strategize over as we refine the system. 

Scheduling the bookmobile locations will be important in creating a predictable time that readers can depend on to read and return books.  In addition of Jimmy Santiago Baca, our team consists of artists, literacy specialists and educators and logistical specialists.  We will take great care in securing a high quality, high interest and varied reading level book collection, and cultural programming at bookmobile presentations that will engage community readers.  We will always be troubleshooting and strategizing to increase participation, build our book collection and promote a reading life for all participants. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot assist us financially in this endeavor, please do share our campaign with others.  Thank you so much!

The greatest risk and consideration is to maintain the book circulation and collection.  Readers are welcome to buy any book they’d like, but if they cannot afford it, then they can borrow a book. Each book will have a unique Baca’s Bookmobile stamp. If anyone returns a book, in good condition, with the bookmobile stamp and the original receipt from checkout, we will allow them to exchange it for another book.  We don’t know how this system will work out, until we’ve used it for at least three months. 
We know that when you just give books away, it will be read once and then put aside.  How do we keep books circulating in the communities in a way that is borrower friendly and consistently rotated and replenished.  This is what we don’t know and will continue to strategize over as we refine the system. 
Scheduling the bookmobile locations will be important in creating a predictable time that readers can depend on to read and return books.  In addition of Jimmy Santiago Baca, our team consists of artists, literacy specialists and educators and logistical specialists.  We will take great care in securing a high quality, high interest and varied reading level book collection, and cultural programming at bookmobile presentations that will engage community readers.  We will always be troubleshooting and strategizing to increase participation, build our book collection and promote a reading life for all participants. 

Other Ways You Can Help
If you cannot assist us financially in this endeavor, please do share our campaign with others.  Thank you so much!

story:
The Visiting ​Writers’ ​​Series at Seton ​Catholic ​ ​High ​School began​ ​in ​2009, ​ ​modeled ​ ​after my ​ ​experience ​ ​as ​ ​a ​ ​Creative ​ ​Writing ​ ​graduate ​ ​student ​ ​at ​ ​Binghamton ​ ​University. ​ ​My ​ ​plan ​ ​was ​ ​to bring ​ ​in ​ ​one ​ ​writer ​ ​a ​ ​month​ ​to ​ ​share ​ ​their ​ ​experiences ​​and ​ ​give ​ ​advice. ​​The ​ ​students also ​ ​read ​ ​the ​ ​writer's ​ ​work, ​ ​so ​ ​they ​ ​could ​ ​ask ​ ​critical ​ ​questions ​ ​about ​ ​it.

In ​ ​our ​ ​first ​ ​year, ​ ​(2009-2010) ​ ​several ​ ​notable ​ ​authors ​ ​visited ​ ​Seton, ​ ​among ​ ​them ​ ​critically acclaimed ​ ​and ​ ​widely ​ ​popular ​ ​YA ​ ​Fantasy ​ ​author ​ ​Brian ​ ​Davis, ​ ​USA ​ ​Today ​ ​Bestselling ​ ​Author,Tom ​ ​Montelone, ​ ​and ​ ​author ​ ​and ​ ​HarperTeen ​ ​acquisitions ​ ​editor ​ ​Claudia ​ ​Gabel. ​ ​Using ​ ​funds earned ​ ​at ​ ​Barnes ​ ​& ​ ​Noble ​ ​bookfairs, ​ ​we ​ ​were ​ ​able ​ ​to ​ ​pay ​ ​the ​ ​authors ​ ​a ​ ​small ​ ​stipend, ​ ​as ​ ​well ​​as provide ​ ​books ​ ​for ​ ​my ​ ​Creative ​ ​Writing ​ ​students ​. ​ ​The ​ ​authors ​ ​would ​ ​not ​ ​only ​ ​visit ​ ​with ​ ​my Creative ​ ​Writing ​ ​Class, ​ ​but ​ ​also ​ ​speak ​ ​with ​ ​a ​ ​general ​ ​assembly ​ ​of ​ ​students ​ ​in ​ ​our ​ ​library, ​ ​in ​ ​an effort ​ ​to ​ ​reach ​ ​those ​ ​who ​ ​may ​ ​not ​ ​have ​ ​been ​ ​able ​ ​to ​ ​take ​ ​my ​ ​class ​ ​that ​ year.

The ​ ​following ​ ​year, ​ ​(2010-2011) ​ ​I ​ ​wanted ​ ​to ​ ​expand ​ ​our ​ ​program. ​ ​Because ​ ​of ​ ​my ​ ​own
experience ​ ​at ​ ​the ​ ​acclaimed ​ ​Borderlands ​ ​Press ​ ​Writers’ ​ ​Bootcamp, ​ ​I ​ ​wanted ​ ​to ​ ​provide ​ ​the same ​ ​experience ​ ​for ​ ​my ​ ​students. ​ ​Thanks ​ ​to ​ ​both ​ ​a ​ ​$2000 ​ ​grant ​ ​from ​ ​the ​ ​Syracuse ​ ​Diocese and ​ ​a ​ ​$3000 ​ ​grant ​ ​I ​ ​received ​ ​from ​ ​the ​ ​Discovery ​ ​Center’s ​ ​Arts ​ ​Partners ​ ​Program, ​ ​I ​ ​was ​ ​able ​ ​to not ​ ​only ​ ​invite ​ ​more ​ ​authors, ​ ​but ​ ​I ​ ​was ​ ​also ​ ​able ​ ​to ​ ​fund ​ ​a ​ ​three-day ​ ​workshop ​ ​experience ​ ​at ​ ​the end ​ ​of ​ ​the ​ ​year ​ ​for ​ ​my ​ ​Creative ​ ​Writing ​ ​students, ​ ​and ​ ​any ​ ​other ​ ​students ​ ​who ​ ​wanted ​ ​to ​​attend.

Our ​ ​instructors ​ ​that ​ ​first ​ ​year ​ ​were ​ ​Tom ​ ​Monteleone ​ ​and ​ ​also ​ ​New ​ ​York ​ ​Times ​ ​Bestselling author ​ ​F. ​ ​Paul ​ ​Wilson. ​ ​A ​ ​product ​ ​of ​ ​this ​ ​grant ​ ​was ​ ​a ​ ​school ​ ​literary ​ ​journal, ​ ​Beautiful ​ ​Chaos. ​ ​We ​ ​received ​ ​funding ​ ​from ​ ​Arts ​ ​Partners ​ ​the ​ ​year ​ ​after, (2011-2012) ​ ​and ​ ​Paul ​ ​Wilson ​ ​and ​ ​Tom ​ ​Monteleone ​ ​returned, ​ ​but ​ ​we ​ ​received ​ ​less ​ ​funding, ​ ​and while ​ ​we ​ ​were ​ ​able ​ ​to ​ ​once ​ ​again ​ ​run ​ ​a ​ ​Writers’ ​ ​Series ​ ​and ​ ​a ​ ​Workshop, ​ ​we ​ ​were ​ ​unable ​ ​to ​ ​print a ​ ​school ​ ​journal, ​ ​or ​ ​buy ​ ​texts ​ ​for ​ ​the ​ ​students.

The ​ ​year ​ ​after, ​ ​(2012-2013) ​ ​I ​ ​learned ​ ​the ​ ​Arts ​ ​Partners ​ ​grant ​ ​would ​ ​no ​ ​longer ​ ​be ​ ​funded. Because ​ ​we ​ ​had ​ ​already ​ ​booked ​ ​our ​ ​workshop ​ ​instructor ​ ​for ​ ​that ​ ​year, ​ ​(acclaimed ​ ​urban ​ ​fantasy author ​ ​Maurice ​ ​Broaddus), ​ ​we ​ ​raised ​ ​the ​ ​funds ​ ​ourselves ​ ​through ​ ​a ​ ​combination ​ ​of crowdfunding, ​ ​bake ​ ​sales, ​ ​and ​ ​other ​ ​fundraising ​ ​methods. ​ ​Also, ​ ​one ​ ​of ​ ​our ​ ​families ​ ​offered Maurice ​ ​free ​ ​lodgings, ​ ​which ​ ​helped ​ ​greatly ​ ​with ​ ​costs. ​ ​While ​ ​we ​ ​were ​ ​not ​ ​able ​ ​to ​ ​fund ​ ​a ​ ​full writers’ ​ ​series ​ ​or ​ ​provide ​ ​texts ​ ​for ​ ​my ​ ​students, ​ ​Maurice ​ ​visited ​ ​our ​ ​school ​ ​and ​ ​conducted ​ ​a three-day ​ ​workshop, ​ ​and ​ ​also ​ ​spoke ​ ​with ​ ​a ​ ​general ​ ​assembly ​ ​of ​ ​our ​ ​students.

Since ​ ​then, ​ ​we ​ ​have ​ ​followed ​ ​a ​ ​similar ​ ​format, ​ ​inviting ​ ​one ​ ​author ​ ​per ​ ​year ​ ​to ​ ​conduct ​ ​a workshop ​ ​with ​ ​my ​ ​students, ​ ​(Ronald ​ ​Malfi ​ ​and ​ ​Mary ​ ​Sangiovanni, ​ ​previously) ​ ​raising ​ ​funds through ​ ​a ​ ​variety ​ ​of ​ ​methods. ​ ​However, ​ ​though ​ ​we ​ ​were ​ ​fortunate ​ ​enough ​ ​to ​ ​host ​ ​bestselling and ​ ​award-winning ​ ​author ​ ​Brian ​ ​Keene ​ ​last ​ ​year ​ ​as ​ ​a ​ ​visiting ​ ​speaker, ​ ​we ​ ​were ​ ​not ​ ​able ​ ​to gather ​funding ​ ​for ​ ​a ​ ​workshop ​ ​at ​ ​the end of the year.

This ​ ​is ​ ​why ​ ​I’m ​ ​seeking ​ ​funding ​ ​for ​ ​our ​ ​Visiting ​ ​Writers’ Series. While we have secured funding for a year-end workshop, currently we need funds for our monthly visits, and we won't hear about our current grant application for the Visions Loves Educators grant until late Spring 2018. ​Two ​ ​visiting ​ ​writers ​ ​- ​ ​Jacob ​ ​Haddon, ​ ​editor ​ ​of ​ ​​Lamplight ​ ​Magazine ​ and acclaimed fantasy author Joshua Palmatier ​- ​ ​have ​ ​already ​ ​come and ​ ​gone, with our third visiting writer, John Brhel, already scheduled for February. Thus far, we’ve funded these writers through bake sales, but ​I ​ ​would ​ ​like ​ ​to ​ ​fund ​three more visiting writers.

What will the funds be used for? As honorariums for our visiting authors and their time, travel, and lodging expenses, ​ ​as ​ ​well ​ ​as ​ ​providing copies of their​ ​books ​ ​for ​ ​my ​ ​students. ​I ​ ​would ​ ​also, ​ ​funds permitting, ​ ​like ​ ​to ​ ​print ​ ​another ​ ​school ​ ​literary ​ ​journal, ​ ​featuring ​ ​the ​ ​final ​ ​editions ​ ​of ​ ​my ​ ​students’ work.

Anticipated Visiting Writers:

February: CW Briar

March: Paul D. Smith

April: Nancy Holzner

May: Bracken MacCleod

May Workshop: James A Moore

story:
Sasse Girls seeks to create a new model that will give girls new images of "sexy and powerful" women and help them to find their own authentic expression. Through a variety of the creative arts, media, and discussion,  peer counseling, girls will explore new ideas of what being a sexy, confident and empowered woman is and begin to develop an inner sense of what these words mean for themselves and how to embody it genuinely.

 Sasse Girls Will:

  • Inspire girls to discover who they are beyond their identification of what they look like and wear.
  • Educate and provide awareness and new choices to girls, in how they see themselves in relation to their gender and sexuality.
  • Empower girls to create new images for themselves what it means to be a powerful woman/girl and to learn how to rely on their own judgment, discernment, and values.
  • Help teen girls to learn to distinguish what is real and what is media propaganda regarding sexual behavior and intimacy.
  • Assist them in understanding what feminine power is and redefine what being sexy means and to develop healthy boundaries regarding their sexuality.
  • Build self-esteem, self-confidence, a healthy body image, and help shift their perception of what it means to be a sexually empowered young woman in today's world.
  •  Increase confidence in refusal skills that would translate to refusal skills for drugs and alcohol and other peer pressure situations.
  • Provide peer counseling techniques for girls in supporting each other in dealing with these issue.

WHAT YOU GET

Benefits to Participants, Community, and Donors

  1. As a contributor, you will know that your money is making a difference in girls lives by providing a program that will help them to develop into more confident, strong, integrated and well balanced young women free from some of the stereotypical ways of viewing themselves. 
  2. By contributing to Sasse Girls you are supporting a program that will help girls become more at choice in their life, know their innate power and become strong, confident healthy young women that will contribute to their community and society in positive ways as they become adults.
  3. As a donor, you will help Sasse to raise awareness and educate teen girls about their sexuality in a safe and positive way. Girls can then begin to understand the depth of the effect that the popular culture and pornography have on their choices, identity, and behavior.
  4.  By providing a safe space for teens to express themselves creatively, they can explore their feelings regarding cultural definitions of what being sexy and empowered is for them.
  5. By encouraging communication and shared experiences with other girls, they can learn how to build positive non-competitive relationships with other girls.
  6. By defining new concepts of feminine power and developing an inner sense of what power means for themselves.
  7. Sasse Girls supports age-appropriate education on negative effects of the sexualization of girls, and adolescents will promote healthy, balanced and positive images of girls and women.
  8. Sasse Girls will help to build girls confidence and self-esteem and will help them reject messages that sexualize and objectify them.
  9. Most important, girls can learn to value themselves for who they are rather than for how they look.
  10.  Increased confidence in refusal skills that would translate to refusal skills for drugs and alcohol and other peer pressure situations.

WHAT WE NEED 

Projected Expenses For Pilot Program 

Videographer -  $3800  

  1. For campaign video and project video.
  2. Interviews before the start of the project.
  3. Interviews at end of the project.
  4. Documents the entire process over 3 months, attending one class per month, an estimated total of 40+ hrs including editing.

Director Compensation: $3500  

  1. This includes the ongoing development of curriculum.
  2. Outreach to community organizations and parents.
  3. Fundraising for a second program and beyond.
  4. Applying for a non-profit status.
  5. Oversees each session and works closely with advisor.
  6. Trains assistant and supports her during each session.

Assistant Compensation:…...  $2400 (for 6 months starting in February)

  1. Oversee the social media campaign for Sasse and all fundraising and sister programs.
  2. Assist with the program outreach to parents and girls and with the interview process.
  3. Support director administratively after the campaign, before the program starts and after.
  4. Help with the set-up and clean-up of space after each meeting.
  5. Work with girls during group meetings.

Curriculum Development Advisor/Counselor ……… $3600

  1. Help develop curriculum for sessions with the director.
  2. Work in an advisory capacity during the group meetings.
  3. Work with girls as needed during group meetings. 

These costs are approximate and may need to be adjusted:

Rental of Space:…………. $1200  

Supplies: ........ $250

Non-Profit Set-up Expenses:.......$400

Insurance: ......... $500

Extra Car Insurance (in case we need to drive girls)........$150

 Logo Design...... $300

Website:...... $300

Investment Capital for next program.....$1,500 (seed money to raise more money and cover preliminary expenses for next program.)

Total Expenses:...$17,900

 

How Sasse Will Make a Difference

  • Sasse Girls is the only program designed specifically to address the challenges teen girls are facing today as regards to their sexuality and in building self-confidence and sexual awareness
  • It is essential that teens are given new perspectives and are able to discover for themselves rather than be told by the media what being a sexually powerful woman is. Sasse will provide a safe space and offer creative ways for girls to explore new definitions of feminine power.

Possible Challenges

As with any pilot program, there will always be unforeseen challenges.  Currently, I can identify two areas where challenges may arise. One is in the documentation of the effectiveness of the program, the other is with providing a solid support team for the girls in case of any emotional reactivity

  • Documentation of the effectiveness of Sasse Girls will be handled in two distinct ways; 

1.  Recording both the initial and final interview of each participant with the permission of a parent.

2. Providing each participant with a questionnaire to fill out to help us gauge where they are when they come in and where they are when they leave.

  • Because Sasse will be discussing and exploring the pop culture's views on women, sex, and power, we understand the teens can become emotionally reactive at times. That is why we are including one parent, a teen counselor educator at each meeting to act as an advisor and provide support during the entirety of the program. 

About the Director of Sasse Girls

For over 30 years I have devoted myself to the study of human sexuality, the mythology of the Goddess, Herstory, self-growth, and self-awareness. I have taken classes, courses and  I am certified in a variety of areas such as an Ordained Minister and Priestess, Spiritual and a Shamanic Counselor. I am also a teacher of women's sexuality and spirituality, the somatic approach to healing trauma and a teacher of sacred sexuality,  I have written hundreds of articles which have been published online on a variety of topics. 

I have dedicated my life to establishing a new paradigm for women's sexuality and of the feminine, and for women and girls to learn how to feel free, powerful and safe in this world.  To be able to walk down the street and be fully in their body and know that it is safe to do so. 

Sasse Girls, as well as all of my programs for women and teen girls, are designed to support a shift in consciousness first for each person, which can then support a shift in their relationship with their family, friends, community and beyond.  

I also have a mentor training for women ages 25-35 to become mentors for the girls who are a part of the Sasse program. I plan to file a non-profit status and have this be used as a model in other communities and have been trained to be a mentor in the Girls to Women training program.

Other Ways You Can Help

SPREAD THE WORD

  • Besides making a financial contribution to this campaign, you can also help us to be a success by getting the word out on FB, Instagram, all social media networks and by sharing our campaign with friends, family, co-workers and any organizations you think would support us.
  • You can also send out an email to your own lists if you feel inspired to do so.
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

I plan to file a non-profit status and have this be used as a model in other communities and have been trained to be a mentor in the Girls to Women training program.Other Ways You Can HelpSPREAD THE WORD
Besides making a financial contribution to this campaign, you can also help us to be a success by getting the word out on FB, Instagram, all social media networks and by sharing our campaign with friends, family, co-workers and any organizations you think would support us.
You can also send out an email to your own lists if you feel inspired to do so.
Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Bootstrap is the most popular web front end framework for building mobile first responsive websites. It provides advantages such as

 

  • Prevent repetition between projects.
  • Utilize responsive design to allow your website to adapt to various screen sizes – mobile, desktop, and everything in between.
  • Add consistency to design and code between projects and between developers.
  • Quickly and easily prototype new designs.
  • Ensure cross-browser compatibility.

Bootstrap makes it easy for beginners and intermediate developers alike to focus on design rather than the modality of the responsiveness. Any web project you work will have to be responsive so you can ideally use Bootstrap for all your web projects. It is one of the most important skill for any beginner.  With a large open source community you will never be struck with any issue if you are using a framework like Bootstrap.

 

Bootstrap 4 is the latest version of the amazing Bootstrap framework and has been released with some top-notch upgrades to the already useful and easy framework. Our Projects in Bootstrap 4 course is the next version of our immensely popular “Projects in Bootstrap 3” course. Our course has been used by over 100K students worldwide and is used as a supporting content in numerous colleges and universities.

 

Our new course is a step up from the previous instalment with more complex projects and much deeper dive into the core concepts of Bootstrap.

Why Bootstrap?

 

As the number of devices that flood the market increase, the display sizes of the devices are all different. This year only, the number of connected devices have finally surpassed the number of people in the world.

 

According to statistics by Statista, the number of connected devices around the world is expected to grow at an exceptional rate. Compared to the 15.41 billion devices in 2015, by 2025 the number will increase to about 75.44 billion devices.

So, how does Bootstrap play a part?

Bootstrap frameworks simplify the process of adding layouts to your website or Web App to help tame them in order to make them more responsive. A simple Bootstrap layout can also be modified to make it more classier and chic, depending on your style. Not only is Bootstrap simple and easy to use, but it also has an extremely easy learning curve, where you require absolute zero knowledge of HTML, CSS or even JavaScript to create your website.

 

The framework itself contains HTML- and CSS-based design templates for typography, forms, buttons, navigation and other interface components, as well as optional JavaScript extensions.

Bootstrap 4 is most widely used front end framework compared to other frameworks such as FOundation and Material UI.

Brief History of Bootstrap

Bootstrap was the brainchild of three Twitter developers – Mark Otto, Sarvesh Mishra and Jacob Thornton. Originally named Twitter Blueprint, the three developers wanted a better way manage the internal tools.

This Blueprint was to help them encourage consistency across internal tools. When multiple designers and developers worked on one project, this resulted in inconsistencies and a high maintenance burden. In order to simplify the process of working on Twitter and to build a new internal tool that would eliminate problems in development, the Blueprint was formed.

After this tool was completed, many developers began contributing to it as a part of Hack Week, a hackathon inspired week for Twitter developers. This resulted in a tool that was more than capable of standing alone, and was aptly renamed as Bootstrap and released as an open-source project for public use on August 19, 2011. Since, then then small group has now grown to a full online community that continue to improve Twitter.

Features of Bootstrap 4

 

Bootstrap 4 is a big update with multiple changes such as

  • Flexbox and improved Grid System
  • Switched from Less to Sass
  • The Reboot
  • New Typography
  • Cards
  • New Customization Option
  • Dropped IE8 and IE9 support, dropped older browser versions, and moved to rem units for component sizing
  • New Build Tools

 

What This Course Offers

 

This inclusive course is aimed at helping developers in all stages, from newbies to more experienced ones. Since, you do not need to know any HTML or CSS, newbies can also start getting hands on with this amazing framework.

 

The best part about this course is that works with both theory and practical, which means that you will be introduced to the theory behind Bootstrap 4, and you will get to see it in action. And, not only see it, but working along with the instructor, you will have a step-by-step breakdown of how this amazing framework works and how you can use it to make your website more responsive.

 

The five different projects were designed in a way to help you progress with the features of Bootstrap. The first project is fairly simple and acquaints you with the basics of Bootstrap, while each projects adds more features and ways that you can manipulate Bootstrap for your own gains.

Why This Course?

 

While, you might feel that the other tutorials are similar, but they are not! Our courses have been designed by experts, keeping in mind the important part, the students. Our first priority is always helping our students actually learn. We have created this course assuming that you know nothing about Bootstrap 4, which you will start from the very beginning.

 

The course will cover the core concepts to help you at every step of the way – from what is Bootstrap 4 to downloading it to building actual real-world projects that you can use everyday. We also offer an amazing support team that will always be ready to help you answer any questions, problems or even glitches that you may encounter. The best part is that every project you create with our course, you get to keep. It’s yours to play around with, modify, build upon and even publish.

Tentative Projects

 

Here is the list of the 5 tentative projects that you will build along with this course. These projects are not finalized and are subject to change.

 

Photosharing – A complete photosharing website that will include multiple pages and a different layout. As you move from one page to another, the layout will change.

 

Resume – A sophisticated resume website, where you will learn how to use the Bootstrap 4 grid and create the corresponding layouts with that.

 

Social Networking – A social networking website, where you will learn how to incorporate a number of different feature such as comments, adding photos, groups. You will also learn how to add a sidebar to the website.

 

Agency – A clean and nice looking website with a nav bar on the top, followed by a jumbotron. In this project, you will learn how to block of sections of a page to add a different segment of the website and add a contrasting design.


Lightbox – In this project, you will learn how to incorporate the Bootstrap 4 grid layout, to create a lightbox, that includes images. The images are added in a slideshow, can be clicked on and the webpage even includes a sticky menu.

 

Risks and challenges

The primary risk that we face is that we may not be able to finish the course creation in the stipulated time. However to mitigate this risk, we have created a strict time line that we will adhere to and we have multiple developers that are working on this course simultaneously, making us confident that we will not pass the deadline.

story:
URBAN HARVEST FARM AT UJIMA

Right now, with the help of a fellow SFNYC supporter, your donation of $25 or more, to support Urban Harvest at Ujima, can be worth an additional $25!   Our friend has offered to donate an additional $25, up to a total of $500, for every donation of $25 or more received now, during the last 8 of our campaign.  Together, we can do this!

_______________________________________________________________________________________

Slow Food NYC believes in a food chain that is good, clean, and fair for all, where everyone, every day, has the right to enjoy ample, sustainably and humanely produced, culturally meaningful, delicious food that is good for human health and well-being, the health of the planet, and those who work to put food on our tables.

We bring these values to Urban Harvest at Ujima, our tuition-free, educational, urban farm community resource in East New York, Brooklyn. Why East New York?  Because East New York suffers limited availability of fresh, wholesome food and disproportionate incidences of avoidable, diet-related disease and death.  

In fun, educational activities, provided in a safe venue, children learn about good food, from field to fork. They gain an understanding of what good, clean, and fair food is and how it affects them, their communities, and the planet.

During July and August, Community Organizations—by arrangement—have access to two to four-day programs of hands-on gardening experiences, food and farming focused lessons and activities, nutrition education, and communal food preparation and enjoyment; experiences that help prepare them to make healthy choices, lead healthy lives, and act for the health of their families and community.

Your financial support of Urban Harvest at Ujima will help us to continue and expand children’s good food educational experiences and to further develop and maintain community food distribution channels, delivering fresh, Ujima-grown produce to our East New York neighbors.

WE HAVE BIG PLANS THIS SUMMER AND YOU CAN HELP!

With the support of community partners and supporters, like YOU, we will continue to dedicate our time and passion to this important work because we believe that learning about and experiencing Good, Clean, and Fair Food in a convivial atmosphere has great impact on children.  

Building upon the success of 2017, our goal is to EXPAND and IMPROVE the educational experiences we can provide at the farm.  The funds raised through this campaign will go towards:

Developing enhanced community food distribution channels, including farmers’ markets, community and senior centers, and food pantries;

Continuing to enhance and expand our relationships with Community-Based Organizations and increasing the number of kids with access to the farm;

Expanding our Junior Farmer Mentorship Program, providing opportunities to local high-school students in paid internships. Junior farmers engage in hands-on learning around nutrition, urban agriculture, environmental health, community development, leadership, and food justice. We provide our Junior farmers with additional opportunities through our relationships in the New York food and farming community;

Enhancing the recently introduced “food box” program that provides fresh vegetables and herbs (and flowers for the table) to each Student and Senior Farmer each week;

Conducting a weekly Junior Farmer-operated, community farm-stand.

Our plans are ambitious and will come to fruition with YOUR SUPPORT!

WHAT YOU CAN DO TO HELP

Slow Food NYC is run entirely, with love and dedication, by volunteers and 100% of the funds raised for Urban Harvest at Ujima are used for farm operation.  Here is what your contributions can help accomplish:

  -  $25 can help stock the cupboard with food preparation staples;

  -  $150 can help buy a new pop-up tent to cover our “farm stand”;

  -  $250 can build a new hoop house to extend the growing season;

  -  $500 can compensate a neighborhood high school youth to work as a Student Farmer Peer Mentor for a month, during July or August;

  -  $1,000 can help provide Student Farmers with lunch, prepared with fresh, seasonal, local, ingredients, for a month during July or August;

  -  $1,200 can help build new raised planting beds at a new farm site.

THE IMPACT

During the 2017 season, Student Farmers:

  -  Planted and tended more than 60 varieties of vegetables (including SFUSA Ark of Taste heirlooms), herbs, and flowers;

  -  Harvested about 750 pounds of herbs, salad and cooking greens, and other vegetables and herbs;

  -  Prepared and served about 20-40 healthy snacks and largely plant-based lunches each day

  -  Composted about 250 pounds of plant material and food scraps; and

Maintained an average daily snack and lunch cost of about $2.25, within the FRAC (Food Research and Action Center) Food Stamp Challenge Budget of $4.00 per day

Check this for more about Urban Harvest at Ujima 2017:

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools to tell your friends about us!

CONTACT US

We would LOVE to tell you more about what we do and how important Ujima is to the community.  E-mail Dee Dee Tiller – deedeertiller@gmail.com - for more information!

andMaintained an average daily snack and lunch cost of about $2.25, within the FRAC (Food Research and Action Center) Food Stamp Challenge Budget of $4.00 per dayCheck this for more about Urban Harvest at Ujima 2017:OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELPDon't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools to tell your friends about us!CONTACT USWe would LOVE to tell you more about what we do and how important Ujima is to the community.  E-mail Dee Dee Tiller – deedeertiller@gmail.com - for more information!

story:
Ghiras Project is OSRA's Educational Project

“Ghiras” is the Arabic word for a small plant with roots which, regardless of where planted, will grow and benefit its surroundings.

The children inside Syria are the greatest victims of the ongoing 7 year conflict.  They have lost their most integral rights due to the absence of any kind of security. This has inevitably diverted attention towards the urgency of meeting the most basic needs, and away from educational needs which during the crisis has become the least of society's concerns. It has also led to a huge decline in educational services as well as a shortage in the educational workforce as a result of the mass displacement and as a result of people finding alternative work in order to earn a living.

What we do?

We are able to achieve this by finding a safe space and equipping it with all the required educational supplies for students and teachers, and provide the highest quality of education for the lowest cost through involving the local communities and resources.

On a community level:

Engaging with the local population has played a key role in raising awareness within communities on the importance of education during the present crisis, particularly as a large number of children have been cut off from all education for almost three years.

This has encouraged local youth to participate and fill in the gaps that the educational sector in Syria is suffering from today

On a school level:

We ensure that the schools are equipped to the best standards by offering technical, administrative, logistical and financial help to the schools we run. After they are up and running we remain in direct contact with the schools to support them, should they face any challenges, and to provide support in resolving the issues at hand as quickly as possible. Despite the crisis we believe these children deserve the best schools, and that this is just as much a priority.

On teacher’s level:

We train the teachers with the fundamental educational techniques, and periodically supervise and reward them for their excellent teaching performance. Feedback is also provided on how their performance can be improved to ensure the teaching methods used are suitable.

On children’s level:

We have incorporated psychological support into the educational programmes we are delivering. This has greatly encouraged children to return to school, by helping them adapt to school life after experiencing a gap in their education, or helping them cope with attending new schools with new friends due to displacement. Finally it has allowed children to find a safe space to recover from the experiences of the war and provides a daily distraction. This has had a positive impact on overcoming some of the behavioral and social problems that have developed as a result of the conflict.  

The "Ghiras Project" in numbers:

Since 2013, the "Ghiras Project" has been able to provide education to over 3500 children through our basic education program, and over 1860 children through our accelerated education program. In addition to this, 4350 children have benefitted from our psychological support project. Our project has also provided work for 333 members of staff as teachers, administrators and psychological support Specialists, 65% of whom are female.

Changing a child’s life:

This year, we aim to provide education for 1015 children, over 5 schools, and provide jobs for 62 members of staff.

Your participation can make 2018 a turning point for a child in Syria. And together we can change the future for these children.

Share this great initiative with your family and friends, and encourage them to also be a part of this change today.

Our Partners :

Facebook Pages : 

OSRA : https://www.facebook.com/osra.ar/

Ghiras : https://www.facebook.com/Ghiras.Pro/

Syrian Hands : https://www.facebook.com/syria.hands/

Ghiras Japan : https://www.facebook.com/GhirasJP/

Ayadee : https://www.facebook.com/orgayadee/

Souriyat : https://www.facebook.com/souriyat.across.borders/

story:
Meet COEX Clover, the open source programmable drone designed to teach you coding! 

 

 

Clover is for anyone who wants to learn to operate and code a drone. The kit comes complete with all the parts you need and a step-by-step tutorial to code and build your quadcopter in no time. It's light, sleek, and flies like a charm. Perfect for indoor use.

 

 

Clover is a true STEAM learning tool

 

 

As a teacher you can dive into the following subjects:  

- Physics: Electronics, electromechanics, aerodynamics, acceleration, and gravity. 

- Math: Geometry, functions, scale factors, and vectors.

- Technology: Telemetry, data logging, lithium battery technology.

- Arts: Design a drone payload using 3d-printing materials. Invent your custom Clover.

- Programming: coding blocks, Python, and C++. 

 

Current stage

At the moment, our project is at the prototype stage. After testing many versions and iterations, different components, and electronics, and evaluating the performance of the quadcopter, we were able to develop and manufacture Clover in the form you see. Moreover, we made a solderless version of the kit in order to simplify the assembly process for the user.

Clover set includes a PX4 flight controller and a Raspberry Pi 4 controlling onboard computer, which can be used to connect to the drone over Wi-Fi and perform autonomous flights. For more information please check the Clover docs: https://clover.coex.tech/en/

 

COEX Pix — a PX4-based flight controller

 

 

It's also Python based, meaning you'll learn real coding. And if you fail to create the correct code, don´t worry, just download the ready made codes. 

The platform utilizes the ROS framework, which allows the user program to communicate with the Clover services.

Positioning systems

  • Optical flow
  • ArUco markers
  • GPS 

 Simulation

 

The clover environment allows you to control your drone not only in reality but virtually as well. Gazebo simulator renders most of the hardware and the same ROS code as the real drone. 

 

Community  

 

 

Clover is a platform that is constantly being updated by a large number of users. Clover is a drone, and it is also a community of like-minded people, aiming to create a universal ecosystem for education. 
 

 

COEX: Support https://t.me/COEXHelpdesk  

Dronecode https://t.me/DroneCode  

Aerial robotics News  https://t.me/aerobnews  

What happens after you have assembled the Clover drone, learned to operate it, and programmed autonomous flights? There are many international competitions, hackathons, and project contests, which are a big part of Clover. You can participate in these activities, meet potential colleagues, partners, friends, realize new technological projects, and win valuable prizes. 

 

Copter Express (COEX) is a development and manufacturing company of open source drones since 2013. Besides educational drone kits, the company produces industrial drones for survey, drone boxes for autonomous missions, and drone points for autonomous drone parcel delivery. 

 

 

The Clover drone kit is made to enthrall experts and beginners alike! If you’ve never built a quadcopter before, then welcome to the club! You’ll have a blast! And those who are familiar with this technology are sure to reveal the other side of the aerial robotics world. 

For kids, they should be supervised by an adult as there are electronic components that need to be handled carefully. Please be sure to observe the proper safety precautions at all times.
story_txt:
Meet COEX Clover, the open source programmable drone designed to teach you coding!   Clover is for anyone who wants to learn to operate and code a drone. The kit comes complete with all the parts you need and a step-by-step tutorial to code and build your quadcopter in no time. It's light, sleek, and flies like a charm. Perfect for indoor use.  Clover is a true STEAM learning tool  As a teacher you can dive into the following subjects:  - Physics: Electronics, electromechanics, aerodynamics, acceleration, and gravity. - Math: Geometry, functions, scale factors, and vectors.- Technology: Telemetry, data logging, lithium battery technology.- Arts: Design a drone payload using 3d-printing materials. Invent your custom Clover.- Programming: coding blocks, Python, and C++.  Current stageAt the moment, our project is at the prototype stage. After testing many versions and iterations, different components, and electronics, and evaluating the performance of the quadcopter, we were able to develop and manufacture Clover in the form you see. Moreover, we made a solderless version of the kit in order to simplify the assembly process for the user.Clover set includes a PX4 flight controller and a Raspberry Pi 4 controlling onboard computer, which can be used to connect to the drone over Wi-Fi and perform autonomous flights. For more information please check the Clover docs: https://clover.coex.tech/en/ COEX Pix — a PX4-based flight controller  It's also Python based, meaning you'll learn real coding. story:
What will be your next favorite Netflix-inspired original series?  Would you believe...a corporate mandated HR training?  Or perhaps, regulatory compliance eLearning?  We think it can be done, but need your funds to move to the next stage! 

I've worked in corporate training for over a decade, and know how painful mandatory training can be.  That's why I founded Ubzerv Learning...to change this painful experience into one that can actually be enjoyable!  A time to grab the popcorn, set up your station on the couch, and cheer for your favorite characters.  

It's where Training meets Entertaining!  

We hope to take Ubzerv Learning from an under-funded startup and turn it into the thriving multimedia eLearning business we know it can be, but it all starts by collecting the funds necessary to completely build out our first round of courseware.

So what's in it for you?  

Other than helping us force the industry to make your next learning experience a fun one?  Well, we know that our rate of success is dependent upon being rewarded by your generosity, so we'll do our best at making the perks as equally rewarding!

We'll use our team of Videographers, Graphic Designers, and 3D Animators to custom-develop an animated video for the special occasion of your choice.  It'll be customized, JUST FOR YOU!  Think of it as your own mini Netflix original (okay, maybe that was a bit of a stretch - but it'll still be awesome!)

Your personalized, animated video will include:

  • Your photos
  • Your choice of music
  • Your text
  • ...all on our awesome design templates


What do you need an animated video for?

  • Sick of eCards?  What about an awesome video birthday, anniversary, thank you card?
  • Ever notice the animated "explainer videos" on websites?  What about a personal one, just for you?
  • Tired of plain old home movies? Jazz it up!
  • Scrapbooker in the family?  Time to start converting those videos into something special too!  Why should the photos get all the glory?

Have an upcoming party? Anniversary, Graduation, Birthday?

How cool would it be to play an animated video, with your pictures, music, text for the audience.  Once in a lifetime kind of moments...that won't cost you thousands!

How does it work?
  • Choose your perk
  • Pick your templates (Indiegogo Templates)
  • Send us your photos, text and music choice
  • We send you an awesome video!





You're the Director!

Depending on the perk that you choose, you'll have varying flexibility in choosing additional templates, add-ons, narration, etc.  But no matter your choice, you are the director!  That means that you pick the look & feel, you determine the pictures, you decide on what is said.

It's your movie, we'll just help to bring it to life!

FAQ:
  • Q: What will the video look like?
  • A: The video will match the template, except that the photos will be swapped out with your images, the text will be changed to say whatever you'd like, and we'll put the whole thing to your choice of music.
  • Q: When will I receive my video?
  • A: Each video will receive personal attention, which does take time...but we'll be sure to have your video to you by the timeline outlined within the perk.
  • Q: What format will my video be in?
  • A: All videos will be rendered in MP4 format, unless you request otherwise.  From there, you can upload to your mobile device, save on your PC, share on Dropbox, whatever you'd like.
  • Q: What are the video playback options?
  • A: Because the video will be in MP4 format, your playback options are nearly endless - it all depends on what device you share it with.
  • Q: How much can I customize the video?
  • A: You'll be able to choose the pictures that are displayed, the text, and the music.
  • Q: I like the idea, but can't find a template that works for me.  Now what?
  • A: Let us know what you're thinking and maybe we can come up with something for you.
  • Q: How can I add narration?
  • A: We have a perk that includes a professional voiceover narrator.  We have many voiceover resources, our intro video demonstrates some of the talent we use.

Q: What will the video look like?

A: The video will match the template, except that the photos will be swapped out with your images, the text will be changed to say whatever you'd like, and we'll put the whole thing to your choice of music.




Q: When will I receive my video?

A: Each video will receive personal attention, which does take time...but we'll be sure to have your video to you by the timeline outlined within the perk.



Q: What format will my video be in?

A: All videos will be rendered in MP4 format, unless you request otherwise.  From there, you can upload to your mobile device, save on your PC, share on Dropbox, whatever you'd like.





Q: What are the video playback options?

A: Because the video will be in MP4 format, your playback options are nearly endless - it all depends on what device you share it with.


Q: How much can I customize the video?

A: You'll be able to choose the pictures that are displayed, the text, and the music.




Q: I like the idea, but can't find a template that works for me.  Now what?

A: Let us know what you're thinking and maybe we can come up with something for you.




Q: How can I add narration?

A: We have a perk that includes a professional voiceover narrator.  We have many voiceover resources, our intro video demonstrates some of the talent we use.

story:
About this project

Last October, seven sixth graders teamed up to take on one of the toughest challenges in this year's Odyssey of the Mind (OOTM) competition: "Technical Difficulties." Like thousands of teams around the world, we spent months integrating mechanical engineering tasks into a humorous skit, building devices, writing scripts, and creating props and a set. 

We placed first in our division at the state championship. Now we need help taking that last, really huge step: going to the OOTM World Championships in Michigan where we'll meet kids from all around the world who, like us, choose to spend their free time solving design problems!

What we need

We need at least $2,100 to pay for the team registration fee by April 22. This will bring into reach of our families and other supporters the overall goal of $8,827 total by May 15. Without the success of this Indiegogo campaign, it's the end of the road for Team Haunted Difficulties.

Here's the breakdown of costs:

  • Team registration  ($300 each x 7) = $2,100
  • Housing & Food ($531 each x 7) = $3,717
  • Estimated Flights (appx. $380 each x 7) = $2,660
  • Ground Transportation ($50 each x 7) = $350

TOTAL $8,827 

What happens to your money

All funds we raise will go toward the team registration fee first. Any funds we raise beyond that will help us make sure every member of our team can afford to go. If we can't meet our goal, the money will go to our local Odyssey of the Mind organization to support another team in the future. No matter what, your money will help kids like us fulfill their dreams.

The Impact

Our OOTM experience so far has helped us see how we can solve problems and work as a team, improve our engineering skills and discover how fun it can be to work hard and be creative. We thinking going to the World Championship will be great because...
  • We'll get to learn from other kids from around the world. 
  • We think it will be scary to perform in front of all those people, but fun too, and we like a challenge.
  • We can show our friends at home how cool OOTM is! 
Other Ways You Can Help

Please share information about our campaign with others you think may want to help support kids pursuing interests in science, engineering and the arts.

Thank you!

story:
A collaborative approach to financial literacy

Brooklyn Plans brings pop-up financial community spaces throughout Brooklyn to empower residents financially and revive a sense of community among disparate groups within (gentrifying) neighborhoods. With $5,000 Brooklyn Plans will be able to launch a financial community space in Red Hook, a financially underserved neighborhood, for the month of May. With your support this space will improve Red Hook’s access to reliable financial information, open up a dialogue between different community members and change how people perceive the topic of “finances” by making it fun and accessible.

What is a financial community space?

Visualize a place where you can participate in workshops, listen to speakers, take a class, send your kids after school or just hang out with an interesting book, where the theme connecting these different events is money and the events are low-cost or free. Now imagine this space in your neighborhood just a few blocks from home. That’s a financial community space and using a pop-up model, we want to bring them to Brooklyn neighborhoods.

Why Red Hook?

We want to bring our pop-up program to Red Hook and launch a financial community space that is open 4 days a week. Red Hook has a history of being underserved, by city government and financial institutions. In response, a thriving network of local organizations has sprung up. Each of these local institutions work to capacitate the neighborhood through the arts, youth education or community organizing.  The strength of these local organizations was most apparent after Hurricane Sandy when they came together with residents in an impressive way. However, the neighborhood continues to be underserved in the area of financial education. It does not host either a financial empowerment center or a Single Stop site, two financial empowerment resources commonly found in underserved neighborhoods.  By creating a dedicated financial space we hope to highlight the financial issues affecting Red Hook residents and mobilize the necessary resources to meet them.

We need your help!

In order to bring our program to Red Hook we need YOUR support! This program has taken shape out of the generosity and buy-in from others. We were graciously donated a beautiful gallery space for the month of May on a busy intersection in Red Hook that can be easily accessed by community residents. The $5,000 we raise will cover the cost of insurance and utilities to run the pop-up for the month, help us convert the bare gallery into an inviting community space and purchase the necessary supplies for workshops such as paper, ink, a projector, white boards, markers and books. 

Your contribution will help us get this project off the ground and bring valuable services to a community in need.If we are able to secure funding, we would like to extend our stay in Red Hook through the end of June in a different community location.

What we do

The programming in a financial community space is based on the unique needs of each neighborhood. We identify these by using human-centered design to immerse ourselves in the neighborhood and speaking to residents and partners to understand the financial realities and needs of that community. We look at the available financial products and services and analyze how these measure up against the needs expressed by residents. Finally, we connect with local partners, citywide agencies, companies, and individuals whose mission aligns with the values expressed by the community and give them the space to host an event. Each pop up space feels and looks different because it reflects the taste and needs of the host community. Each event at the space is an opportunity for residents to learn, share, collaborate and have fun alongside one another.

What we’ve accomplished

While many years in the making, we launched Brooklyn Plans in March and moved quickly to secure a partner in Crown Heights for the month of April. Our partner, Shoestring Press, is an operating print shop and there we are open to the community twice a week. In this space we created programming that was relevant to local residents and members of the shop, a largely self-employed and artist community. We have the following events on the calendar:

·  Real talk: How to find the perfect rental

·  Make your own piggy bank (ages 6-10)

·  Walk-in credit counseling

·  Class: Taxes for freelancers and the self-employed

·  First-time homebuyers workshop


Every person that attends an event reports increased confidence in their ability to independently take the next steps they need on the related topic.

Who we are

Kristen and Jennifer are the enthusiastic, compassionate, tenacious and sometimes dorky, founders of Brooklyn Plans.  The idea of building a physical financial space was the brainchild of Kristen, a Certified Financial Planner dedicated to making finances accessible to the masses. Kristen connected with Jennifer over their passion for change as financial advisors to underserved New Yorkers at a local nonprofit. In that role, they worked with thousands of diverse clients to help them set financial goals, pay down debt and save. They also gathered an understanding of the financial issues affecting the working poor in NYC and the services and products available to them. Kristen’s idea clicked with Jennifer’s passion for economic equality and closing the opportunity gap for the City’s increasingly marginalized established residents.

We understand that you may not be in a position to contribute to our campaign, and that's OK! You can get involved in other ways.  Check www.brooklynplans.org/getinvolved to find out how.  Please show your support for Brooklyn Plans by sharing a link to this page on your various social media accounts!

If you've read this far and still aren't sick of us, check out www.brooklynplan.org or visit our Facebook page to learn more about our efforts. We hope you’ll join us in our financial empowerment revolution!
