  Other Ways You Can Help 
Boost the signal! Like us on Facebook, then share our posts. Talk about us. Tell your families and friends! 
 Use Indigogo share tools!

story:
How can United States government continue to expand without accompanying change to the Constitution of the United States? During Affordable Care Act discussions I had heard enough. I endeavored to find out for myself what United States government role is intended to be. Inquiry resulted in a book, Constitutional Renaissance.


Watching direction we are being taken, I have become concerned for the future of this great country. This concern has prompted me to found the Constitutional Renaissance Institute to promote discussion and thought on the Constitution and on my suggested alternative to our expanding large central United States government. I know of no other suggestion of an alternative to big central government, we seem to be resigned to the inevitability of it.

Funding is needed for a dedicated facility, marketing, media exposure, web presence, transportation and other related expenses. All the funding will be used to pursue the Institute‘s goals. Funding is to cover start-up and operating expense for at least two years. Efforts can then be concentrated on the goals of the Institute rather than fund raising. The more funds raised the bigger the campaign.



To Realize our potential there must be a positive business environment. Without wealth it is very hard to achieve potential. Part of the mission of the Institute will be promoting a mechanism that provides the best environment in the world for business. It is described in more detail in the book Constitutional Renaissance. Regulations, taxation and litigation must be reviewed and modified as indicated to have the best environment for business. This mechanism coordinates economic activities nationally without the involvement of United States government.



United States government is too complicated, too intrusive requiring too much energy to navigate. We need disciplined government that stays within its constitutional role. In short, States take care of their internal affairs and United States government takes care of external affairs. There should be very little overlap, if any. This position is based on the intent of the Constitution. It is not based on what interpretation is in vogue. Human character has not changed since the writing of the Constitution. Therefore, the Constitution is as valid today as when it was written. It means the same thing now as when written. The Constitution is the legal datum for our country, it does not change with time--unless we change it through amendment process. If the Constitution is interpreted differently over time we will not know where we will end up. It is up to the current stewards as they come and go to be true to it. It is the duty of every generation to hand this country off intact to the next generation. As citizens strive for their potential, building on past generations, the country improves in an endless cycle. There is no need for the various parts of government to change or expand roles.


(The statement above refers to the Congress of the confederate government, but it is applicable to the Congress of the federal government of today too.)


The Institute is not aligned with any political ideology. It is the intent of the Institute to encourage application of libertarian to liberal ideas as is appropriate for the intended task. What is being proposed is to move governance, as much as possible and constitutional, from a nebulous complex central government to as-local-as-is-possible government. Competition improves the breed, this goes for government too. By removing overlaying central government from domestic governance and having the states handle their own domestic issues puts competition in play thus improving governance. This should result in the best environment for both business and for individual citizens.



This country has tremendous potential, if only big intrusive government would get out of the way so it could be realized. Three quarters of the people of this country think we are on the wrong path. The only difference between the two parties is one goes down the left side and the other the right side of the same path. It is still the wrong path. We need to think anew for solutions to an out of control United States government. We are on the wrong path. Now is the time to make corrections and return to course, a course prescribed by the Constitution.

Founding of the Constitutional Renaissance Institute is motivated by the belief that it is individual citizens realizing as much of their potential as possible that, in the aggregate, makes a great society. Government affects us all, get it right and we all do better, get it wrong and we all suffer. The key to our potential is respecting the Constitution of the United States ("...its only keepers, the people."--George Washington). Since we all are in this together, it would be great (and humbling) to get millions of small contributions to fund this project and help realize the potential that is in all of us--"We the People of the United States."

Registration as an LLC and application for non-profit organization 501c(3) are in process.

story:
Summary

We are an interdisciplinary Unmanned Aerial Systems team of 45 engineering students at the University of California, Riverside. Our team competes against universities from around the nation, and around the globe in the AUVSI SUAS Competition. At this competition the AUVSI sets forth objectives which embraces students to apply systems engineering to create a UAS platform capable of autonomous flight. 

An Unmanned Aerial Vehicle is a complex project that involves engineers from multiple fields and high quality materials to be successful. This though, is why it is such an incredible experience for us as engineering students; to get out of the classroom, work as a team, and do something real.

Your contributions will help us achieve our goals of becoming better engineers by giving us the experience and knowledge needed to be competitive in the constantly evolving world of engineering.

Goal

Last year we overcame challenges associated with being a new team and competing for the first time, but now we're stepping it up. We want to succeed where last year we struggled, writing better software and designing a more agile plane. These task are not easy to overcome though. We need better processors, simulation software, and material for the proof of concepts, prototypes, and the final build. Not to mention we have to travel across the entire country with all of our equipment.  

Your Impact

This is where your contributions come in. Whether your buying the 3D Printed plane because its interesting or donating because your passionate about learning through experience and competition, your contributions are needed for us to be able to compete. What you donate will be used to purchase those carbon fiber booms we need so badly, purchase new battery packs to give us more flight time, or even go towards someones plane ticket, so were not representing ourselves with 2 people at the competition. Your contribution matters and we appreciate any sort of support. 

Expenses

Thank You!!

We want to thank everyone who contributed to our campaign.  Even if you can't contribute to our expenses, sharing our Indiegogo page
 ( http://igg.me/at/UCR-UAS )
or our Facebook page 
( https://www.facebook.com/groups/118885211603855/ )
would do more than you could imagine.

story:
We couldn't do this amazing work without your generous donations.  It is through you that we are able to acquire the resources needed in order to Islamophobia - the false notion that Muslims and Islam are a threat. Our community is not only a non-threat, it is an asset to our society and our country and of that we are proud.  We will fight for your rights for Freedom of Religion!

We have handled over 3300 cases of Muslim Anti-Discrimination .  We will Empower you and stand for your rights and foster change.  
 

CAIR-Chicago is the main office of the Illinois chapter of CAIR (Council on American-Islamic Relations) serving the neighboring Midwest. CAIR is the nation’s largest Muslim civil rights and advocacy group.

CAIR-Chicago is a not-for-profit organization registered in Illinois. Though it leverages the resources, expertise, and knowledge base of CAIR (based in Washington), it functions as an independent organization that sets its own strategy and goals.

Our work at CAIR-Chicago spans four different areas.

Firstly, we deal with civil rights issues, taking up complaints ranging from bigoted gestures to official discrimination against Muslims. We create logs for incidents and pursue the appropriate remedying measures which can range from cultural sensitivity training for the perpetrating party to all out legal measures. We also record every case and release reports to educate the public about the civil rights plight of Muslims.

Secondly, we are involved in political empowerment helping community members understand and utilize the political system to work for them. Projects include voter registration drives, community workshops, “know your rights” educational campaigns, and training of mosques and Muslim centers on how to contact local and national politicians.

Thirdly, we are involved in media monitoring. We monitor the local media closely and flag bias against Muslims. We respond accordingly to editors and producers with letters, phone calls, or meetings. We mobilize the community in letter writing campaigns to reinforce feedback sent to the media.

Lastly, we are involved in community outreach. We forge mutually beneficial partnerships with local and national institutions whose activities overlap with CAIR-Chicago’s in order to maximize efficiency. We work to empower the Muslim community and to foster an understanding between Chicago’s Muslim and non-Muslim communities via public education, and to serve the needs of the Chicagoland community via public service.

CAIR-Chicago Aspires to be:

  • Credible: Gain the trust and respect of all involved.
  • Consistent: Our level of motivation and productivity should not waiver with time. The attention given to the various areas of our work should be even.
  • Professional: Level-headed, objective, presentable, attractive.
  • Proactive: Create programs that predict and preemptively challenge potential problems.
  • Omnipresent: Our presence and our programs should enjoy high exposure both with members of the Muslim community, the general public, the media, and government.
  • Targeted/Focused: Well-defined problem areas and solutions.
  • Transparent: What you see is what you get.
  • Efficient: No redundancies. Putting the right people in the right place at the right time.
  • Egalitarian/Fair-minded: Reach out to support non-Muslims who face similar grievances as our own, or who see similar values to our own being challenged.
  • Accessible: Easy to find and reach whether by members of our community, or by members of the media.
  • Sincere: What fuels our work is not personal ego or a hidden agenda, but a genuine desire to effectuate positive change.

At CAIR-Chicago, we wish to avoid being a traditional organization; rather, we make an effort to enlist maverick approaches in our work.




Firstly, we want to leverage the potent power of the volunteer base in our community. We have set up a powerful system to recruit and place volunteers in the right place at the right time leading to maximum efficiency. We take into consideration each volunteer’s talents, set of skills, and interests and then place them accordingly in a project, so that it is simple plug-and-play. This also makes volunteering with us enjoyable for them and not merely a chore. We regard them as community activists, and not simply volunteers. We believe in clearly defined goals for each project, and setting milestones so that progress is tangible and measurable.

Secondly, we wish to bypass conventional barriers that have plagued our community in the past. We wish to dissolve the generational, class, and racial gaps by stressing the common aspirations and challenges that face us all. Huge progress has been done in bypassing such barriers in the first few months of our recent inception. We are especially keen to see the gap between the transnational (mostly Arab and South Asian) and indigenous (mostly African-American) Muslim communities dissolve.

We also are very vigilant in avoiding potential pitfalls that usually create tension and rifts in the Muslim community, such as dogmatic disagreements between religious currents or schools of thought. We are not a religious organization in that we don’t issue decrees, nor interpret religious text for the people. We are a community services organization and as such we wish to serve with integrity and professionalism any party that sees itself as Muslim. A clear and dominant theme in our work is inclusion.

CAIR-Chicago is a different kind of organization. Though it officially launched January 5th, 2005, the vision and strategy of its board and staff are already cause for high expectations and excitement. Its track record over the “incubation” period between September 2004 and the launch date speaks of a bright future.

We hope that we can work together.
- CAIR-Chicago Team

Please make sure you attend our 11th Annual Banquet or become a sponsor.
story_txt:
We couldn't do this amazing work without your generous donations.  It is through you that we are able to acquire the resources needed in order to Islamophobia - the false notion that Muslims and Islam are a threat. Our community is not only a non-threat, it is an asset to our society and our country and of that we are proud.  We will fight for your rights for Freedom of Religion!We have handled over 3300 cases of Muslim Anti-Discrimination .  We will Empower you and stand for your rights and foster change.    CAIR-Chicago
 is the main office of the Illinois chapter of CAIR (Council on 
American-Islamic Relations) serving the neighboring Midwest. CAIR is the
 nation’s largest Muslim civil rights and advocacy group.
CAIR-Chicago is a not-for-profit organization registered in Illinois.
 Though it leverages the resources, expertise, and knowledge base of CAIR
 (based in Washington), it functions as an independent organization that
 sets its own strategy and goals.
Our work at CAIR-Chicago spans four different areas.
Firstly, we deal with civil rights issues, 
taking up complaints ranging from bigoted gestures to official 
discrimination against Muslims. We create logs for incidents and pursue 
the appropriate remedying measures which can range from cultural 
sensitivity training for the perpetrating party to all out legal 
measures. We also record every case and release reports to educate the 
public about the civil rights plight of Muslims.

Secondly, we are involved in political empowerment
 helping community members understand and utilize the political system 
to work for them. Projects include voter registration drives, community 
workshops, “know your rights” educational campaigns, and training of 
mosques and Muslim centers on how to contact local and national 
politicians.
Thirdly, we are involved in media monitoring.
 We monitor the local media closely and flag bias against Muslims. We 
respond accordingly to editors and producers with letters, phone calls, 
or meetings. We mobilize the community in letter writing campaigns to 
reinforce feedback sent to the media.
Lastly, we are involved in community outreach.
 We forge mutually beneficial partnerships with local and national 
institutions whose activities overlap with CAIR-Chicago’s in order to 
maximize efficiency. We work to empower the Muslim community and to 
foster an understanding between Chicago’s Muslim and non-Muslim 
communities via public education, and to serve the needs of the 
Chicagoland community via public service.
CAIR-Chicago Aspires to be:


Credible: Gain the trust and respect of all involved.

Consistent: Our level of motivation and 
productivity should not waiver with time. The attention given to the 
various areas of our work should be even.

Professional: Level-headed, objective, presentable, attractive.

Proactive: Create programs that predict and preemptively challenge potential problems.

Omnipresent: Our presence and our programs should 
enjoy high exposure both with members of the Muslim community, the 
general public, the media, and government.

Targeted/Focused: Well-defined problem areas and solutions.

Transparent: What you see is what you get.

Efficient: No redundancies. Putting the right people in the right place at the right time.

Egalitarian/Fair-minded: Reach out to support 
non-Muslims who face similar grievances as our own, or who see similar 
values to our own being challenged.

Accessible: Easy to find and reach whether by members of our community, or by members of the media.

Sincere: What fuels our work is not personal ego or a hidden agenda, but a genuine desire to effectuate positive change.

communities dissolve.
We also are very vigilant in avoiding potential pitfalls that usually

professionalism any party that sees itself as Muslim. A clear and

story:
THE MYOPIA EPIDEMIC

One-third of the world's population could be short-sighted by 2020.
(Source: Brien Holden Vision Institute)

Up to 90% of Asian schoolchildren are near-sighted. 
(Source: The Lancet, 5 May 2012)

In the United States of America, myopia has increased 66% in 30 years. 
(Source: National Eye Institute)

Severe myopia could lead to complications including retinal detachment, glaucoma, macular degeneration, cataract and even blindness. 
(Source: Singapore Health Promotion Board)

The situation is bad, but it's only getting worse!

THE GOOD NEWS

Much of the "school myopia" that children face today are linked to environmental factors like long periods of near work and reading in poor lighting conditions. The good news is that all this can be prevented with good reading habits!

That's why we invented...

BookBuddy™ is the smart bookstand which reminds your child to read in good reading conditions through the use of smart sensors. It helps our children to develop healthier reading habits, thereby improving their visual and spinal health. 


HOW IT WORKS

Ergonomic Features


Supports all book sizes

*BookBuddy™ is not just for books. It works great with tablets and smartphones too!


Clever Sensors


We love colours!

You have 3 attractive colours to choose from. Once we’re ready for mass production, we will contact you personally regarding your choice of colours and preferred delivery address.


WHAT EYE EXPERTS SAY

Eye experts recommend three rules that aid in the prevention of myopia. We have implemented all of them into the BookBuddy™: 

1. Hold the book about 30cm away from their eyes while reading. 

2. Ensure there is adequate lighting in the room while reading. 

3. Take a break after 30 minutes of near work.


REWARDS


MEET OUR AWESOME TEAM

The BookBuddy™ was developed at CrymsonTec. Founded in Singapore, CrymsonTec is the brainchild of two concerned fathers who were looking for ways to improve their children's physical and mental well-being. 

Our products are natural and non-invasive, and created specially for urban children. All our products are entirely designed and engineered in Singapore.


WE NEED YOUR HELP!

We already have several working prototypes, and now we are ready for mass production. By pre-ordering the BookBuddy™, you are helping us turn this project into reality so that we can share it with the world. Some of the proceeds may also go into the development of our next exciting product - the EyeBuddy™. 

We need your help in making this come true. Join us in caring for the millions of urban children around the world. Thank you.

story:
Akili Preparatory School is a Kindergarten through 8th Grade school for girls aged between 3 to 15 years in Obunga Slums, Kisumu, Kenya. The school, currently in its 3rd grade expands to the next grade every year until we get to 8th grade in 2020.

My best friend Erick and I (David) were lucky enough to be sponsored through college by well-wishers. After graduating from college, we have returned to our community to empower girls and women having witnessed our mothers and women in the community struggle so hard to raise their families single handedly due to failed marriages and extreme poverty in the slum.


  Our school provides quality education, school uniforms, shoes, text books, backpacks, stationery, computer training and food for the orphans and vulnerable girls in the community. We recruit sponsors who pay $25 monthly to pay teachers wages, buy school supplies, uniforms and food for the girls.

    With a school population of 90 girls this year, we only have sponsors for 30 girls. Every day we provide lunch for the girls through our school feeding program. Our main challenge is that when we prepare lunch for the 30 girls who have sponsors, we cannot tell the 60 girls who do not have sponsors that there is no food for them. So we have been stretching our budget with the meager funds to provide food for all the 90 girls. For most of these girls, this is the only meal they have for the day since most of their parents are always away doing odd jobs or small scale businesses to fend for the family. Besides, with the skyrocketing cost of living in Kenya, many families would rather have one meal at dinner when all the family members are available that at lunch hour when only the kids are back from school.

Through this campaign, our goal is to raise $6,000 so that we can provide lunch for one school year for the 60 girls who do not have sponsors as we continue to recruit sponsors for all of them by the end of the year. It costs $15 to feed one girl monthly and $135 to feed one girl for the entire year.

By donating to this project, you will help provide lunch for these underprivileged girls. If we pass our goal of $6,000, we will be able to support the school program for longer as we work on sustainable projects at our Akili Farm that will see us support the school without relying on donations in the coming months. We currently grow tomatoes and vegetables at the farm. These will be used to feed the girls and the surplus sold to buy other foods like rice and maize meal.

As young people born of the community, we have come back to be the change we want to see in Obunga and its environs. Our vision is to use Akili Preparatory School as a model for the provision of high quality education for girls which can be rolled-out to other schools to help improve student performance and achieve gender equality and empower women in Kenya, Africa and beyond.

We invite you to partner with us to make our dream come true. You can give or sponsor a child yourself or share our campaign link with your friends and encourage them to give or sponsor a child with us. Thank you and God bless you!

For further information on our school and work in Obunga, visit our website www.akilischool.weebly.com and Facebook Page https://www.facebook.com/pages/Akili-Preparatory-School-Library/293226414149078 or Contact our USA Volunteer Coordinator Trinity Cole at trinityc@lifepointpeople.com or trinity_cole@live.com or Email our Director of Operations David Omondi omondidavid@gmail.com

story:
Hey All!

My name is Briana and I am a 3rd year Sociology/Psychology student at Purchase College and an intern at my college's Wellness Center. At the Wellness Center we have yoga instructors and faculty that are certified to help students with all sorts of problems. Our main goal is to help students become mindful and to take care of their wellness (hence the name :D)! In doing so we provide Yoga sessions, massage sessions, a biomat, meditation, interns to talk their non-crisis problems out, and so on. We have had energy work sessions done by past interns too. The problem is that we don't have enough materials and 0 funding to help us expand our sessions.

Wellness is extremely important for college students to learn and to have access to these programs. Stress, anxiety, and depression run high among students as they learn new experiences, deal with large amounts of work, and over all learn to become an adult. Having Yoga, meditation, and all these other classes have benefited students mental health, which helps their physical health as well.

I would like to raise money to bring in my own program of crystal energy work to the Wellness Center. In the past meditation and energy work sessions have attracted a lot of students and had a great outcome. I feel that doing crystal grids and crystal massage therapy will be beneficial along side our yoga programs. I grew up using crystals as a kid and still do today. I find them to help a lot of people refocus their intentions, attention, and re-center themselves. Whether it is true that crystals give off energies that can influence us, or a placebo effect, does not actually matter. What matters is that students are able to find a way to relax so that they can remain focused and healthy. My crystal program would be held 2-4 times a week and would consist of laying down meditation while I constructed the appropriate grids around them.  I will also supply information on what crystals to use for their intentions if they want to meditate alone or buy their own. I am well researched in crystal energy work and have plenty of reference books to refer to if needed be. If I could I would make a profession out of crystal energy work and massage therapy. This is why I am hoping to get funds for this program so that maybe it will lead me to a new path. I am very passionate about crystal energy work and its effects on the body. Launching this program would be so exciting for not just be but the whole Wellness Center.

The funding money will go to purchasing appropriate basic crystal stones, wands, and massage pieces. Blankets and cushions will also be purchased to make a comfortable space for those who participate. I am asking for $500 in funds to achieve this goal.

I want to expand my knowledge and practices with crystals so that I can share it with others. I feel that I can help a lot of people with these practices and create a mindful community. To launch my program would be my way of giving back to the campus. I am a full time student and live off campus so not only is money extremely tight as I commute an hour everyday and back, but I also lack a sense of community from being back and forth. My crystal program can help me establish a sense of purpose and community in this school while helping students with their problems.

Please consider donating even just a little. Every penny will help! Pictures will be provided to show the progress! Take part in the future generation's wellness :) 

If you cannot donate please share this campaign around! It would be great to talk to other crystal users for tips and ideas.

story:
People of Cupertino, we need your help!

Every year, students from Monta Vista High School’s World Literature classes take part in a school wide TED competition. This is a project in which students, using the structure from TED talks, create a beneficial wish for Cupertino or Monta Vista that they hope to see carried out. These ideas are then translated into videos to promote the project put forth by the students. Eventually, one wish is chosen and is then funded and executed. 


Here’s an example of one of our winning projects:

Unfortunately, this year we were unable to receive the funding that would allow the winning project to be accomplished. Please help us overcome this challenge by donating to raise money to be able to execute the winning project. Every cent will go towards making one wish for the community of Cupertino or Monta Vista come true. Whether you can donate or not, please share this page so others can donate, either by using the link or the sharing tools on indiegogo! 

You can see all of our class pictures and other winning projects in the gallery.

Learn more about the MV TED project at http://tedproject.weebly.com/

A giant thank you from the students of World Lit!


Here are some of the projects that our students are working towards achieving for the community!


FUHSD Hackathon
 Our wish is to promote coding among students by holding a district hack session which includes teaching students how to code as well as give them a fun environment to try out coding projects.
 
Establishing Road Reflectors at MV
Our wish is to put in road reflectors around MV where cyclists may ride so that safety pervades campus.

Swap Meet for the Community
Our wish is to create a self-sustaining swap meet for the district so that household and clothing items will go to those in need and the proceeds will serve those in need.
 LED Lights to Line Major MV paths
Our wish is to line major MV paths with LED lights so that safety abounds for all.

Second Harvest Food Collection
Our wish is to help our community by collecting food items annually.

Little Free Libraries
We want to provide a chance for people to own books by allowing people to own books by allowing them to donate and exchange books at one of three free libraries.

Organ Donating Event
We want to host an event that promotes organ donation and raises awareness for the thousands that die everyday because they are unable to receive new organs in time.

Garbage Cans on McClellan
We want to put two garbage cans on McClellan Rd. to create a cleaner and more pleasant environment.

story:
Professional athletes train to win, so should you.

A professional athlete would never go to a tryout without hours of intensive training.  So why do so many aspiring professionals do just that?  Most likely because they were not aware that such training existed or found it too difficult to pursue.

It is time to change the playing field.  It is time to create a professional interviewing service that helps you evaluate and enhance your skills.  A solution that utilizes today's virtual technology and performance analytics to give you the feedback you need to accelerate your career.

Our solution is like no other.

Many interview improvement services exist today. These services are often inconvenient, rely upon prerecorded interviewers, and/or leave the candidate reliant on self-evaluation.

The VIP solution will provide:

  • Resume evaluation
  • Direct, live, and personal interaction
  • Multiple interviewers and reviewers
  • Observational feedback and graphic analysis
  • Professional write up with insightful visualizations

Our team is uniquely suited to develop this solution.

Experience: Over the last two decades, our team has conducted hundreds of interviews for Fortune 500 companies.  We have placed candidates at every level.  We know what it takes to get hired and to succeed. 

Technology: Our team includes talented technologists.  For the past six months, they have been evaluating the technologies needed to create a perfectly balanced and optimized experience.  Video conferencing and recording technologies blend face to face interaction with the convenience and cost effectiveness of our virtual environment.  A great experience to assure the best outcomes.  Cost effective technology to assure our solution is available to everyone who could benefit.

Analysis: With decades of analytic prowess at our disposal, we have developed advanced criteria and decision theory to thoroughly evaluate the strengths and weaknesses of our client's interviewing skills.  We analyze this data and provide actionable feedback to improve the interview skills and abilities of those who enroll in the service.

But we need your help

We are coming to you and the rest of the Indiegogo community for a few good reasons:
  • While technology scales cheaply, initial licensing cost can be considerable.  Freeware rarely provides a great experience or outcome.
  • We are looking for pioneers.  Those who enroll early will not only receive a considerable discount but also know they helped contribute to the success of this great new service.
  • Even if this service is not for you, you likely know someone it could help.  So spread the word! Join the race.

UPDATE - FAQ:

1) How hard is it to schedule an interview and how soon will it happen?

This does depend greatly on your availability. That said, VIP is a completely virtual service so we have a tremendous amount of flexibility. Once you sign up for an interview, you will receive and email outlining a number of possible times within the next two weeks. If that doesn't work for you, we work together to schedule a time that does. We want to make it as convenient as possible, while assuring you also receive the expert attention and mentoring you need.

2) I don't live in the United States, is that a problem?

Not for us. We do request that you speak conversational English. Sorry, the team is diverse but we aren't large enough to support multiple languages (but stay tuned!)

3) Will I need to download special software?

Absolutely not! You only need a reliable internet connection, a web cam, and somewhere relatively quiet to talk. We utilize Google Air technology to facilitate the video session.

4) Is this product available for corporate or sales applications?

Great question! We are currently talking with possible partners in a number of spaces and we would love to talk with you.

5) If you are ready to conduct interviews today, what is the money for?

We have been conducting interviews for a short time now, though long enough to start hearing success stories! The money we raise goes in part to pay for the service. What we raise in addition will be invested into better technology and research. We wish to make this the most convenient and most effective service possible. Helping people secure great jobs is a passion!

UPDATE #2 - Interview Write-up & Artwork:
We added a new image to the gallery showing the latest artwork and graphics for the post interview write-up. The sample shows only five pages of the two dozen or so included. Hope you enjoy.

UPDATE #3 - Success Story:

We caught up with Javier V. this week to thank him for his recent contribution. Javier was one of the original Beta testers of VIP. We are happy to report that he has obtained a great new role with a major Fortune 500 company. Congratulations to Javier. We are excited to know we helped you prepare for this great opportunity.

Thanks for your continued support!
story_txt:
Professional athletes train to win, so should you.
A professional athlete would never go to a tryout without hours of intensive training.  So why do so many aspiring professionals do just that?  Most likely because they were not aware that such training existed or found it too difficult to pursue.
It is time to change the playing field.  It is time to create a professional interviewing service that helps you evaluate and enhance your skills.  A solution that utilizes today's virtual technology and performance analytics to give you the feedback you need to accelerate your career.
   Our solution is like no other. Many interview improvement services exist today. These services are often inconvenient, rely upon prerecorded interviewers, and/or leave the candidate reliant on self-evaluation.
The VIP solution will provide:

Resume evaluation

Direct, live, and personal interaction
Multiple interviewers and reviewers

Observational feedback and graphic analysis

Professional write up with insightful visualizations    Our team is uniquely suited to develop this solution.

story:
The fundraising campaign continues, follow this link! http://louflorez.com/help-fund-lou/

Help me better serve the Orishas, and serve you! 

Hi Loves! This is your friendly neighborhood Orisha priest, rootworker, folklorist, and social justice activist & advocate who is working to do something pretty huge!
October brought a life-changing opportunity to not only uplift my conditions but to give me further ritual training, education, skills, and energy so I can be an even better priest, teacher, and advocate for my beloved community.
What's the Opportunity?
Based upon my dedication to community and service over the years, an invitation has been extended to travel to Nigeria in February with an esteemed elder and teacher, and to take the high priesthood initiation in IFA, the root of all Orisha religions. In addition to receiving this once-in-a-lifetime spiritual elevation, I will also train in traditional medicine making, and herbalism.
Who am I?
I'm Lou and I'm a magical guy! :-)
I'm deeply moved, inspired, and motivated by our innate connection to the life-giving force in all its forms. Over the years I have had the blessed opportunity, and amazing good fortune, to learn from indigenous healers, teachers, elders, artists, and activists in a variety  of traditions and forms. 
The IFA Tradition, born in Nigeria and transported throughout the world during the Middle Passage, is not only beautiful and awe-inspiring, but it has profoundly impacted the way I live in the world. The teachings view the cosmos as imbued with emanate life force and spiritual power which supports our individual journeys and evolutionary processes as we move towards the biggest versions of ourselves and our lives.
Where will I be and what will I be doing?
I will be traveling throughout Nigeria for twenty one days during the initiation and training process, but some of the highlights are: 
-visiting  Osogobo and meeting the Oshun River, temple, and community
-traveling to Ile Ife  and Ekiti for ceremony
-going to one of the world's oldest witchcraft markets!
Expenses
-Passport, Visa, Flight, Immunization shots

-All activities, lodging, initiation costs, supplies, food, etc..

-Basic expenses stipend to cover my time away from work

All additional money earned will be donated to Orisha communities throughout Nigeria.

If I  do not raise the entire funds I need to make this trip, the proceeds will be used for creating Orisha related events in Oakland and the Bay. But if you help me, I will surely be able to take this huge step in my spiritual life!


Your benefit 

-Access to teachings, trainings, and medicine direct from Africa

-Cultural preservation, help support the survival of indigenous teachers, artists,and communities

-Statues, fabric, divination tools, and Orisha related items brought back for you! 

-Supporting a working class, queer, man of color dedicated to anti-oppression work and the liberation of all!


Challenges

Time is a critical component in terms of fundraising for this trip. Due to the timing of these initiations, in terms of season, divination,&  astrological influences as well as the schedule of the presiding priestesses and priests in these communities, these ceremonies  and teachings are only being offered in February, 2015. This requires a large group of teachers who do not come together very frequently. So please, give today! 


Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please  make some noise about what I'm doing by posting on your social networking sites, and sending some messages to people who you think might help!
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools  to help link to my campaign!
  • Please pray for my success in this endeavor for the benefit of all! Ashé!

story:
Hello everyone I am an aspiring Expressive Arts Therapist. I was led to study abroad in Canada for love and the arts. I have always loved the arts. I studied music in Chicago and it was through music school that I learned that above a musician I am an emotionalist. I love music because of how it allows me to connect with my intuition while expressing universal emotions to myself and those around me. It is through this connection that we can feel the interconnected creative force that unites us all. 

Expressive arts therapy is intermodal (poetry, drama, comedy,visual arts, music etc) healing and expression through the arts.

As a client of expressive arts therapy I have experienced the power of the arts as a transformative tool for healing throughout your life. What I see with EXA is that the client is empowered to actively transform an event, thought or feeling through the arts. It is through the power of the arts and trusting the creative process that this healing takes place. With EXA we see the therapist as a companion and the client as the expert on their life and we are there to help facilitate this healing through the arts and to witness. 

I fell in love with EXA from the moment I started this school and continue to do so with every class. I am the kind of person that has an interest in all the arts. I am particularly fascinated on it's affects on our emotions and states of being. In music school I found studying one instrument limiting since I play drums, guitar, bass and voice.  I am an artist that loves poetry, acting, drama, visual art, writing, and music. With EXA I no longer have limits and I am able to further explore and develop my fascination with the arts and it's healing effects on people.  And for the first time I feel like I know that I am exactly where I need to be- studying EXA. 

So why do I need your help? As an international student in a private school there are very limited scholarships and even loans available to me. With student loans from my BA and living expenses in a foreign country I have been finding it very difficult to fund my tuition for this school and therefore continue my education here in Toronto.  Which is why I have to come up with creative ways to fund my education. 

WHY SHOULD YOU HELP??

My dream is to make expression through the arts as available to people as a yoga class. Who needs expression through the arts? EVERYONE 

Living a healthy lifestyle is not just about your physical body it is about your mental and emotional states as well. 

I want to make expressing through the arts an option for people. When you're having a bad day- take an expressive arts class.

 When you're going through a breakup- take an expressive arts class. 

When you're having a good day and want to expand on that feeling- take an expressive arts class. 

So I invite you to help me come closer to making this dream a reality!

story: ...

Banyan is a non-profit community center based in Bratislava, Slovakia. 

Has been opened since September 2014 as a place to provide safe and cozy environment for a self-development projects. In this short period of time we had open various yoga classes and courses, we have organized community events, seminars, group meditations.
We work also with seniors and organize three yoga courses a week specialized for them. We have classes also in English for our lovely expat community.

Banyan centrum is a "dream come true" project of the founder Eva Zajasenska (http://journeyofbohemian.com/), who is creating also this project to rise funds for a bigger studio.

The community is growing and our current studio with 30 m2 is too small for our activities. Still more and more people would like to join our classes, presentations, meetings and we would like to welcome them and inspire as many people as possible. 
We do not have at the moment a changing room and shower, the main room is only 20 m2. 
The bigger space would allow us to make much more interesting events. For example intuitive dance nights, music concerts, dynamic meditations etc. 
I wish to find a place in a nice central location with trees and greenery around. 
With proper changing room, place to sit before and after the events and enjoy a small chat or cup of nice tea.
We would like to organize much more free events: meditations, movie nights, community meetings etc.
The funds will help us to support one year rent. In the case we can find a good deal we would invest the rest of money to buy some basic equipment as a good quality yoga mats, meditation pillows, radio and speakers which are more then needed.
Banyan is an open community which provides  space and support beginning teachers, interesting projects, group meditations, presentations etc. 
Thank you very much for your contribution and for spreading the word about our campaign and sharing it with your friends.

Slovenská verzia
Banyan je komunitné centrum zamerané na osobnostný rozvoj človeka, založené v septembri 2014 v Bratislave. 
V súčasnosti vedieme hodiny a kurzy jogy, cvičenie pre seniorov, organizujeme semináre, meditácie a cestovateľské prezentácie.
Naša činnosť a členovia sa stále rozrastá a naše súčasné priestory 30m2 sú nám veľmi tesné. 
Touto zbierkou by sme chceli získať finančnú pomoc na prenajatie väčších priestorov, ktoré budú vhodné na našu činnosť a umožnia nám rozšíriť aktivity pre väčší počet ľudí. Rovnako nám vaše príspevky pomôžu k zakúpeniu vybavenia a pomôcok, ktoré potrebujeme.
Radi by sme v budúcnosti poskytli priestor viacerým ľuďom a projektom. Otvorili nové aktivity, ktoré si vyžadujú väčší priestor. Ako napríklad intuitívny tanec, hudobný koncert, cestovateľské prezentácie, dynamické meditácie a pod. 
V novom priestore by sme radi pre vás mali šatňu, sprchu, priestor na posedenie a prípadne vypitie čajíka. 
Chceli by sme organizovať viac podujatí, ktoré by boli zadarmo alebo za dobrovoľný príspevok. Ako napríklad meditácie, filmové večery, stretnutia a pod. 
Prečítajte si o nás v tomto blogu: http://www.journeyofbohemian.com/?p=1752
alebo na našej webovej stránke: http://banyan.webnode.sk/o-nas/
Článok napísaný k tejto kampani: http://banyan.webnode.sk/news/kampan-pre-banyan-centrum/
Sme veľmi vďační za každý jeden príspevok, za to, že vám záleží na projektoch a práci robenej z lásky a za to, že projekt zdielate.

story:
Short Summary

Notre Dame High School (NDHS)  in Harper Woods, Michigan closed its doors in June of 2005.  Since then, the video and film library has been stored by the Mandl family in a storage locker on behalf of the Notre Dame Alumni.  After ten years in storage, it is now time to bust open the storage totes and get the footage converted from film and VHS to electronic format so this library can be enjoyed by all. 

I, Jim Mandl, am a 1990 graduate of NDHS.  I have acted as president of the alumni association on a volunteer basis for the past ten years.  My father, Jim Mandl '66, acted as vice president.  We talked often about what to do with the video and film library.  It was always his vision to get the library converted to electronic format and upload to the internet for all to see. 

I intend to use the funds raised from this campaign to fulfill my father's vision of having the video and film library converted to an electronic format that can be uploaded to the internet and burned on DVD.

This will be a massive undertaking as there are hundreds of videos and films that need to be converted.  With a limited yearly budget, cost has always been prohibitive.  This is why I need your assistance with this campaign.  Please consider contributing through one of the reward packages I have created within this IndieGoGo campaign.


What We Need & What You Get

I estimate that it will cost around $4,500 to convert the entire library. 

We also need funds to cover the cost of rewards in the campaign and shipping of the rewards.

When the campaign concludes, the funds will be transferred to the Friends of Notre Dame High School credit union account.  They will be stored there until the bill is due for the conversion of the library.  

In the event that we do not raise enough funds to convert the entire library, I will use the funds to convert films first.  Videos will be converted as funds become available. 

In the event that we surpass our campaign fund raising goal, extra funds will be disbursed to the Jim Mandl '66 Memorial Scholarship Award.  We honor my father each year with a scholarship towards the Catholic school tuition of a son, daughter, and/or grandchild of an NDHS graduate. 


The Impact

I firmly believe this is a worthy campaign in which to raise funds.  Over the past ten years, countless NDHS alumni have inquired about the video and film library.  Now, all NDHS graduates will be able to enjoy the library in a form that they choose - DVD or viewing on the internet. 


    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you are unable to assist with a donation to this campaign, there are certainly other ways you can help.  

    1) If you offer video and film conversion services, I would love to receive a quote  from you

    2) You can tell people about the campaign

    3) You can send an email about the campaign to your address book

    4) You can use the Indiegogo share tools to post the campaign to your website, Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, etc.


    Thank you!

    Jim Mandl '90 

    President, Notre Dame Alumni Association

I, Jim Mandl, am a 1990 graduate of NDHS.  I have acted as president of the alumni association on a volunteer basis for the past ten years.  My father, Jim Mandl '66, acted as vice president.  We talked often about what to do with the video and film library.  It was always his vision to get the library converted to electronic format and upload to the internet for all to see.  
I intend to use the funds raised from this campaign to fulfill my father's vision of having the video and film library converted to an electronic format that can be uploaded to the internet and burned on DVD. 
This will be a massive undertaking as there are hundreds of videos and films that need to be converted.  With a limited yearly budget, cost has always been prohibitive.  This is why I need your assistance with this campaign.  Please consider contributing through one of the reward packages I have created within this IndieGoGo campaign. 

  What We Need & What You Get
I estimate that it will cost around $4,500 to convert the entire library.  
We also need funds to cover the cost of rewards in the campaign and shipping of the rewards. 
When the campaign concludes, the funds will be transferred to the Friends of Notre Dame High School credit union account.  They will be stored there until the bill is due for the conversion of the library.  
In the event that we do not raise enough funds to convert the entire library, I will use the funds to convert films first.  Videos will be converted as funds become available.  
In the event that we surpass our campaign fund raising goal, extra funds will be disbursed to the Jim Mandl '66 Memorial Scholarship Award.  We honor my father each year with a scholarship towards the Catholic school tuition of a son, daughter, and/or grandchild of an NDHS graduate.  
  The Impact I firmly believe this is a worthy campaign in which to raise funds.  Over the past ten years, countless NDHS alumni have inquired about the video and film library.  Now, all NDHS graduates will be able to enjoy the library in a form that they choose - DVD or viewing on the internet.       Other Ways You Can Help If you are unable to assist with a donation to this campaign, there are certainly other ways you can help.  
1) If you offer video and film conversion services, I would love to receive a quote  from you
2) You can tell people about the campaign
3) You can send an email about the campaign to your address book
4) You can use the Indiegogo share tools to post the campaign to your website, Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, etc.


Thank you!


Jim Mandl '90 President, Notre Dame Alumni Association

story:
There are almost no contemporary books  available on the island of St Kitts, and the need is great.

Over 700 books were donated and shipped to St Kitts. An under used building in Mansion was to be the first and only READING ROOM & BOOK EXCHANGE  on the island, providing  the largest diversity books on the island... for free. There are however a few gaps, not enough children's books or books for young adults.

THE NO. 1  READING ROOM AND BOOK EXCHANGE HAS BEEN A GREAT SUCCESS

However, it still requires additional book shelves for about 400 books, plus tables and chairs for a more functional and friendly environment.  The tables would provide a stable and clean area for the children to play board games, draw and put together puzzles.. My niece suggested I bring skipping ropes, which thankfully I did and the kids love them and return them everyday.
With some help from volunteers in the community and a constant rotation of books,  both new and old, plus magazines,  other communities might be encouraged to open additional reading rooms in St. Kitts & Nevis
I am not a charity, nor a NGO, but a  grandmother with limited funds who wishes to complete her mission before she returns to Canada. Everything on the island is expensive since it must be shipped in. The following list may not be complete and although  prices  have been checked,  there might be some flexibility. 

2  large folding tables with plastic tops 620.00XCD each =       1,240.00XCD
12 folding chairs aprox. 130.00XCD each =                                      1,560.00XCD

1 replacement door with lock aprox.                                                  2,300.00XCD

1 garbage container to clear area of debris, delivery & pick-up     300.00XCD

1 student book shelves, bricks and wood shelves aprox.                250.00XCD
5 gallons of white paint                                                                                700.00XCD
3 paint trays with roller                                                                                170.00XCD


cleaning supplies etc                                                                                   300.00XCD
board games                                                                                                   100.00XCD
delivery fees aprox.                                                                                       150.00XCD


Please friend me, and send me a message, ask questions etc. via FACEBOOK
https://www.facebook.com/alle.jilesen

story: We are currently raising money for mats, training pads, and mirrors. We are a christian based Martial arts school opening by june of this year in Hialeah, FL dedicated to teaching children and adults how to live joyful abundant lives through the word of God while learning how to defend themselves and there families. We focus on training the body, mind, and most importantly the soul. Due to the high cost of after school activities most children must do without extracurricular activities. They end up missing out on skills like teamwork and proper exercise techniques or necessary principles like integrity and perseverance. Our main goal is to allow these children the opportunity to become great by believing in themselves. For this reason our enrollment is extremely cheap compared to other schools.

story:
The Coraopolis Train Station can be core of our community again.

With its revitalization, it will be so much more than the transportation hub that it was before. 

It will be the center of an active and vital community here in Coraopolis. The meeting place that welcomes residents and neighbors. The magnet that attracts shops, restaurants, retail businesses, and commerce. The heart of our community life. 

The Coraopolis Train Station stands as an outstanding example of the unique Richardson Romanesque architecture. Named after famed architect Henry Hobson Richardson, this style features rounded arches, recessed entrances, and short, strong columns. 

This proud, distinguished structure deserves to be restored and cherished. It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places by the Pittsburgh History and Landmarks Foundation in 1978. It was added to the National Register of Historic Places in 1979. And it was named one of Pittsburgh’s Top Ten Best Preservation Opportunities in 2010 by the Young Preservationists Association of Pittsburgh. 

The Train Station’s elegant presence and historical value have long been recognized. But steps were never taken to save it.

Until now.

In 2008, four local couples purchased the Train Station and immediately donated it to the Coraopolis Community Development Foundation – and organization they established to oversee the Station Project as well as other community initiatives.

The goal is to completely restore it, while retaining its unique character and architecture, and transform it into a multi-use community center. 

Because Coraopolis is the terminus of the Montour Trail, a part of the Rails to Trails network from our town to McKeesport, people walking and cycling on the trail will visit the new Train Station as a stop along their way. The station will also serve as the junction between the Ohio River and Montour Trails. In the future you'll be able to ride to Ohio and Washington DC from here.

The buzz and energy from the transformed Train Station will attract more people. That in turn will generate more interest in our area and bring in more shops, retail stores, restaurants, and other businesses. This development will spur even more development. 

It’s the start of new growth for Coraopolis. And it all begins with the restoration and renovation of the Coraopolis Train Station. There’s new energy and a new vision of what Coraopolis can become. 

We need your help. We will be asking, corporations, organizations, government and foundations for financial support. What we need right now is you.

Your support, your enthusiasm, and your civic pride are vital to making this project work to benefit us all. 

Together we can restore the historic Coraopolis Train Station, create a new and vital community center in our town, and generate new growth and development in our community.

Join us! 

Renovating and revitalizing the Coraopolis Train Station is a big project, and it has a detailed, well-thought-out plan, with the numbers, the priorities, and the waves of progress required for reaching completion on time and on budget. We’ve already completed an engineering study to assess the structural integrity of the building, and have received designs for both the interior and exterior elements. We’ve now identified the next steps, and have broken them down into three phases.

Phase One consists of the most immediate needs — new roofing.

Phase Two goes deeper into the infrastructure, with items like rough carpentry, masonry, electrical, plumbing, flooring, windows, and doors. 

In Phase 3, we’re getting closer to completion. We’ll take care of the remaining necessities as well as the aesthetic elements, with items like finish carpentry, tiling, plaster, painting, and signage. 

The total cost to renovate and repurpose the Train Station is between $1,000,000 and $1.6 million. A small price, when you think about it, for the revitalization it will bring to our communities throughout Coraopolis now and in the future.


You can donate any amount you choose. Thank you for considering our project!


The Train Station project is an initiative of The Coraopolis Community Development Foundation, the most active nonprofit in the borough. Since 2008, the CCDF has worked to provide a variety of service needs to the community, including food, ESL classes, after school youth programs, and more.

story:
Youth Leadership Institute is building communities that invest in youth!

Why now?

In honor of Youth Leadership Institute (YLI) hiring Jonathan Marker as their new CEO, a group of funders has come together with a $14,000 matching gift.  Your donation will be matched dollar for dollar to ensure that the young people with whom YLI partners can research and develop the campaigns that are most important to them.  

Who are we?

YLI is a youth development organization that uses a social justice lens to support young people in building healthier, more equitable communities.

What we need:

  • YLI gets funding from government grants, foundations, and YOU!  For every dollar you contribute, you are letting young people choose the projects they work on.
  • The first $14,000 raised will be matched.
The Impact:

For 23 years, Youth Leadership Institute (YLI) has sparked the development of young people to identify and create solutions for community change. Born out of a realization that youth are often denied decision-making opportunities, YLI gives young people a say in the programs and systems affecting them. 

YLI develops young people by focusing on issues such as education, health, environmentalism, and economic security, YLI is cultivating engaged and dynamic young leaders today in order to create a more equitable and sustainable society tomorrow.

Our model is grounded in a youth development framework that employs evidence-based approaches and emphasizes the importance of healthy youth-adult partnerships.

91% of youth respondents surveyed agreed that they “had the opportunity to build and practice skills in my program.”


Where do we work?

For over 20 years, YLI has sparked the leadership of young people to solve pressing issues in their communities. With offices in San Francisco, San Mateo, Fresno, and Marin, YLI is positioned to connect the San Francisco Bay Area and California’s Central Valley.

YLI also has a national reach, providing Training and Technical Assistance and capacity-building support to organizations and groups across the country.

81% of youth agreed that, “my program has helped to create some type of positive change in our community.”

Who do we serve?

YLI engages historically-marginalized youth in becoming civic leaders. Currently, 92% of youth served by YLI are people of color, and nearly 60% are from low-income backgrounds.

Since its founding, YLI has worked with over 80,000 young people in over 200 communities nationally and abroad.

Learn More!

  • To learn more about YLI, please visit our website at www.yli.org, email info@yli.org, or call (415) 836-9160.
  • Take a look at our Annual Report video above or on our website: http://yli.org/getinvolved.
  • Join our email list: http://eepurl.com/I4-VH

Other ways you can help:

Some people can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Share this campaign with your friends and family
  • If you live in the Bay Area or Central Valley, let us know how you would like to help as an adult ally for one of YLI's programs: info@yli.org

story: I am raising money to fund the entire trip, including food, tuition, fees, airfare, and living expense. If fully funded, I will be able to go to Vietnam and Cambodia to work with impoverished children in poverty-stricken areas. Also, there will be courses taught on community health, social work, and social issues occurring in the country. My overall goal is to take the lessons I learn from this trip, and bring it back to the United States to better our communities and lifestyle.

Also, there will be courses taught on community health, social work, and social issues occurring in the country. My overall goal is to take the lessons I learn from this trip, and bring it back to the United States to better our communities and lifestyle.

story:
Hi! My name is Vid and I'm from Slovenia. I've always wanted to be involved with Events Industry and now I have a chance.
I have applied to two different universities in the UK and both have made me an offer. The problem is that in Slovenia, there are no tuition fees and that is also why in Slovenia banks do not give loans to students. 
My tuition fees will probably be covered by Student Finance England but there are still everyday expenses- accommodation, food, books, etc.
Since there are no loans for living costs in the UK or in Slovenia, I am on my own. I need to raise funds to help me pay for living costs while studying. I have saved some money from when I was working during summers and this summer I'll be working again but unfortunately this still doesn't cover all the costs. 
I know that all around the world people are struggling to pay the bills but I would be most grateful if you could spare some money to help me achieve my dreams.

story:
Short Summary

For over 40 years Blackstrap Youth Camp has been offering week-long camping experience to Saskatoon and district youth. In recent years we are finding that most of the interest in Camp is coming from those who cannot afford it - recent immigrants, children of single-parent families, or otherwise impoverished families. Saskatoon Knights of Columbus and allied organizations are doing their utmost to allow as many of these youth to attend Camp as financially possible, but funding sources have dwindled. We need your help!

What We Need & What You Get

The last few years about 300 youth attend who are able to pay in full. Camp capacity is 600. We know from speaking with School counselors that if funding was available we could easily fill the Camp.

  • At our current rate of $230 per child, fees for 300 campers are $69,000
  • Even if the entire goal is not met, the funds will all be used for sponsorship.
  • We are a registered Charity so besides knowing that you have helped put a smile on a young person's face, your sponsorship is tax-deductible.

The Impact

The Camp cannot continue operations if attendance remains significantly below capacity.

  • It is an excellent setting to foster understanding of other cultures, races, creeds, genders and financial conditions.
  • Parents and youth get a break, and as a result learn greater appreciation for each other.
  • Your contribution will help enable continuation of this unique opportunity for youth.

Other Ways You Can Help

If your piggy bank is empty, you still can help by:

  • Spreading the word and making some noise about us through social media.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
The Vision

After experiencing the loss of a breast to cancer I was very uncomfortable and self-conscious about going back out in public looking so different… and feeling so, "disproportionate".  That all changed when I came across an amazing simple solution called Knitted Knockers™.  Immediately I knew that these needed to be made available to women everywhere. After several dead-ends trying to find out more about them, how to make them, and how to use them, I made it my mission to create a website, www.knittedknockers.org,  that combined all the best research and resources on the topic.

Knitted Knockers™ are special, knit prostheses handcrafted with love by volunteer knitters (and crocheters) who want to show they care for breast cancer survivors in a tangible way.  Knitted Knockers™ are distributed FREE online through the website, www.knittedknockers.org, and through designated distribution points.  Though they could be manufactured commercially the special knowledge of knowing someone cared enough to make this special gift makes a huge difference. The person making them also benefits from knowing they are making a tangible difference to someone at a vulnerable time.

A Knitted Knocker

The vision has grown from providing knitted knockers just to the women and medical clinics of Barbara's own community to spreading the model of regional groups of kindhearted knitters sharing their time and talent to hand craft these beautiful works of art as free gifts of inspiration and compassion for as many breast cancer survivors as possible everywhere.

Literally over 2.5 million women living in the United States RIGHT NOW have had mastectomies, 1.2 million of those have not been reconstructed.  Yes, that’s 1,200,000!!!!  Knitted Knockers™ is making a difference in the quality of life for many of these women by providing them with a simple, soft, beautiful and huggable breast prosthesis that can be worn with most regular bras.

Traditional breast forms can be hot, heavy, sweaty, expensive and require special mastectomy bras.  A typical prosthesis with a specialty bra can cost between $300-$800.  Many women have given up on wearing them.  As one woman stated, "hers are stored up with the Christmas decorations only to be brought out on special occasions".

Why We Need Your Support

Knittedknockers.org's vision is to offer free knitted knockers to every breast cancer survivor in the United States and ultimately the world who could benefit from them. 

This includes those right now in the midst of their battle (over 50,000 mastectomies per year in the US alone)... as well as the countless women who have already had mastectomies and are just now hearing of Knitted Knockers.

There are other provider groups out there but the mixed blessing of getting to share her story recently with several major news organizations…is that the demand has far exceeded all of Barbara's expectations. With current online requests of over 140 per month and going up rapidly, postage alone is a major expense.   Funds are needed to connect volunteer groups with the over 550 accredited breast clinics around the United States to provide them with a reliable source of Knitted Knockers™ for distribution.

This funding goal will allow us to equip and support volunteer knitters to provide for at least 20 more breast clinics in the next year while continuing to provide for online requests. More money means more women served sooner! The eventual goal is to provide for 2 or more breast clinics per state within 3 years (100 breast clinics providing an estimated 20,000 Knitted Knockers™ per year).

Volunteer Knitters

Funds will be used for ongoing support of the website,  www.knittedknockers.org as a portal to provide Knitted Knockers™ to the women who do not currently have access to Knitted Knockers™ in their community.  The website has video tutorials, free patterns, links to provider groups and other resources to equip both users and providers.

knittedknockers.org

You will be providing funds to generate publicity to spread the word of the availability to any woman who wants their own Knitted Knockers™.  It will allow us to have a presence in the many large events held all over the country such as Relay for Life, Race for the Cure, Fiber shows, radio and television news broadcasts.

Relay for Life Booth

The Impact of your Support

Indiegogo is an amazing website where people help others bring their heroic dreams and great ideas to life.  It's an opportunity for people around the world to invest in those dreams and get something in return for their investment.  In this case... you'll get more than just some-"thing" in return though. 

·  You get the satisfaction in knowing you've given comfort, encouragement, and confidence to women who are warriors in the battle against breast cancer.

·  You put a smile on a woman's face in a very difficult time of her life.

·  You have assisted a knitter or crocheter to make good use of their skills in making Knitted Knockers™ for a great cause.

·  You have equipped breast clinics to provide a valuable service to their clients.  It gives them great joy to be able to provide the women with a free knitted knocker of their choice at a very vulnerable time and to show them that even complete strangers can show that they care.

Best said by one of the hundreds of testimonies we get:

     "I heard about your organization in December while watching an Orlando, Fl news station. My husband's nephew's wife had just been diagnosed with breast cancer. I went to my local yarn shop, purchased the yarn and made her a pair. I've been telling friends about your project and several have started making knockers. So far I've made 3 pairs, purchased more yarn today so I can make more. One of the ladies just couldn't stop crying when I gave her a pair. This is a wonderful project. Thank you for being there. I'll keep knitting and telling ladies about you.  Brenda"

Why are we asking for money?

Knitted Knockers™ is currently represented in 13 states and is filling requests and working with groups from many other countries as well. With these funds we will expand our reach to 10 more states in the next year. This should allow annually about 4,000 additional women to receive Knitted Knockers™ provided from their own communities in addition to the thousands given out online from the website.  Extra funds will be used to expand the reach to even more states.  Ultimately the vision is to have Knitted Knockers™ available in at least 2 communities per state in the United States and continue to support groups in other countries where requested.  The expectation is to accomplish this within three years.

What are we going to do with it?

Dollars collected will be used to set up collection points using a franchise model through yarn shops and various existing guilds while maintaining quality control. Funds will be used to equip and supply distribution points through accredited breast clinics and generate publicity to get the good news out about Knitted Knockers™ to the hundreds of thousands of women that can use them.

Where do the dollars go?

In order to create and support these new groups and breast clinics it will require funds for marketing, travel, training, printed materials, supplies, postage, etc.  All labor is volunteer and no wages are taken for administrative purposes.  Booths at events such as Relay for Life, Fiber Arts Fairs, health fairs along with TV, radio and print ads will be utilized to spread the word to volunteer knitters who can provide them and the breast cancer survivors who can use them.  

Social media sites such as Facebook, Pinterest, Twitter, Google+, and Instagram will be utilized to spread the word.  Our website, www.knittedknockers.org will continue to be a main portal to allow women to order free Knitted Knockers™ that don't have providers in their community as well as equip knitters to make them and shops to become collection points.  Postage and handling costs are substantial for providing knitted knockers through the website so any groups that can be equipped to provide directly to their own communities saves these costs in the long term.


It's a Tax Deductible Donation!

Knitted Knockers™ Support Foundation is a non profit 501(c(3). The Rewards have been carefully chosen in consideration and support of breast cancer causes.  If you opt out of the reward all or part of your gift may be tax deductible as a charitable contribution.  Please check with your tax advisor.

Any funds received over our goal will enable us to spread the word and serve more women sooner!

Risks and challenges

Our risks are minimal as we have been operating for awhile developing the model by which to connect the networks of volunteer knitters with the breast clinics to provide free Knitted Knockers™ to the women that need them. The largest risk we have is that as word gets out the demand will surpass the network of volunteer knitters. The risk is minimized as there are literally thousands of existing groups of knitters and crocheters that are organized and ready and willing to knit "charity" projects.

The challenge is equipping them to do what they do well, knitting, and connecting them with the medical clinics and websites for distribution. Our model enables us to do that. Most yarn shops have these groups operating through their stores. It is a win/win for the stores to sign up for the program as it generates sales of yarn, traffic in the store as knitters drop off their completed knockers, and goodwill of being associated with such a worthwhile project.

We will connect with breast clinics across the country this year to establish one distribution point per state to provide for their own communities (about 200 knockers per community). Requests from women from areas not yet served will be met online through the websites. With hundreds of yarn shops in the US and around the world hearing about this great cause, we're discovering so many are excited to participate. The expectation is that each distribution point will provide around 200 Knitted Knockers™ per year to their community. That’s as simple as 17 knitters making just 1 Knitted Knocker each per month. Any excess knockers created can be sent to the national group for distribution from our website.

Other Ways You Can Help

Know someone who would be just as inspired as you are about Knitted Knockers? Share our campaign with them through the "Share this project" button at the top. Sharing is caring!

 Please share with your friends and family!

Please Tweet our campaign to your audience!


Perks List

Perks are optional and meant to show our thank you for contributing to the cause. Don't need a "Perk"?  Then more of your contribution will go to generate and distribute knitted knockers to the women who can use them.  The amount eligible for a tax deduction will be reduced by the value of the perk selected.

Some perks have images and they are shown below.

Awareness Stitch Marker $10 Pledge

1 Swarovski Crystal Stitch Marker

Printed Window Stickers $10 Pledge

Knitted Knockers Window Stickers

 4 Swarovski Crystal Stitch Markers $20 Pledge

 4 Swarovski Crystal Stitch Markers

8 Swarovski Crystal Stitch Markers with Charm- $35 Pledge

8 Swarovski Crystal Stitch Markers with Charm

Knitted Knockers T Shirt Men or Women Sizes- $75 Pledge

Knitted Knockers T Shirt- Mens and Womens

Custom Set of Knitted Knockers- $100 Pledge

Custom Knockers made in the color & yarn you like

Hope for a Cure Crystal Butterfly Pin- $150 Pledge


Hope for a Cure Crystal Butterfly Pin

Valentina: Silver plate pendant with cord- $150

Valentina: Silver plate pendant with cord

 Elena Gold plate pendant with chain- $200

Elena Gold plate pendant with chain

Alma "Beneath the Breast Beats the Heart" Bracelet-$200

Alma "Beneath the Breast Beats the Heart" Bracelet

 Antonia Leather Wrap Bracelet- $200

Antonia leather wrap bracelet

 Sterling silver earrings- $1000

Sterling silver earrings

THANK YOU

 for making a difference to breast cancer survivors everywhere!

The
Vision
After experiencing the loss of a
breast to cancer I was very uncomfortable and self-conscious about going back
out in public looking so different… and feeling so,
"disproportionate".  That all changed when I came across an
amazing simple solution called Knitted Knockers™.  Immediately I knew
that these needed to be made available to women everywhere. After several
dead-ends trying to find out more about them, how to make them, and how to use
them, I made it my mission to create a website, www.knittedknockers.org,  that combined all the
best research and resources on the topic.
Knitted Knockers™ are special,
knit prostheses handcrafted with love by volunteer knitters (and crocheters)
who want to show they care for breast cancer survivors in a tangible way. 
Knitted Knockers™ are distributed FREE online
through the website, www.knittedknockers.org, and through
designated distribution points.  Though they could be manufactured
commercially the special knowledge of knowing someone cared enough to make this
special gift makes a huge difference. The person making them also benefits from
knowing they are making a tangible difference to someone at a vulnerable time.


A Knitted Knocker

The vision has grown from providing knitted knockers just to the
women and medical clinics of Barbara's own community to spreading the
model of regional groups of kindhearted knitters sharing their time and talent
to hand craft these beautiful works of art as free gifts of inspiration and
compassion for as many breast cancer survivors as possible everywhere.
Literally over 2.5 million women
living in the United States RIGHT NOW have

that’s 1,200,000!!!!  Knitted Knockers™ is making a
difference in the quality of life for many of these women by providing them

prosthesis that can be worn with most regular bras.
