story:
About We-Speek.com

We-Speek is an Educational Social Network which offers to members all possible features where they can learn and practice foreign languages they study or just want to know thanks to multiple solutions that it offers, like: instant messaging system, vocal and video-chat, hiring of teachers and much more, users improve their studies of foreign language, experience new cultures and meet new friends all over the world.


Problem

Consumers spend a lot of time searching for a service like ours and at the end they can't find it

There are still no site which satisfies all need of consumer




Solution

Social Networking website which will offer all possible features to help consumers with study and practice of foreign languages, find new friends abroad and learn about new cultures


Why we do it?

Online learning becomes very important industry nowadays, every day the number of students who is seeking for free and useful services is increasing, so we want to offer this service.

We want especially help people from all over the world to study and practice foreign languages, we want to make the world more open, we want people to have the ease of finding new friends abroad, we want people to not only study, but also have fun.


How will the funds be used?

Our approximate cost breakdown is as follows:

1. Establishment of the company in USA  = €3500,00


2. Rent office for the first three months = €1900,00


3. Own servers and at least 3 computers with necessary software = €2500,00


4. Salaries for first-rate team (at least 5 developers in different areas)for the first three months = €30000,00


5. Advertising on internet (SEO, SMM, CPC, CPV and others) to make us visible from all over the world = €8000,00

6. The remaining €4100,00 will go to other paper promotion.


The beta version of the platform is already on the net, try it by yourself, visit http://we-speek.com

Check also our Video press release

story:
This is a Personal Story

Over the last couple of years my friends and I have spent countless hours learning new technologies with the help of various video training courses. Working in the IT sector keeping up to date with rapidly changing technological trends is an absolute must. We have plenty of personal experience about the advantages and disadvantages of using video based learning solutions.  

One of the issues that kept coming up in conversations was how tedious it was to take notes and synchronize the notes with the videos. Without a link between videos and notes going back to double check some information was tedious and impractical. After a while we actually gave up trying. However, this hindered the learning process and we realized we have to find a better solution. The idea of a video player that was optimized for learning from video courses was born about a year ago and slowly our concepts started to take form. We drew not only from our experiences but talked to many other people and finally we put together a list with most prevalent problems and recommendations for their solutions. These solutions form the core functionality of the MoocPlayer software.


The Problem with Video Players


  • Existing video players are designed for watching movies and TV shows and listening to music. In these cases having to pause and start the video multiple times is a rare occurrence. When learning from video trainings you will have to stop the video several times to memorize some  piece of information, try out some solution recommended in the video or take some notes. Having to continuously push pause and play become tedious very fast.

  • It’s often difficult to decide where to store your notes. You can write notes on paper, in a document on your computer or you can use some online note taking solution. In none of these cases will the notes be linked with the specific video they relate to and especially not to the place in the video from where the information originated. This makes rechecking information extremely inconvenient especially if you watched hundreds of training videos.

  • Typically video training courses contain very dense educational material. The seconds you lose pressing pause and play or when you simultaneously try listening and taking notes can easily translate into missed information.

  • A picture is worth a thousand words. Sometimes saving a screenshot of the video frame is an incredibly useful way of capturing information. Normally each screenshot requires several additional steps and organizing them in any meaningful way is a cause for headache.

  • Wouldn’t you like a clearly structured, standardized summary of your notes?  A summary where the different types of information in your notes are aggregated. Wouldn’t it be great for example if you had a collection of all Photoshop keyboard shortcuts you learned about?

  • Video training courses typically contain a large number of video files organized into chapters. Making a playlist that takes into consideration the chapter structure is not supported by popular video players. All the videos will be dumped into one simple list. This presents an especially frustrating problem when videos are numbered similarly in every chapter and thus the order is messed up.

  • There is an abundance of amazing training videos and tutorials on YouTube. Wouldn’t it be great to create a playlist in your video player from YouTube videos or to import an existing YouTube playlist? 

  • Have you ever managed to remember where you left off yesterday with your video course? We have lost count of how many time we have skipped videos or watched a video repeatedly. This is particularly a problem when you watch multiple courses simultaneously.

  • Wouldn’t it be great if you could create your own knowledge base from all the video courses you watched and all the notes and screenshots you took making any information easily retrievable in a structured context?

What MoocPlayer Offers


MoocPlayer is a publisher independent video player that offers a quick and easy solution to all of the problems listed above.

  • MoocPlayer makes note taking a seamless experience. The video automatically pauses and starts again when you start typing or press Enter.

  • You can take notes directly in the application and all notes are linked to the specific video frame where the video was paused. Going back to re-watch the video segment is extremely easy, just click on the note inside the program.

  • With seamless note taking there are no lost seconds and so you will not miss out on any important piece of information.

  • Every time you add a note, a screenshot is attached automatically.

  • With just one click a summary of your notes will be generated. You will get a simple structured overview of the notes you took, a summary of your comments, keyboard shortcuts, resources, and questions.

  • MoocPlayer generates a playlist that keeps the chapter structure of the video training course intact, videos will always be in the right order. MoocPlayer also keeps track of your progress, displaying where you are in the given chapter and also the entire video course.

  • Adding YouTube videos to your playlist is simple in MoocPlayer, in fact, whole YouTube playlists can be added with just a few clicks.

  • MoocPlayer automatically remembers where you left each of your video training courses.

  • The exported training related notes and screenshots are organized into a structured knowledge base you can always come back to.

Our Progress


Since last fall our team has been working tirelessly to design the system architecture and to develop a working prototype of MoocPlayer. We have made significant progress and the first alfa version is already running on our machines. However there are a lot of things to do before we can publish the final product. We still need to improve usability, add features, fix bugs and package it in a way that we have a simple downloadable and installable product. There is a lot to do and we can’t do it alone.

Roadmap


Prototype

Here are some screenshots of the actual prototype of MoocPlayer:


What We Need

The total development costs of MoocPlayer are far higher than the requested amount. Until now we have financed the project from our own savings but our resources have been exhausted. We are very enthusiastic and we believe that MoocPlayer will be a game changer in how we learn from video trainings, but we need your support in realizing our dream.  

The biggest part of the requested funds will be spent on further development and testing. We would also like to integrate some state of art 3rd party component into our software and for this we will have to purchase their licenses. Finally, we need some money for design and marketing purposes as well.



The Team

We are a handful of IT guys with many years of experience under our belts and an ongoing passion for innovation. We have worked for companies like Verizon, T-Mobile, Siemens, HBO, McDonald’s, Hertz to name a few. We also have a design expert on our team to make sure things look great.


Help the World Get the Most Out of Video Courses

In the beginning we just wanted to make learning from video trainings a better experience for ourselves, but along the way, we realized that millions of people have the same problems as we do. It dawned on us that MoocPlayer could actually be the solution the world has been waiting for…. well the part of the world that watches video courses anyway. We have great ambitions and the knowledge to develop a truly exceptional video player optimized for video courses but we will need your help.

We will be more than grateful if you can make a financial contribution to our efforts but getting the word out about MoocPayer or sending us feedback also goes a long way. With your help MoocPlayer can become a reality.

issues that kept coming up in conversations was how tedious it was to take
notes and synchronize the notes with the videos. Without a link between videos
and notes going back to double check some information was tedious and impractical.
After a while we actually gave up trying. However, this hindered the learning
process and we realized we have to find a better solution. The idea of a video
player that was optimized for learning from video courses was born about a year
ago and slowly our concepts started to take form. We drew not only from our
experiences but talked to many other people and finally we put together a list
with most prevalent problems and recommendations for their solutions. These
solutions form the core functionality of the MoocPlayer software.
The Problem with Video Players

Existing
video players are designed for watching movies and TV shows and listening to
music. In these cases having to pause and start the video multiple times is a
rare occurrence. When learning from video trainings you will have to stop the
video several times to memorize some  piece of information, try out some solution
recommended in the video or take some notes. Having to continuously push pause
and play become tedious very fast.
It’s
often difficult to decide where to store your notes. You can write notes on
paper, in a document on your computer or you can use some online note taking
solution. In none of these cases will the notes be linked with the specific
video they relate to and especially not to the place in the video from where
the information originated. This makes rechecking information extremely inconvenient
especially if you watched hundreds of training videos.
Typically
video training courses contain very dense educational material. The seconds you
lose pressing pause and play or when you simultaneously try listening and
taking notes can easily translate into missed information.
A
picture is worth a thousand words. Sometimes saving a screenshot of the video
frame is an incredibly useful way of capturing information. Normally each
screenshot requires several additional steps and organizing them in any
meaningful way is a cause for headache.
Wouldn’t
you like a clearly structured, standardized summary of your notes?  A summary where the different types of
information in your notes are aggregated. Wouldn’t it be great for example if
you had a collection of all Photoshop keyboard shortcuts you learned about?
Video
training courses typically contain a large number of video files organized into
chapters. Making a playlist that takes into consideration the chapter structure
is not supported by popular video players. All the videos will be dumped into
one simple list. This presents an especially frustrating problem when videos
are numbered similarly in every chapter and thus the order is messed up.
There
is an abundance of amazing training videos and tutorials on YouTube. Wouldn’t
it be great to create a playlist in your video player from YouTube videos or to
import an existing YouTube playlist? 
Have
you ever managed to remember where you left off yesterday with your video
course? We have lost count of how many time we have skipped videos or watched a
video repeatedly. This is particularly a problem when you watch multiple
courses simultaneously.
Wouldn’t
it be great if you could create your own knowledge base from all the video
courses you watched and all the notes and screenshots you took making any
information easily retrievable in a structured context?

What MoocPlayer Offers
MoocPlayer is a publisher independent video player that offers a quick and
easy solution to all of the problems listed above. 

MoocPlayer makes note taking a seamless experience. The
video automatically pauses and starts again when you start typing or press
Enter.
You can take notes directly in the application and all
notes are linked to the specific video frame where the video was paused. Going
back to re-watch the video segment is extremely easy, just click on the note
inside the program.
With seamless note
taking there are no lost seconds and so you will not miss out on any important
piece of information.
Every time you add a note, a screenshot is attached
automatically.
With just one click a summary of your notes will be
generated. You will get a simple structured overview of the notes you took, a
summary of your comments, keyboard shortcuts, resources, and questions.
MoocPlayer generates a playlist that keeps the chapter
structure of the video training course intact, videos will always be in the
right order. MoocPlayer also keeps track of your progress, displaying where you
are in the given chapter and also the entire video course.
Adding YouTube videos to your playlist is simple in
MoocPlayer, in fact, whole YouTube playlists can be added with just a few
clicks.
MoocPlayer automatically remembers where you left each
of your video training courses.
The exported training related notes and screenshots
are organized into a structured knowledge base you can always come back to.
Our ProgressSince last fall our team has been working tirelessly to design the system
architecture and to develop a working prototype of MoocPlayer. We have made
significant progress and the first alfa version is already running on our
machines. However there are a lot of things to do before we can
publish the final product. We still need to improve usability, add
features, fix bugs and package it in a way that we have a simple downloadable
and installable product. There is a lot to do and we can’t do it alone.RoadmapPrototypeHere are some screenshots of the actual prototype of MoocPlayer:



What We Need

The total development costs of MoocPlayer are far higher than the requested
amount. Until now we have financed the project from our own savings but our
resources have been exhausted. We are very enthusiastic and we believe that
MoocPlayer will be a game changer in how we learn from video trainings, but we
need your support in realizing our dream.  

The biggest part of the requested funds will be spent on further development
and testing. We would also like to integrate some state of art 3rd
party component into our software and for this we will have to purchase their licenses.
Finally, we need some money for design and marketing purposes as well.

The Team
We are a handful of IT guys with many years of experience under our belts
and an ongoing passion for innovation. We have worked for companies like Verizon,
T-Mobile, Siemens, HBO, McDonald’s, Hertz to name a few. We also have a design
expert on our team to make sure things look great.

Help the World Get the Most Out
of Video Courses
In the
beginning we just wanted to make learning from video trainings a better experience
for ourselves, but along the way, we realized that millions of people have the
same problems as we do. It dawned on us that MoocPlayer could actually be the solution
the world has been waiting for…. well the part of the world that watches video
courses anyway. We have great ambitions and the knowledge to develop a truly
exceptional video player optimized for video courses but we will need your help. We will be more than grateful if you can make a financial contribution to our
efforts but getting the word out about MoocPayer or sending us feedback also
goes a long way. With your help MoocPlayer can become a reality.

story:
Zleikha's Story


Zleikha M R Muhtaseb has been running a small kindergarten in the top floor of her own home called the Ibrahimi Kindergarten since the second intifada. At times, more than fifty children squeeze into two rooms to receive education from Zleikha and volunteers.

Many of the children who attend Ibrahimi Kindergarten are from poor families who cannot pay for their children's education which is fine with Zleikha but without the kindergarten that Zleikha runs it would be likely that these children would not receive any education.

The Ibrahimi Kindergarten receives no government or private funding and relies solely on individual donations.

Zleikha's home is situated between the old city and Shuhada street which is a closed militarized area where armed soldiers patrol the rooftops and violent settlers live in illegal settlements very close by.

This is a very negative and aggressive environment for any human being to live in, let alone for a child to be brought up in, so education and activities are vital for this area of the old city to keep minds away from the occupation even if it is for a short while.


Zleikha's Dream


"My dream is to have a big space in order to create a safe playing and learning area for all kids from the old city. My dream will come true through your support" ~ Zleikha 


Zleikha's dream is to provide the community with more space which would give up to one hundred and twenty children the opportunity to learn and play. 

The space required would also serve as a community center for women to teach and learn many subjects such as embroidery, lectures, recycling and gardening. The new community center would have even more rooms much bigger in size and a large playground on the roof for the children.

This spacious building is right next door to the small kindergarten that Zleikha is already running.


Zleikha "Opening a bigger community center and kindergarten would be a form of non violent resistance that would bring life to an occupied city which currently remains like a ghost town because of the Israeli army, settler presence and military closure orders"


How You Can Get Involved

Could you help empower Zleikha to provide a larger space for up to one hundred and twenty children to learn and play that would also serve as a community center for women?

Please join our campaign and contribute to help us raise the £18,000
needed to purchase a bigger property for a community center in the heart of an occupied city.

In solidarity you can also help us raise awareness and share this campaign with your friends, please share on Facebook, Twitter, email or even by talking to your friends and family.

If we all work together we can help to achieve Zleikha's dream providing children's education and women's classes for the residents of the old city in Hebron.  




About The Campaign Organizers


My name is Kajsa Anckarström. I have been working with Solidarity organizations in Occupied Palestine. Currently, I am based in Al-Khalil (Hebron) in the Occupied West Bank. I met Zleikha on my previous trip to Palestine this is how I got to know about the great work that Zleikha does for the community and children in the old city. Kajsa Anckarstrom, Zleikha M R Muhtaseb and my friend, Yahya Aitabi, who is also volunteering for a Solidarity organization will be working to raise funds for Zleikha campaign.

Here are other campaigns I have successfully fund raised for on Indiegogo:

https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/do-you-want-...

https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/help-um-sale...

https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/support-ghas...

story:
Short Summary

The Augusta Robotics Club is a recently formed organization with a focus on enhancing the STEM community in Augusta. We cater to beginners and experienced roboteers alike. Our passion lies with being able to provide a safe and fun way for anyone to learn more about robotics. 

Any contribution will be a massive help towards building the club's arena and allowing us to put on events for everyone.

 The arena is essential for the safety and well being of the club's members and audience. It will be hand built out of quarter inch Lexan and welded steel. A trailer allows for easy transportation to and from events. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise $3,000 to purchase building materials for the arena. Contributors will receive perks for contributing any amount of money from $5 and up. These perks are:

  • $5- Augusta Robotics Club Sticker
  • $35- Augusta Robotics Club T-Shirt
  • $50- A customizable 3D printed nameplate from the Augusta Robotics Club
  • $125- Your name or your company's name on the Augusta Robotics Club T-Shirt AND everything up to $125 (Sticker, T-Shirt and 3D printed nameplate)
  • $200- A plaque with your name or your company's name on the arena AND everything up to $200
  • $500- An entire corner of the arena featuring your name or company's name and logo, in addition to recognition on the Augusta Robotics Club website AND everything up to $500
  • $1000- An event hosted in your family's name or your company's name AND everything up to $1000

The Impact

On a local scale, contributing to this campaign means growing the STEM community in Augusta and giving a unique educational opportunity to members of the club. In a larger perspective, the Augusta Robotics Club is creating individuals well equipped with the knowledge and skills needed to thrive in the modern world. Members of the club learn valuable lessons in technology that they may not have access to elsewhere. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand if you are unable to contribute to our campaign, but there are other ways you can help! 

  • You can help spread the word in person and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Sharing the campaign online using social media also helps immensely!

story:
Support tomorrow's African women today! 

After more than 15 years of working in Africa, the one thing that strikes me is that educating girls magnifies their life options.  So when I was asked to be part of the Advisory Committee for WESA, I was thrilled to see that they had a scholarship for girls to attend secondary school.

This campaign ensures that bright young women get a chance to attend a prestigious school that will lay a strong foundation for entry into well respected universities.  And now is your chance to get involved. 
The current recipient, Revai, in her last two years of high school, dreams of becoming  a veterinarian.  Your contribution to this scholarship paves the way for her to achieve this. We are looking for $6000 to continue support for her school fees this year. 
Check out the girl effect video on youtube. Educating girls gives them confidence, skills, knowledge and support they need to succeed in life and opens the door for future generations to thrive. As I write this, I am seeing this happen with Revai.  Already she has grown in confidence at her new school, willing to explore new ideas, and challenging herself by taking up different subjects. Revai is breaking the mould and helping to redefine gender norms.  This is not a 'given' in Africa where typically young African women are not given opportunities to explore different career paths. 
But of course, a talented girl needs a supportive environment to break that mould.   Hellenic International Academy, which accepted her application, is fostering that environment with  solid science programme that strongly supports  women in the sciences.  
What makes this programme unique is that WESA has matched a bright young woman with a supportive academic environment.  
Change happens by stepping up and getting involved. Now it is your turn.

story:
Pupils at Suye School, Arusha, Tanzania, will get clean, plentiful drinking water for the first time ever, thanks to building work about to be undertaken by 16-year-old Dom B Coll and his classmates from Ashton Park School in Bristol, UK.

They are spending three weeks in Tanzania, and each of them is having to fund-raise separately to pay for building materials, plus their travel and accommodation costs – an eye-watering £2,500 EACH!!!

It’s a chance for the Bristol students to do something genuinely worthwhile while getting a unique insight into the lives of young people in Africa.

Dom has already done a fair bit of fund-raising, including a benefit concert at the Thunderbolt, Bristol, and a table top sale at Totterdown Baptist Church. But he’s still a long way short of the total – hence this appeal.

The students will spend the greater part of their trip doing building work at Suye School, including the installation of a rainwater harvesting, storage and filtration system. They will then ‘relax’ by climbing to the top of Mount Kilimanjaro, Africa’s highest mountain!

All money donated to Dom’s fund will be used to help reach Dom’s personal IndieGoGo target of £1,000. In the unlikely event of a surplus, it will be put towards Ashton Park School’s fund for next year’s Africa trip.

Ashton Park School has a proud tradition of taking students to Africa to help build schools. They have built at least one school in Kenya completely from scratch. The projects are chosen after careful consultation with the communities involved.

story:
Short Summary

This Scholarship was created out of the need to assist young Balantas have access to education. In countries like Guinea-Bissau, most young people don't have access to education simply because their families are too poor and they can't afford it . The scholarship fund will enable us educate young , talented and deserving student that will be able to take the mantle of leadership in the future .

What We Need 

Our goal is to enable over 1000 young people get secondary education through our scholarship program in the next 5 years. We aim to provide comprehensive support for scholars in our program to enable them maximize their potentials and become changemakers in society.

The Impact

  • Young Balanta people will get an education.
  • The Balanta community will be strength and unified.
  • Youth and future leaders will be supported and empowered.
  • Families will be supported.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share our campaign on with your friends.
  • Like us on facebook

story:
Hello Contributor,

I teach at a low income (Title 1) school highly populated with English as a second language learners. We are struggling to progress with the newly required standards. I have been researching (through a technology grant) resources to advance the success of my students using iPads. My class is a 1-1 iPad class. I found several apps (listed below) that test and manage each student's progress toward standard mastery. This is computer generated and managed. This allows each student to work on missing skills while advancing at their best possible rate. In effect, this creates an individualized learning plan for each student while moving forward at a rate that responds to that particular student. Then, the parents and I get a report which allows me to focus that student on areas of need. Math, reading, science, social studies, and language arts issues are all tracked. Some of the apps allow for lesson creation and delivery along with other teacher created lessons addressing the standards. 

My students will be working in the environment that is required for current Common Core testing (SBAC). They are using the iPad to work out math problems, type answers for reading response questions or explanations for problem procedures and more. This will allow them to have the best preparation for testing. Typing issues or iPad responses through touch are constantly being addressed and improved.

My students have shown genuine improvement on standards using these apps to date. I am happy with the reports showing progress and areas of needed improvement for each student, and parents are pleased with current reporting on their students progress.

Teachers are currently struggling to account for the different standards due to limited access to appropriate materials and delineating different standards addressed in layered questions in current testing materials. These apps specify progress on all of the standards in great specificity.

The $1825 will cover the following apps and in app purchases needed to have a complete program addressing the required standards: ScootPad; NearPod; MobiMax; Edmodo; Time for Kids; Literability; Zaption; Splashmath; and Grammar App.

Thank you for your kind consideration and all that you do for education.
